loans.name: Najah

texts.en:
Najah is a 30-year-old married woman and mother of three children. She works hard to provide the best living for them. Najah opened her shop three years ago. She sells women, men and children's wear, in addition to the household appliances she introduced early to her clients. Najah is a hardworking woman who seeks perfection for her family. That’s why she helps her husband increase their income to provide healthy living for her family.

Najah is requesting a loan from Al Majmoua, in order to increase her shop’s capital for the Holy Ramadan month's Celebrations, since most of the kids celebrate the end of this month with fireworks, candies and a lot more ways, and she has to be ready with new clothes collection they have to wear. Najah is a woman with good reputation. She has good communication skills and customer care.

loans.use: To increase her inventory for the Holy Ramadan month's celebrations

loans.name: Asociacion Las Tres Estrellas Group

texts.es: Una alcancía con nuevos objetivos y nuevas metas, así se caracteriza L. alcancía comunal Asociación las Tres Estrellas integrada por 7 miembros hace más D. un año y medio. Cada integrante se identifica por L. fortaleza y el entusiasmo por salir siempre adelante una D. ellas es Anita  D. 33 años D. edad, sorprenD. con su actitud, es D. esas mujeres que te dan energía, es casada y tiene cuatro hijos. Una mujer  con oportunidades y habilidades distintas a las demás pero que en el correr del tiempo ha evidenciado que siempre se pueD.,  Comenzó su negocio hace diez años partiendo casi D. cero, vendiendo golosinas en una maleta, hoy en día tiene su local D. golosinas. Con L. ayuda D. su esposo, día a día trabajan  para salir adelante y darles una buena educación a sus pequeños hijos, también se dedican a L. ventas D. calzados, con el reciente prestamos piensan  en invertir en  mas calzados y golosinas.
texts.en: The 'Asociación las Tres Estrellas' community bank is a bank with new aims and new goals.  The group has seven members and has been in existence for more than one and a half years.  Each member of the group is noted for their strength and the enthusiasm that they have to keep forging ahead in life.  One of the members is 33 year-old Anita who has a surprising attituD..  She is one of these women who give you energy.  She is married and has four children.  She is a woman who has different opportunities and abilities from other people but, over time, she has shown that she is always able.  She started her business ten years ago, starting almost from scratch, selling candies out of a suitcase.  She now owns a candy store.  With the help of her husband, she works every day in order to get ahead in life and proviD. her young children with a good education.  She also sells footwear.  She plans to invest this new loan in buying more footwear and candy.

loans.use: to invest in buying footwear and candy

loans.name: Evalesthy Concepción

texts.es: "Dentro de 10 años me miro como una mujer independiente con una familia nueva, en formación, con una estabilidad económica que será gracias a mi profesión lo cual me permitirá poner mi propia clínica o hacer un proyecto donde se incluya la medicina oriental como parte del sistema terapéutico de algún centro hospitalario o de salud. Mi inspiración soy yo y mis futuros hijos, quisiera cambiar la realidad de la vida y las dificultades que tengo hoy, pero sabiendo siempre manejar mi prudencia".
texts.en: In 10 years I see myself as an independent woman, with young children in school, and with economic stability thanks to my profession.  I will be able to set up my own clinic to a project in which Eastern medicine is used a part of the therapeutic approach of a hospital health center.  I and my future children are my inspiration.  I would like to change the reality of my current life and the difficuties I face today, but in a prudent way.

loans.use: to pay monthly school payments and University tuition.

loans.name: Sara Maria

texts.es:
Sara madre soltera, mujer honesta, sus hijos mayores le ayudan económicamente.  Actualmente requiere seguir con el proyecto del mejoramiento de la infraestructura de su vivienda.  Desde hace un tiempo trabaja como conserje siendo un  trabajo de mucho esfuerzo. 
Durante este tiempo no se le ha presentado ninguna dificulta en ir realizando las mejoras ya que mediante el financiamiento lo ha logrado poco a poco. Con este préstamo que solicitad será invertido en la compra de materiales de construcción como: cemento, arena, piedras canteras, bloques, hierro, tablones de maderas, laminas de zinc, golosas, perlines, estribu entre otros materiales para construir el muro de la vivienda y el entechado de la casa, para que en estos tiempo de lluvia no se pase el agua a la casa. ofreciéndole mayor comodidad y protección a su familia.
texts.en:
Sara is a single mother and honest woman.  Her older children help her out financially.  She needs to continue improving the infrastructure of her home.  She has worked for a while as a janitor, which is a job that requires a lot of effort. 

So far she has not had any problems making improvements to her home because the loans have helped her to succeed bit by bit.  The loan she is requesting will be used to purchase construction supplies such as cement, sand, quarried rock, cement block, iron, wood boards, zinc panels, struts and supports, among other supplies.  She will use these to build the wall of her home and the roof, so that during the rainy season water does not get into her home, thus providing better comfort and protection to her family.

loans.use: to purchase construction supplies.

loans.name: Rabiia

texts.en: Rabiia is a 33-year-old single woman who has been working in women's beauty and care for 20 years. She was very young when she started this business, in order to help with her family’s income. She opened her one salon in 2007 to improve her living and to increase her capital. Rabiia is a hardworking woman who is preparing herself to get married soon. That’s why she requested a loan from Al Majmoua. She wants to increase her beauty creams capital and finish her wedding preparations. Rabiia has been an Al Majmoua borrower for three consecutive loans. All of them had an excellent effect on her social and financial situation and she is a good standing borrower. Rabiia hopes to stay up on her customers’ opinion and meet their needs.

loans.use: To purchase more beauty creams

loans.name: Bairon Angel

texts.es:
Bairon de oficio seguridad interna, casado, padre de familia de tres hijos, como objetivo ha sido la construccion de su casa, en donde poco a poco ha venido comprando materiales de construccion, con sus ahorros. Para el ha sido dificil, ya que se le habia complicado comenzar la obra por que le hacia falta materiales y para mano de obra.
Su gozo fue al tener un financiamiento en Afodenic, a plazos accesibles en donde logro un gran abance con su casa, al levantar el muro y parte del porche que continuara con este nuevo prestamo para seguir levantando paredes y techo, y cada dia, avanzar mas.logrando una vivienda digna y segura. En donde comprara materiales como: bloques, bolsa de cemento, arena, hierro y comenzar la construccion.
texts.en:
Bairon works a security guard.  He is married and has three children.  His goal is to build his home.  Little by little he has purchased construction supplies with his savings.  It has been difficult for him to get the project started because he didn't have enough supplies or money for labor.  

He was pleased to get a loan from Afodenic, with manageable payments, which enabled him to make great progress on his home, to build a wall and part of the porch.  He will continue building with this loan to put up walls and a roof, making progress each day towards a proper and safe home.  He will purchase supplies such as blocks, bags of cement, sand, and iron to start the work.

loans.use: to purchase construction supplies to continue buliding the porch and walls, those providing a better, safer home for his family.

loans.name: Mohamad

texts.en: Mohamad is a 26-year-old single man who has been working in car maintenance since 2009. He is a hard working man, liked by most of his clients. Mohamad is recommended by most of his clients and because of their interest in his work, he requested a loan from Al Majmoua, in order to update his machines by buying an air compressor that is necessary to do an important part of his business. Mohamad is planning to expand his garage and to attract new customers. He is a self-developing man who is motivated to improve and develop his social and financial situation.

loans.use: To buy an air compressor

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy merchandise

loans.name: Najah

texts.en:
Najah is a 62-year-old married woman who has been selling women's accessories and Brazilian gold since 2005. Najah is a mother of five children who helps to prepare them for marriage, one by one. Najah is a hardworking woman. She helps her husband with their big family’s income and covers most of their expenses. 

Najah is requesting a loan from Al Majmoua in order to increase her business capital and to help her son pay most of his wedding’s needs. Najah hopes to expand her business more and more to cover all of her children's needs in the future.

loans.use: To pay for her son's wedding expenses and increase her business capital

loans.name: Esprescion

texts.en:
Esprescion is 45 years old and married with six children. Among them, three are being sent to school. Someday, Esprescion hopes to fulfill the dreams of his children, which is to continue their education until they finish college. 

For this reason, Esprescion ventured into hog fattening and has been doing this business for two years already. He is asking for a loan amounting to PHP 15,000 to buy feed for the maintenance of his pigs. Fully-grown pigs are usually sold by Esprescion after four months of raising them patiently.

loans.use: to buy feed for his pigs.

loans.name: Jose Eduardo

texts.es: El señor José Eduardo es un hombre muy responsable y trabajador, desde hace 15 años el adquirió su vivienda de interés social que por lo regular en esta ciudad este tipo de viviendas son muy pequeñas. José preocupado por el bienestar y confort de la familia el desea construir un cuarto mas en la parte de enfrente para tener mas espacio. Para poder realizar su proyecto necesita capital para comprar lo necesario para comenzar su construcción.
texts.en: José Eduardo is a very responsible and hard-working man.  He acquired his home through a social housing project 15 years ago.  Usually in this city, this type of house is very small.  José is concerned for the well-being and comfort of his family and so would like to build an additional room round the front of his home so that his family can have more space.  In order to carry out his project, he needs capital to buy the supplies he needs to start the building work.

loans.use: to extend his home

loans.name: Marlene Esperanza

texts.es:
El Grupo De Crédito María Auxiliadora se reúne cada quince días  en La parroquia La Sequita de Montecristi, cantón conocido como la cuna  del viejo luchador Eloy Alfaro y por los famosos sombreros de paja toquilla que son apreciados dentro y fuera del país.

En este lugar conocimos a la señora Marlene, tiene 47 años de edad, está casada y de esta relación  tiene 4 hijos ya todos son  mayores de edad, pero uno de ellos aun vive en su casa. Su esposo se dedica a la albañilería.

Nuestra amiga tiene una mini farmacia en su casa, nos cuenta que vende toda clase de medicamentos. Además de esto ella también se  dedica a la cría de chanchos y pollos, para lo cual tiene un lugar adecuado para la cría de sus animalitos, nos cuenta que los cría por espacio de tres a cuatro meses  y luego los vende a comerciantes que llegan hasta su casa para luego llevarlos a los distintos mercados de la ciudad, lleva cinco meses con su farmacia y le está yendo muy bien y con la cría de animales más de 8 años.
 
Este crédito lo va a emplear en comprar medicinas para surtir su farmacia y alimento de animales. Lleva más de 15 años en el  Grupo De Crédito y le gustan los beneficios que recibe de la institución.
 
Sus sueños son que su farmacia crezca cada día más.
texts.en:
The Maria Auxiliadora community bank meets twice a month in Montecristi, an Ecuadorean town famous for being the birthpplace of El Viejo Luchador (The Old Fighter), Eloy Alfaro, and for the straw hats that are made here and so admired inside the country and out.  

We met Marlene, 47, at the bank.  She and her husband have 4 grown children, only one of whom still lives at home.  Her husband is a construction worker.  

Our friend, Marlene, operates a small pharmacy in her house where she sells all kinds of medications.  She also raises chickens and pigs and has a yard for keeping them.  She tells us that she keeps them for three or four months and then sells them to passing wholesalers who, in turn, sell them at different markets in the city.  She has operated the pharmacy for 5 months and is happy with her progress.  She has been raising animals for 8 years.  

Marlene will use this loan to buy medicines for her pharmacy and feed for her animal-sales business.  She has been a member of the community bank for more than 15 years and likes the advantages that being a member bring.

Her dream is to grow the pharmacy business.

loans.use: to buy merchandise for her pharmacy business and feed for her animal-sales business.

loans.name: Herminio

texts.en:
Herminio is a farmer working in the Philippines who earns an average of PHP 43,000 every harvest. He is already 57 years old and is married with three children. As head of the family, Herminio is trying his best to give his family a comfortable living.

He wanted to create a more productive farming business. Thus, he is asking for a loan of PHP 10,000 to buy a sufficient supply of seeds, fertilizers and insecticides for his farm to ensure a better yield. Herminio grows rice and has been doing this for 30 years now.

loans.use: to buy seeds, fertilizers and insecticides

loans.name: Mohamad

texts.en: Mohamad is a 38-year-old married man and father of three children who works hard in his grocery store and improves his wholesale trade to fulfill their needs. Mohamad is a hardworking man with a good reputation in his area. He struggles to improve his family's social and financial situation. Mohamad is requesting a loan from Al Majmoua to buy a Renault rapid car, necessary to transport merchandise requested in his store and to sell wholesale products. Mohamad is planning to open other branches in nearby villages, and he is hoping to expand his business more and more.

loans.use: To buy a Renault rapid car

loans.name: Margarita Del Rocío

texts.es:
El Grupo De Crédito María Auxiliadora se reúne cada quince días  en La parroquia La Sequita de Montecristi, cantón conocido como la cuna  del viejo luchador Eloy Alfaro. Y por los famosos sombreros de paja toquilla que son apreciados dentro y fuera del país.

Aquí conocimos a la señora Margarita tiene 30 años de edad, está casada, y fruto de esta relación tiene tres hijos de 5, 3 años y un bebé de 8 meses, el mayor de ellos este año empezó a estudiar el primer año de escuela. Su esposo trabaja en una fábrica de atún en Manta.
op>
Ella para ayudar a su esposo con los gastos del hogar se dedica a la venta de  ropa de todo tipo y bisutería, trabaja los viernes, sábados y domingos y su forma de venta es puerta a puerta. Además de esto también se está dedicando a la cría de pollos y chanchos, nos cuenta que lo hace en su casa y que le está dejando muy buenos ingresos, además como es en su casa está al tanto del cuidado de sus animalitos y tampoco descuida a sus hijos que están pequeños, ella entrega sus animalitos a comerciantes que llegan hasta su casa.
 
Este crédito lo va a emplear en comprar ropa, bisutería y alimento para los animales. Es socia del Grupo De Crédito hace ya 8 años y le gusta por la responsabilidad de sus compañeras. 

Su sueño es tener un bazar.
texts.en:
The Maria Auxiliadora community bank meets twice a month in Montecristi, an Ecuadorean town famous for being the birthplace of El Viejo Luchador (The Old Fighter), Eloy Alfaro, and for the straw hats that are made here and so admired inside the country and out.  

We met Margarita, 30, at the bank.  She and her husband have three children, 5-years, 3-years and 8-months old, respectively.  Her oldest child just started school.  Her husband works in a tuna processing plant in Manta.

In order to help her husband with household expenses, Margarita operates a business selling clothing and jewelry.  She works Thursdays, Saturdays and Sundays, going door to door in search of customers.  She earns extra money raising chickens and pigs, a business that she operates at her house.  The business makes good money and she's happy with it because she can work at home and take care of her young children at the same time.  She sells the animals to passing wholesalers.

Margarita will use this loan to buy merchandise for her retail business and feed for her animal-sales business.  She has been a member of the community bank for 8 years and likes it because the other members are responsible.  

She hopes one day to open a shop selling all kinds of merchandise.

loans.use: to buy merchandise for her retail business and feed for her animal-sales business.

loans.name: Walid

texts.en:
Walid is a 35-year-old married man and father of two lovely kids: Gabriel (a boy, 3 years old) and Ashley (a girl, 8 months old), who are his whole life, as he describes. Walid has been selling fuel since 1995. He's an expert in his field and well known in his region. To improve his living conditions, Walid introduces multiple things in his place such as car maintenance and cold beverages. That's why he requested a loan from Al Majmoua, Kiva's partner, in order to buy a special brakes maintenance machine, in addition to an ice cream machine, which will increase his income during customers' waiting time while their cars are being fixed.

This is his first experience with Al Majmoua and hopes it will be a good experience to repeat. He hopes to improve his fuel station by buying upgraded and modern machines, in addition to doing necessary construction and slight outside decoration that attracts more customers.

loans.use: To buy a special brakes maintenance machine

loans.name: Balvina

texts.es:
Balvina madre soltera, mujer emprendedora, trabajadora y honesta, todavía sus hijos está cursando la primaria, los planes a futuro que sus hijos sean profesionales. Tiene su propio negocio en el cual ella vende tortilla desde hace un tiempo. Inicio su negocio con fondos propios. A planes de corto plazo es aumentar sus ventas para generar ganancias.
Requiriendo el préstamo para invertirlo en la compra de materia prima como: maíz, leña, cal para nezquizar, carbón entre otros productos. Para la elaboración de tortillas. 
Agradece a la financiera por  el gran apoyo al desarrollo de su negocio y el mejoramiento al nivel de vida de su familia.
texts.en:
Balvina is a single mother.  She’s an enterprising, hard working and honest woman.  Her children are still going to elementary school but her plan for the future is that they become professionals.  She has had her own business selling tortillas for some time now.  She started it with funds of her own.  Her short term plan is to increase sales to generate profits.

She requires the loan to buy raw materials like: corn, firewood, lime powder and charcoal among other things to make tortillas.  She is grateful to the financial organization for the great support of her business’ development and to the improvement of her family’s standard of living.

loans.use: to buy raw materials to make tortillas.

loans.name: Benedicta Aurentina

texts.es:
El Grupo De Crédito María Auxiliadora se reúne cada quince días  en La parroquia La Sequita de Montecristi, cantón conocido como la cuna  del viejo luchador Eloy Alfaro. Y por los famosos sombreros de paja toquilla que son apreciados dentro y fuera del país.

En este lugar conocimos a la señora Benedicta, tiene 65 años de edad, mantiene una relación de unión libre y de esta relación  tiene 7 hijos todos mayores de edad e independientes. Su esposo no trabaja está enfermo el sufre de ataques epilépticos.

Nuestra amiga para ganarse el sustento diario de ella y su esposo se  dedica a la cría de chanchos y pollos, nos cuenta que compra estos animalitos cuando aun están pequeños, los pollos en una incubadora en Portoviejo y los chanchos en el mercado o a vecinos que los venden pequeños. A los chanchos los tiene por espacio de tres a cuatro meses hasta que tengan un peso adecuado y luego los vende a comerciantes que llegan hasta su casa y ellos los llevan a los distintos mercados de la ciudad a comercializar la carne.  A los pollos también los entrega a comerciantes  o si no los pela y los vende por libras a vecinos y tiendas de sus localidad.

Este crédito lo va a emplear en comprar pollos, alimentos y medicinas tanto para pollos y chanchos. Lleva en el  del Grupo De Crédito 10 años y  le gusta porque los intereses son más bajos que en otros lugares de crédito y por la ayuda que le dan en el grupo. 

Sus sueños son seguir adelante y tener salud.
texts.en:
The Maria Auxiliadora community bank meets twice a month in Montecristi, an Ecuadorean town famous for being the birthplace of El Viejo Luchador (The Old Fighter), Eloy Alfaro, and for the straw hats that are made here and so admired inside the country and out.  

We met Benedicta, 65, at the bank.  She and her partner have 7 children, all grown and independent.  He suffers from epilepsy and no longer works.  

To earn enough to support them both, Benedicta operates a business raising and selling chickens and pigs.  She tells us that she buys the animals when they are young, the chicks from a supplier in Portoviejo and the piglets from a local market or from neighbors.  She keeps the pigs for three or four months until they're ready for market.  She then sells them to a passing wholesaler who, in turn, sells them at markets in the city that specialize in meat sales.  She often sells the chickens to passing wholesalers, as well, but if not, she plucks them and sells them herself.

Benedicta will use this loan to buy chickens and the supplies she needs to care for her animals.  She has been a member of the community bank for 10 years and likes it because the interest rates are relatively low and because of the help that she receives from the group.

Her greatest hope is to keep going and stay healthy.

loans.use: Comprar pollos,alimento y medicinas para pollos y chanchos.

loans.name: Rebeca

texts.es:
Rebeca  es natural de Huancavelica, radica desde hace 10 años en la ciudad  de Huancayo con su esposo y su pequeño hijo en casa de sus suegros. Es docente de profesión y desempeña su trabajo como profesora a personas adultas, enseñándoles a leer y escribir. De manera paralela tiene otras actividades, principalmente la crianza de cuyes, y en la venta de gelatina, esta última lo ha dejado por motivos de salud. Desde hace 4 años se ha dedicado más a la crianza de cuyes, pues se ha convertido en un negocio muy rentable, ya que ella además venderlos vivos, también vende su carne a los carniceros de su comunidad. Considera que este negocio la ayuda en la economía de su hogar, además que le permite disponer de su propio tiempo. Es por esta razón que desea seguir trabajando con ese mismo empeño para crecer económicamente.Es la quinta oportunidad de trabajo que tiene con MFP, desde sus inicios en sus créditos siempre ha demostrado ser puntual en sus pagos, asimismo cada  monto de dinero que recibió a través de los créditos le han servido para mejorar y crecer un poco mas en sus negocios que hoy están mejor constituidos.
Con el dinero que solicita, lo invertirá en la compra de cuyes productores y mejorar la calidad genética de estos animales, a su vez desea comprar materiales de construcción para mejorar su granja.
texts.en:
Rebeca is a native of Huancavelica.  She has lived in the city of Huancayo for 10 years with her husband and small child in the house of her in-laws.  She is a teacher who works teaching adults how to read and write.  In addition she's been working raising guinea pigs and selling gelatin, but she has quit this last activity for health reasons.  She has been raising guinea pigs for 4 years, and this has become a very profitable business for her.  She sells them live and also sells their meat to the butchers in her community.  She feels that this business helps her financially to support her household, and it also allows her to have her own time.  For this reason, she wants to continue working with the same effort so she can have a better economic situation.  This is her 5th opportunity to work with MFP, and from the start she has always been punctual with her payments.  Each sum of money that she has received through these loans has served to improve and grow her business so it is now in better shape.  

With the money she requests, she will invest in the purchase of breeder guinea pigs to improve the genetic quality of her animals.  She will also buy construction materials to improve her farm.

loans.use: to buy more guinea pigs and construction materials for her farm

loans.name: Melva Lucelina

texts.es:
El Grupo De Crédito María Auxiliadora se reúne cada quince días  en La parroquia La Sequita de Montecristi, cantón conocido como la cuna  del viejo luchador Eloy Alfaro. Y por los famosos sombreros de paja toquilla que son apreciados dentro y fuera del país.

En este lugar conocimos a la señora Melva, tiene 51 años de edad, está casada y de esta buena relación tienen 6 hijos los mismos que  ya son mayores de edad, uno de ellos falleció hace varios años lo cual cuenta con profunda tristeza nuestra amiga, su hijo menor  aun vive con ella. Su esposo es electricista.

Nuestra amiga es una gran ama de casa que para tener sus ingresos y con estos ayudar a su esposo con los gastos del hogar hace varios años puso un negocio el cual lo mantiene  hasta la actualidad, ella tiene un depósito de gas en sus casa, allí trabaja todos los días desde que amanece hasta la noche ya que a cualquier hora a sus clientes se les termina el gas y acuden hasta su local y ella esta presta a atender estas emergencias, su hijo le ayuda en su negocio, ella va a comprar las bombonas de gas a la distribuidora general en Montecristi.
 
Este crédito lo va a utilizar en comprar gas líquido para el uso del hogar para la venta.   Ella es socia fundadora  del Grupo De Crédito y le gusta porque sus compañeras son muy unidas y responsables.
 
Sus metas son seguir adelante y gozar de buena salud.
texts.en:
The lending group Maria Auxiliadora meets every 15 days in the parish of La Sequita de Montecristi, an area known as the home of the ancient fighter Eloy Alfaro. It is also known for the famous straw hats that are recognized in and out of the country. 

Here we meet Melva, who is 51 years old, married and has 6 children who are all grown. One of her children passed away some years ago which left our friend with a deep sadness. Her youngest son still lives with her. Her husband is an electrician.

Our friend is a housewife who started a business some years ago in order to bring in some income of her own to help her husband with the family's expenses. The business, which is still going today, is a gas deposit in her home. She works there every day from dawn to dusk, since her customers may need her at whatever hour their gas runs out and they show up at her store. She is ready to assist them during these emergencies. Her son helps her with the business.  She goes to buy tanks of gas from the general distributor in Montecristi. 

The loan will be used to buy liquid gas for home use, which she will sell. She is a founding member of the lending group and she likes it because her partners are very united and responsible.

Her goals are to continue moving forward and to enjoy good health.

loans.use: to buy tanks of gas.

loans.name: Cristino

texts.es: El  señor  Cristino es una  persona  muy  trabajadora   que  se  esfuerza  día  con  día  para  salir  adelante,  el    junto  con su esposa  se  dedican  a  la  venta  de  leche   ya  que   poco   a poco  han ido  comprado  vacas y  actualmente  cuentan  ya  con  seis animales,  en esta  ocasión ellos   requieren de  nuestra  ayuda  porque  decean  realizar  la compra   de  una   vaca   para  de  esta  manera  obtener  mayores  ingresos  que  les  permitirán tener  una  mejor estabilidad  económica, agradece  el apoyo  brindado  para  la realización de  su  proyecto.
texts.en: Cristino is a hard working gentleman who puts forth great effort to get ahead every day.  He and his wife sell milk and have been buying cows little by little.  They now have six.  They need our help because they want to buy another cow so that they can increase their income, allowing them to have greater economic stability.  [Cristino] appreciates the support he has gotten toward completing this project.

loans.use: to buy a cow

loans.name: Mauro

texts.en:
Mauro is married with 10 children. Three of his children are being sent to school. He is a farmer working in the Philippines who is engaged in a hog fattening business.  He has been doing this work for over a year.

Mauro is asking for a loan to buy feed to maintain his raised pigs. Mauro knows that this loan will grow his business more. He earns PHP 13,000 after every four months in this field of work. 

His biggest dream in life is to have a child who has finished college and eventually is employed in their profession.

loans.use: to buy feed for his pigs

loans.name: Houssam

texts.en:
Houssam is a 34-year-old married man, the father of two children. He works in providing entertainment for teenagers, children and adults. He opened his entertainment games shop in April 2010, and it's all because he felt that it's the only safe place to gather such customers away from bad habits.

Houssam is a father and he cares a lot about the future of his children. That's why he works hard to improve his business through increasing his income to cover all their expenses and needs. He requested a loan from Al Majmoua in order to buy three X-Boxes and three TVs which will help in increasing his income and improving his social and financial situation.

This is Houssam's seventh loan cycle with Al Majmoua. All his previous loans have helped a lot in adding machines to his business and expanding it; at the same time he is a borrower in good standing.

He hopes to continue expanding his business, and hopes to open other branches in the future.

loans.use: To buy new X-Boxes and TVs

loans.name: Lelia Orfelia

texts.es:
El Grupo De Crédito María Auxiliadora se reúne cada quince días  en La parroquia La Sequita de Montecristi, cantón conocido como la cuna  del viejo luchador Eloy Alfaro. Y por los famosos sombreros de paja toquilla que son apreciados dentro y fuera del país.

Aquí conocimos a la señora Lelia tiene 72 años  de edad, está separada hace varios años pero de esta relación tuvo 7 hijos los mismos que ya son mayores de edad y que ya son independientes. Esta desde el inicio en el Grupo de Crédito y le gusta porque sus compañeras son como su familia ya que siempre están allí cuando las necesita.

Ella para poder subsistir y tener para sus gastos  hace varios años puso un pequeño bar en su casa en el cual  vende aguas, sodas, energizantes, hielo, cervezas, entre otras bebidas, ella aprovecha que frente a su casa se reúnen todos los días personas que llegan a hacer deporte pues allí hay unas canchas de fooball y de voleibol, nos cuenta que esto lo hacen todos los días por las tardes, además también ella prepara deliciosos helados de frutas, nos cuenta que lleva haciendo esto por más de diez años y que gracias a Dios esto le ha servido para sus gastos ya que es una persona que vive sola.

Este crédito es para comprar sodas, aguas, cervezas, hielo, entre otras cosas.
 
Sus sueños son seguir adelante en su negocio y que esto le de lo necesario para sus gastos.
texts.en:
The loan group called “María Auxiliadora” meets every two weeks in the “La Squita” parish of Montecristi, a settlement known as the crib of the old wrestler, Eloy Alfaro.  It’s also known for its straw hats that are appreciated within and outside the country.

Here we meet Lelia.  She is 72 years old and has been separated for various years, but she has seven children, all adults and on their own now.  She’s been with the group since the beginning and she enjoys it because her fellow members are like her family and are there for her when she needs them.

A few years ago she opened a small pub in her home so that she could make money to pay her expenses.  She sells water, soda, energy drinks, ice, and beer, among other drinks.  She takes advantage of the fact that people meet each day across the street to play sports, where there are soccer fields and volleyball courts.  She tells us that they do this every evening.  She also makes delicious frozen treats.  She tells us that she’s been doing this for more than ten years and thanks to God this has helped her with her expenses because she lives alone.

She will use the money from this loan to buy sodas, water, and ice among other things.  She wants to continue ahead with her business and hopes that it will continue to provide for her expenses.

loans.use: to stock her pub.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to hire field hands.

loans.name: Nida

texts.en: Nida is a 50-year-old widowed woman who is residing in Oroquieta City, Misamis Occidental, Philippines. She has four grown children. She has a small food stall at home selling viands and the like as the family's source of living. She has enjoyed doing it for three years already and reaped a monthly income of PHP 5,600. Nida has applied for a loan of PHP 4,000 at GDMPC to purchase required food supplies for making viands and the like. She has been a member of GDMPC for one year.  She aims to expand the business and improve her financial stability.

loans.use: to purchase food supplies to make viands

loans.name: Aminata

texts.en:
Aminata, aged 27, is married to a trader, and has three children aged one month, five and nine years. In 2001, Aminata established her business selling used clothing for children and ladies. She started working in this business when she got married, as she was helping her husband in his business but now she has her own. Working six days a week and seven hours a day, she earns about SLL 800,000 every month from this business.

She would like a loan of SLL 4,000,000.  Aminata has already received and successfully repaid one loan, and now requires a new loan in order to buy four bales of children's dresses and one bale of ladies' dresses.  She hopes that this loan will enable her to increase her monthly profits by approximately SLL 250,000. 

In the future, Aminata plans to expand her business and open another outlet.  She wants to see her children progress through school if only she can access more loans.  She knows that she will realize more profit that will lead her to achieve her aims. Aminata plans to be a supplier of bales of used clothing in Makeni City. She serves a reasonable amount of people each day. Aminata intends to save some money and plough back some into her business from the proceeds of this loan. She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: To pay for bales of assorted used clothing including four bales of children's dresses and one bale of ladies' dresses .

loans.name: Luciana

texts.en: Luciana is a 51-year-old woman, married and residing in Clarin, Misamis Occidental, Philippines. She has one grown child. She has a corn plantation that supports the family living. She earns a total of PHP 2,000 from this activity. Because of a lack of funds, Luciana has applied a loan of PHP 5,000 at GDMPC to purchase fertilizers for her corn plantation. She has been a member of GDMPC for almost one year. She hopes for a good harvest and plans to extend the farm to gain more income.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers

loans.name: Santa Nicolasa

texts.es:
El Grupo De Crédito María Auxiliadora se reúne cada quince días  en La parroquia La Sequita de Montecristi, cantón conocido como la cuna  del viejo luchador Eloy Alfaro. Y por los famosos sombreros de paja toquilla que son apreciados dentro y fuera del país.

La señora Santa es socia fundadora del Banco comunal y le gusta porque todas sus compañeras son muy responsables y cumplidas. Tiene 62 años de edad y mantiene una relación de unión libre de la cual tiene cinco hijos todos mayores de edad e independientes. El esposo es sastre pero casi no trabaja ya que quedo discapacitado.
 
Nuestra amiga para ganarse el sustento diario de ella y su esposo se  dedica a la cría de chanchos y pollos, ella compra estos animalitos cuando aun están pequeños, luego los tiene por espacio de tres a cuatro meses hasta que tengan un peso adecuado para después venderlos a comerciantes que llegan hasta su casa, los mismos que los trasladan hasta los centros de faenamiento o a los distintos mercados de la ciudad y comercializar la carne en estos lugares. Su esposo le ayuda cuando puede en la alimentación y cuidado de los animales.

Este crédito lo va a emplear en comprar alimentos y medicinas para pollos y chanchos.
 
Sus sueños son tener salud ella y su familia para continuar adelante.
texts.en:
The María Auxiliadora communal bank meets every fifteen days in the parish of La Sequita de Montecristi. The canton where it is located is known as the birthplace of the historic fighter Eloy Alfaro. It is also known for the famous hats woven from paja toquilla fibers ["Panama" hats], which are prized inside and outside the country.

Santa is a founding member of her communal bank, and she likes it because all of her fellow members are very responsible and dependable. She is 62 years old and has a common-law husband, with whom she has five children, all grown and independent. Her husband is a tailor, but he is hardly working anymore because he became disabled. 

To earn her daily sustenance and that of her husband, this friendly woman works raising pigs and chickens. She buys the animals when they are very small, and she keeps them for a period of three to four months until they reach an appropriate weight to be sold to commercial dealers who come to her home. The dealers take them to slaughterhouses or to the various markets of the city and sell the meat in those places. Her husband helps her when he can with the feeding and care of the animals. 

She will use this loan to buy feed and medicines for chickens and pigs. 
 
Her dreams are that she and her family will maintain good health so they can keep making progress.

loans.use: to buy feed and medicines for chickens and pigs.

loans.name: Cecilia

texts.es:
La señora Cecilia es una mujer muy trabajadora y emprendedora, para recibir un ingreso extra hace 6 años coloco una papelería en su casa que se encuentra en una de las calles mas transitadas, el negocio se le denomino “Papelería UPS2" en el que ofrece variedad de artículos escolares como lo es lápices, plumas, sacapuntas, cuadernos, mochilas y más. El préstamo que solicita es para estar preparada para la entrada del nuevo ciclo escolar donde le pedirán las listas de las escuelas como lo es de kínder, primaria y secundaria así de esta manera obtendrá mayores ganancias. 

Cecilia también trabaja de secretaria en el Gobierno para poder sostener los gastos del hogar.
texts.en:
Cecilia is a hardworking and enterprising woman. In order to have an income, six years ago she started a stationary store in her house which is located on one of the busiest streets in town. The business is called "Papeleria UPS2" and offers a variety of school supplies like pencils, pens, hole-punchers, notebooks, backpacks and more. The requested loan is to stock her store to be prepared for the new school year when they will have lists of supplies needed for kindergarten, primary school and high school. This way she will make more money. 

Cecilia also works as a secretary for the government to cover the costs of her home.

loans.use: to buy merchandise such as notebooks, pens, crayons, pencils, and paper.

loans.name: Cheryl

texts.en: Cheryl is a 34-year-old woman, married and residing in Clarin, Misamis Occidental, Philippines. She has four school-aged children. She is raising goats and selling them to earn a living. She has been doing this for 10 years. She earns PHP 3,000 a month from selling the grown goats. Cheryl has requested a loan of PHP 5,000 at GDMPC to purchase additional goats to raise and be sold when grown. She has been connected to GDMPC for one year. She hopes to raise more goats in the future and earn adequate income so she can start her house renovation plan.

loans.use: To purchase additional goats to raise.

loans.name: Maria Anita

texts.es: María Anita y su esposo cuenta con el negocio de la venta de blocks desde hace 2 años, esta es su fuente de ingresos que recibe la pareja, entre los dos preparan la mezcla para hacer los blocks para introducir en una maquina que los forma y se dejan al sol para que se sequen. María Anita desea comprar materia prima de buena calidad para que su producto este mejor reforzado de esta manera sus clientes los recomienden y asi tener mas ventas.
texts.en: Maria Anita and her husband have been in the business of selling cinder-blocks for two years. This is the couple's source of income. Between the two of them they prepare the mix to make the blocks and then put that in a machine that forms them, then they leave them in the sun to dry. Maria Anita wants to buy good quality raw materials so that her product is stronger. This way their customers will recommend them and they will have more sales.

loans.use: to buy raw materials.

loans.name: Letty Diana

texts.es:
El Grupo De Crédito María Auxiliadora se reúne en La parroquia La Sequita que  pertenece al cantón Montecristi prospero cantón manabita, conocido como la cuna  del viejo luchador Eloy Alfaro y por los famosos sombreros de paja toquilla que son apreciados dentro y fuera del país.

En este jugar conocimos a la señora Letty, ella tiene 42 años de edad,  está casada y de esta relación ha tenido cuatro hijos todos mayores de edad, dos de ellos están solteros y aun viven con ella, con nuestra amiga también vive una pequeña nieta de dos años la misma que la tiene desde que nació y es una hija mas para ella y su ilusión de vivir. Su esposo es albañil.

Para colaborar con los gastos del hogar ella se dedica a la venta de sabanas y edredones así como también a la cría de pollos para lo cual  tiene una pequeña granja, trabaja todos los días en el cuidado y alimentación de sus pollos mientras que sus ventas las realiza puerta a puerta por las tardes y los fines de semana, ella deja a crédito las sabanas y cobra todos los sábados. Compra las sabanas en Picoaza, en cuanto a los pollos los compra en una incubadora y después de tres meses los entrega a comerciantes que llegan hasta su casa para llevarlos a los mercados de Manta y Portoviejo.

Este crédito lo va a utilizar en comprar sabanas y alimento para los pollos. Está en el Grupo De Crédito hace seis años y le gusta por la ayuda que le han dado con los créditos.
  
Su sueño es terminar de arreglar su casa.
texts.en:
The María Auxiliadora communal bank meets in the parish of La Sequita, which belongs to the canton of Montecristi. This prosperous canton of Manabi province is known as the birthplace of the historic fighter Eloy Alfaro and also known for the famous hats woven from paja toquilla fiber ["Panama" hats] which are prized within the country and abroad.

In this place, we meet Letty, who is 42 years old. She is married, and from this relationship she has had four children, all of them now grown. Two of the children are single and still live with her. A small granddaughter, two years old, also lives with Letty. The girl has been with her since she was born, and she is like another daughter to Letty and the joy of her life. Her husband is a mason. 

To contribute to the household expenses, Letty works selling sheets and comforters, and she also raises chickens, for which purpose she has a small farmyard. She works every day feeding and caring for her chickens, and in her sales business she goes door to door during the evenings and weekends. She sells the sheets on credit and collects payments every Saturday. She buys the sheets in Picoaza, and in the case of the chickens, she buys them from an incubator, and after three months she sells them to dealers who come to her house to take them to the markets of Manta and Portoviejo.

She will use this loan to buy sheets as well as feed for her chickens. She has been in the communal bank for six years, and she likes it because of the help given to her through the loans.
  
Her dream is to finish fixing up her house.

loans.use: to buy sheets to sell as well as feed for her chickens.

loans.name: Sullay

texts.en:
Sullay, aged 34, is married, and has two children aged one and four. In 2007, Sullay established his motor spare parts business which includes tyres, brake pads, fan belts, batteries, windscreens, inner tubes, motor oil, etc. He began doing business when he was a small boy for his mother. When he became mature, he started his own business. 

Sullay has a special interest in business because the income he gets from this business is used to provide his family's livelihood.  It is from his business proceeds that he has bought a car and two pieces of land. Working six days a week and 10 hours a day, he earns about SLL 1,000,000 every month from this business. 

He would like a loan of SLL 3,000,000. Sullay requires a loan in order to buy 10 lift pumps, 50 oil filters, 50 universal joints and 10 brake kits. He hopes that this loan will enable him to increase his monthly profits by approximately SLL 300,000. 

In the future, Sullay plans to construct a house on his land from the proceeds of the business. By adding to his present capital, he will be able to maximize profits and send his first child to a nursery school in this coming academic year.  Increase in the cost of stock is affecting his business and competition is also high but he offers quality products so he gains more customers.  

Sullay serves all the vehicle owners and drivers of this community.  He travels twice per month to Guinea to purchase reasonable and quality goods. He thanks you for your support.

loans.use: To pay for motor spare parts including lift pumps, oil filters, universal joints and brake kits

loans.name: Ketty Jessenia

texts.es:
El Grupo De Crédito María Auxiliadora se reúne en La parroquia La Sequita que  pertenece al cantón Montecristi prospero cantón manabita, conocido como la cuna  del viejo luchador Eloy Alfaro y por los famosos sombreros de paja toquilla que son apreciados dentro y fuera del país.

En este lugar conocimos a la señora Ketty, tiene 27 años de edad, está casada y de esta relación tienen tres hijos de  7, 6 y 5 años de edad los mismos estudian en escuela. Su esposo es albañil.

Nuestra amiga trabaja en una fábrica de atún en la ciudad de Manta pero además de eso también se dedica a la venta de ropa de todo tipo las mismas que hace en sus ratos libres y fines de semana, nos cuenta que la mayor parte de su mercadería la vende por pedidos que le realizan los clientes con anticipación, ella deja a crédito sus productos y cobra en tres pagos. Dicha mercadería la compara cada vez que necesita en Portoviejo. Nos cuenta que este negocio lo empezó cuando estaba desocupada y que lo financio con el primer crédito que recibió del grupo.

Este crédito lo va a utilizar en comprar pantalones, blusas, camisetas y ropa de niños. Está en el Grupo De Crédito hace cinco ciclos y le gusta porque con los créditos emprendió su negocio.
  
Su sueño es algún día tener una boutique en Manta.
texts.en:
The “María Auxiliadora” communal bank meets in the La Sequita parish, which belongs to the Montecristi cantón, which is a prosperous cantón of Manabí. It is known as the birthplace of the “Old Fighter”, Eloy Alfaro. It is also famous for the straw hats that are well-known in and outside of the country. 

This is where we meet Ketty, who is 27 years old, married, and has three children who are 7, 6, and 5 years old. They are all studying in school. Her husband is a mason.

Our friend works in a tuna processing plant in the city of Manta, but in addition to this she also sells clothing of all kinds, which she does during her free time and on the weekends. She tells us that she sells the majority of her merchandise through orders that customers make ahead of time. She sells her products on credit and charges in three installments. She buys her merchandise each time she needs to in Portoviejo. She tells us that she started this business when she was out of work and that she financed it with the first loan she received from the group.

She will use this loan to buy pants, blouses, t-shirts, and children’s clothes. She has been in the community bank for five loan cycles and she likes it because the loans got her business going. Her dream is to one day have a boutique in Manta.

loans.use: to buy pants, blouses, t-shirts, and children's clothes.

loans.name: Windel

texts.en: Windel is a 33-year-old woman, married and living in Clarin, Misamis Occidental, Philippines. She has four school-aged children with her. She has been growing corn for 10 years as her means of survival. She generates a total of PHP 3,000 a month. Windel has requested a loan of PHP 5,000 from GDMPC to purchase corn fertilizers and pay for planting costs. She has been a member of GDMPC for almost a year. Windel hopes to own a motorcycle in the future to easily transmit the goods to buyers to earn more income.

loans.use: to purchase corn fertlizer and pay for planting costs

loans.name: Rosa Endrina

texts.es:
El Grupo De Crédito María Auxiliadora se reúne en La parroquia La Sequita que  pertenece al cantón Montecristi prospero cantón manabita, conocido como la cuna  del viejo luchador Eloy Alfaro y por los famosos sombreros de paja toquilla que son apreciados dentro y fuera del país.

En este lugar vive la señora Rosa, tiene 57 años de edad, está casada y de esta relación  tiene 11 hijos, 10 de ellos ya mayores de edad, la menor de ellos tiene 17 años y estudia en colegio, 4 de sus hijos aun viven en su casa. Su esposo es comerciante.

Ella es una gran mujer que para ayudar a su marido realiza los créditos para que este lo invierta en su negocio, el se dedica a la venta de pescado para lo cual recorre en un triciclo las calles en la ciudad de Manta con la finalidad de vender mejor sus productos. él trabaja todos los días y sale desde la madrugada a las playas de Manta para tener el mejor pescado para sus clientes. Lleva más de 30 años que se dedica a esta actividad y gracias a Dios siempre le ha ido bien.
 
Este crédito lo va a utilizar en comprar pescado para la venta. Está en el Grupo De Crédito hace diez años y le gusta por las facilidades de pagos. 

Sus sueños son comprar un carro para que su esposo se traslade con más facilidad.
texts.en:
The María Auxiliadora (Mary Help of Christians) Loan Group meets in La Sequita parish, which belongs to Montecristi Canton, a flourishing canton in Manabi, known as the birthplace of the Viejo Luchador ("Old Fighter" and a former president of Ecuador) Eloy Alfaro, and known for its famous Panama hats, which are known in and outside of the country.

Rosa lives here. She is 57 years old, married, and has 11 children, 10 of them now grown. The youngest is 17 and goes to high school, and four of her children still live at home. Her husband is a businessman.

She is a great lady who helps her husband by getting loans for him to invest in his business. He sells fish, and to do this he rides a three-wheeled bike through the streets of Manta with the goal of selling his products. Our friend Rosa tells us that he works everyday, and that he goes out to Manta's beaches at dawn to have the best fish for his customers. He has been doing this work for more than 30 years, and thanks to God it has always gone well for him.

He will use this loan to buy fish to sell. Rosa has been in the Loan Group for ten years, and she likes it because of the easy payments. 

Her dream is to buy a car so her husband can travel more easily.

loans.use: to buy fish.

loans.name: Gina

texts.en: Gina is a 38-year-old woman, married and living in Clarin Misamis Occidental, Philippines. She has four school-aged children. She has been growing corn for 20 years to earn a living. Every month, she earns PHP 3,000 by doing this activity. Gina has applied for a loan of PHP 5,000 at GDMPC to purchase corn fertilizers and pay for the labor cost. She has been a member of GDMPC for almost a year. Gina plans to expand the farming area and start saving for future expenses.

loans.use: to purchase corn fertilizer and pay for labor costs

loans.name: Rosalinda

texts.en: Rosalinda is a 32-year-old widowed woman who settled down in Clarin, Misamis Occidental, Philippines.  She only has one child to care for. She has been engaged in a manicure servicing activity for three years to earn a living. She earns a monthly income of approximately PHP 3,000 from this job. Rosalinda has applied for a loan of PHP 5,000 at GDMPC to purchase a new manicure set for the service-based activity. She hopes to have more customers, gain more income and apply for insurance for the family in the near future.

loans.use: to purchase a new manicure set

loans.name: María Dayce

texts.es:
El Grupo De Crédito María Auxiliadora se reúne en La parroquia La Sequita que  pertenece al cantón Montecristi prospero cantón manabita, conocido como la cuna  del viejo luchador Eloy Alfaro y por los famosos sombreros de paja toquilla que son apreciados dentro y fuera del país.

En este lugar vive la señora Dayce, tiene 51 años de edad, y mantiene una relación de unión libre de la cual tiene cinco hijos todos mayores de edad, el menor de ellos que es soltero aun vive con ella. El esposo es comerciante.

Ella es una muy buena ama de casa y esposa que realiza el crédito para ayudar a su esposo en su negocio, el se dedica a la venta de frutas, legumbres y verduras, su esposo se desplaza de madrugada a comprar verduras y frutas en los campos cercanos y algunos otros productos en el mercado de mayoristas en Portoviejo para luego recorrer sus productos en su carro por toda la ciudad de Manta,  esto lo realiza cinco días a la semanas y viene realizando esta actividad por más de 20 años.

Este crédito lo va a emplear en comprar frutas, verduras y legumbres. Lleva más de 10 años en el Grupo De Crédito y le gusta porque a través de los créditos ella puede ayudar a su esposo.

Su sueño es comprar otro carro ya que el que tienen está muy deteriorado.
texts.en:
The María Auxiliadora (Mary Help of Christians) Loan Group meets in La Sequita parish, which belongs to Montecristi Canton, a flourishing canton in Manabi, known as the birthplace of the Viejo Luchador ("Old Fighter" and a former president of Ecuador) Eloy Alfaro, and known for its famous Panama hats, which are known in and outside of the country.

Dayce lives here. She is 51 years old and is in an open relationship, from which she has five grown children. The youngest, who is a single man, still lives with her. Her husband is a businessman.

She is a very good housekeeper and wife who is getting the loan to help her husband with his business. He sells fruits, legumes and vegetables. Our friend Dayce tells us that he leaves at dawn to buy fruits and vegetables at the nearby farms and to buy some other products at the wholesale market in Portoviejo. He later takes these products through the whole city of Manta in his car. He does this five days per week and has been working in this business for more than 20 years.

They will use this loan to buy fruits, vegetables and legumes. Dayce has been in the Loan Group for more than ten years, and she likes it because she can help her husband through the loans.

Her dream is to buy another car since the one they have is in very poor condition.

loans.use: to buy fruits, vegetables and legumes.

loans.name: Marcelina Sollano Group

texts.en:
Marcelina is 62 years old and lives in Maningcol, Ozamis City, Misamis Occidental. She is a widow with four children. To earn a living, Marcelina has a business selling used clothes. She earns about PHP 1,500 each month doing this type of work. Marcelina has requested a loan for PHP 3,000 to buy used clothes to sell. 

Marcelina has been a member of PMPC just this year 2011. In the future, she would like to have a progressive business and better family living conditions. Marcelina is the leader of a four-person group. Although they borrow as a group, each member of the group has their own business.

loans.use: To buy more used clothing to sell.

loans.name: Jesús Lucinda

texts.es:
El Grupo De Crédito María Auxiliadora se reúne en La parroquia La Sequita que pertenece al cantón Montecristi prospero cantón manabita, conocido como la cuna  del viejo luchador Eloy Alfaro y por los famosos sombreros de paja toquilla que son apreciados dentro y fuera del país.

En este lugar vive la señora Jesús, tiene 43 años de edad, está casada y de esta relación  tiene 4 hijos, dos de ellos ya son  mayores de edad y dos de 16 y 14 años, todos viven en su casa y estudian en colegio y Universidad. Su esposo se dedica a la albañilería.

Jesus se dedica al cuidado del hogar  y a la cría de chanchos y pollos, los mismos que los compra cuando aun están pequeños, los tiene por espacio de tres a cuatro meses hasta que tengan un peso adecuado y luego los vende a comerciantes que llegan hasta su casa,  ellos los llevan a los distintos mercados de la ciudad a comercializar la carne, trabaja todos los días en el  cuidado y alimentación de animales, sus  hijos le ayudan cuando están desocupados.
 
Este crédito lo va a emplear en comprar pollos y alimento y medicinas tanto para pollos y los chanchos. Es socia fundadora  del Grupo De Crédito y le gusta porque los intereses son más bajos que en otros lugares de crédito.
 
Sus sueños son que sus hijos terminen sus estudios y que sean buenos profesionales.
texts.en:
The María Auxiliadora (Mary Help of Christians) Loan Group meets in La Sequita parish, which belongs to Montecristi Canton, a flourishing canton in Manabi, known as the birthplace of the Viejo Luchador ("Old Fighter" and a former president of Ecuador) Eloy Alfaro, and known for its famous Panama hats, which are known in and outside of the country.

Jesús lives here. She is 43 years old, married and has four children. Two of them are grown, and the other two are 16 and 14 years old. They all live in her house and attend high school and the University. Her husband is a bricklayer.

Jesús takes care of their home and raises their pigs and chickens. She buys them when they are little, keeps them for three to four months until they reach a good size, and then she sells them to businesspeople who come to her house. They take the animals to the different markets in the city to sell the meat. Jesús works everyday caring for and feeding the animals, and her children help her when they are not busy.

She will use this loan to buy chickens, feed and medicine for both chickens and pigs. She is a founding member of the Loan Group, and she likes it because the interest rates are lower than at other loan institutions.

Her dreams are for her children to finish their studies and become professionals.

loans.use: to buy chickens, feed and medicine for chickens and pigs.

loans.name: Victoria

texts.es: Victoria vive en compañía de sus hijas en la asa que sus padres la dejaron. Se dedica a realizar bordados artesanales desde hace 3 años, se inicio por invitación de una de sus amigas que la enseñó este oficio, ahora trabaja independientemente en la comodidad de su casa para poder atender su hogar y sus hijas. Paralelamente  cultiva alfalfa para venderla al por mayor. Por tal razón, no tiene un horario fijo, de trabajo, pero es muy constante en la realización de sus bordados ya que  por la complejidad del trabajo y el grosor del bordado en la tela este trabajo dura hasta un mes de realizado. Como resultado termina en una bella prenda  típica que causa admiración en sus clientes y finalmente son comprados al contado. La época más rentable  en su negocio es cuando  están en plena época de festividades típicas llamadas la fiesta del Santiago que se celebra mucho por su zona. Desea crecer en su producción de faldas bordadas y contratar personas para ayudarla  en esta confección. Es su quinto crédito que tiene con MFP, siempre se ha destacado en su grupo solidario por ser puntual en sus pagos y se ha ganado la confianza de los demás integrantes, en todas estas oportunidades de crédito que ha tenido. Con el dinero que solicita, lo invertirá en la compra de hilos y telas, a la vez  comprará semillas y sacos de abono para sembrar alfalfa en algunos terrenos que adquirió recientemente.
texts.en:
Victoria lives with her daughters in the house her parents left her. She has been doing embroidery by hand for three years. She began this at the invitation of one of her friends who taught her this trade, and now she works independently in the comfort of her home so she can take care of her house and her daughters. She also grows alfalfa to sell wholesale. For this reason, she does not have a fixed schedule, but she is very regular about doing her embroidery because the complexity of the work and the thickness of the embroidery on the cloth make one project take up to a month. She ends up with a beautiful traditional outfit that her customers admire, and that is finally paid for in cash.

The most profitable time for her business is during the traditional feast of Santiago (St. James), which is celebrated a lot in her area. Victoria wants to increase her production of embroidered skirts and to hire people to help her make them. This is her fifth loan with MFP. She has always stood out in her communal bank for being punctual with her payments, and she has earned the trust of the other members in all the opportunities she has had to receive loans. She will invest the money she is asking for in the purchase of thread and cloth. At the same time she will buy seeds and sacks of organic fertilizer to sow alfalfa on some land she acquired recently.

loans.use: to buy thread and fabric, as well as alfalfa seed and sacks of organic fertilizer.

loans.name: Mercedes Sebastiana

texts.es:
El Grupo De Crédito María Auxiliadora se reúne en La parroquia La Sequita que  pertenece al cantón Montecristi prospero cantón manabita, conocido como la cuna  del viejo luchador Eloy Alfaro y por los famosos sombreros de paja toquilla que son apreciados dentro y fuera del país.

En este lugar conocimos a la señora Mercedes, tiene 46 años de edad, está casada y de esta relación  tiene 5 hijos, cuatro de ellos ya son  mayores de edad y el ultimo de 17 años que  estudian en colegio, cuatro de sus hijos aun viven con ella. Su esposo es comerciante.

Ella como buena esposa trata de ayudar a su esposo en lo que más puede por eso realiza el crédito para el negocio del esposo, él se dedica a la venta de frutas, legumbres y verduras el mismo que lo realiza cuatro días  por semana en el mercado Tarqui en Manta, nos cuenta nuestra amiga que el señor se desplaza de madrugada a dicho mercado con la finalidad de comprar a comerciantes mayoristas y luego realizar sus ventas a las personas que asistan a este centro de abastos a comprar los productos para el consumo diario.

Este crédito lo va a emplear en comprar frutas, verduras y legumbres. Lleva más de 10 años en el Grupo De Crédito y le gusta porque se divierte con sus compañeras y por la ayuda que le dan. 

Sus sueños son algún día tener un bazar o una tienda bien surtida.
texts.en:
The María Auxiliadora (Mary Help of Christians) Loan Group meets in La Sequita parish, which belongs to Montecristi Canton, a flourishing canton in Manabi, known as the birthplace of the Viejo Luchador ("Old Fighter" and a former president of Ecuador) Eloy Alfaro, and known for its famous Panama hats, which are known in and outside of the country.

Here we met Mercedes. She is 46 years old, married and has five children. Four of them are grown, and the youngest is 17 and in high school. Four of her children still live with her. Her husband is a businessman.

As a good wife, Mercedes tries to help her husband as much as she can. That is why she is getting this loan for her husband's business. He sells fruits, legumes and vegetables himself, and he does this four days per week at the Tarqui market in Manta. Our friend Mercedes tells us that he leaves at dawn to go to this market and buy from wholesalers, and later he makes sales to people who come to this supply center to buy products for daily use.

They will use this loan to buy fruits, vegetables and legumes. Mercedes has been in the Loan Group for more than ten years, and she likes it because she enjoys being with her friends and because of the help they give her. 

Her dream is to one day have a bazaar or a well-stocked store.

loans.use: to buy fruits, legumes and vegetables.

loans.name: Stela

texts.en: Stela is 42 years old and lives in Ozamis City. She is married with three children. To earn a living, Stela has a business selling meals through her restaurant. She earns about PHP 1,500 each month doing this type of work. Stela has requested a loan of PHP 25000 to purchase more ingredients for meals from her resaturant. Stela has been a member of PMPC for one year.

loans.use: to purchase more ingredients for meals from her restaurant.

loans.name: Blanca Bertha

texts.es:
El Grupo De Crédito María Auxiliadora se reúne en La parroquia La Sequita que  pertenece al cantón Montecristi prospero cantón manabita, conocido como la cuna  del viejo luchador Eloy Alfaro y por los famosos sombreros de paja toquilla que son apreciados dentro y fuera del país.

Conocimos a la señora Blanca y ella nos cuenta algo de su vida, tiene 79 años de edad hace muchos años su esposo falleció y quedo sola pero de esa relación tuvo 5 hijos los mismos que ahora ya son mayores de edad. Uno de sus hijos que a pesar que es comprometido  aun vive con ella junto con su familia.

Ella para obtener algo para sus gastos se dedica a la venta de ropa de todo tipo, su forma de venta es puerta a puerta, trabaja los sábados y domingos en las ventas y cobranzas ya que deja a crédito y cobra al mismo tiempo que realiza sus ventas. La mercadería se la va a comprar un hijo a Guayaquil porque dice que allá se encuentran mayor variedad y a más bajos costos para que le quede mejores  ganancias. Lleva más de 16 años que se dedica a esta actividad y aun se mantiene ya que tiene muchos clientes que la prefieren.

Este crédito lo va a utilizar para comprar pantalones, camisas, blusas y ropa de niños. Está en el Grupo De Crédito desde el principio y le gusta por los beneficios adicionales que brinda la institución.

Sus sueños son tener salud para seguir adelante.
texts.en:
The “María Auxiliadora” communal bank meets in the La Sequita parish, which belongs to the Montecristi cantón, which is a prosperous cantón of Manabí. It is known as the birthplace of the “Old Fighter”, Eloy Alfaro. It is also famous for the straw hats that are well-known in and outside the country [“Panama” hats]. 

We meet Blanca and she tells us some about her life. She is 79 years old. Her husband died many years ago and since then she has been alone. But she had 5 children from her marriage, all of whom are now grown. One of her sons is engaged, but continues to live with her, along with his family. 

In order to earn something for her expenses, she sells clothing of all kinds. She sells door to door. She works Saturdays and Sundays in sales and also charges customers at the same time she does her sales. One of her sons goes to Guyaquil for her to buy the merchandise because she says that there is a better variety there and the costs are lower, which leaves her with better income. She has been in this business for 16 years and she’s still doing it because she has many clients who prefer her.

She will use this loan to buy pants, shirts, blouses, and children’s clothing. She has been in the communal bank since its beginning and she likes it because of the additional benefits the institution provides. Her dream is to have good health so that she can continue get ahead in life.

loans.use: to buy pants, shirts, blouses, and children’s clothing.

loans.name: Lina

texts.en: Lina is a 30-year-old woman, married and a resident of Clarin, Misamis Occidental, Philippines. She has two school-aged children. She grows bananas as the source of income. Every month, she has a total earnings of PHP 3,000 from this activity. Lina has been struggling hard for the family for nine years. She has requested a loan of PHP 5,000 from GDMPC to purchase corn fertilizers and banana propagation cost. Lina hopes to expand the business, buy a motorcycle to easily move the goods in the marketplace and obtain more income in the future.

loans.use: To purchase corn fertilizers and banana propagation cost.

loans.name: Mayra Elizabeth

texts.es:
El Grupo De Crédito María Auxiliadora se reúne en La parroquia La Sequita que  pertenece al cantón Montecristi prospero cantón manabita, conocido como la cuna  del viejo luchador Eloy Alfaro y por los famosos sombreros de paja toquilla que son apreciados dentro y fuera del país.

En este lugar conocimos a la señora Mayra, tiene 26 años de edad, está casada y de esta relación  tiene dos hijos de 9 y 4  años, el mayor estudia en escuela mientras que al menor lo deja en una guardería por su trabajo. Su esposo es comerciante.

Nuestra amiga trabaja en una fábrica de atún en la ciudad de Manta pero adema de eso también tiene un bar en su casa, ella vende golosinas,  helados, colas, jugos, aguas, cervezas entre otras cosas, nos cuenta que ella atiende su negocio en las tardes una vez que llega de su trabajo y en los días libres aunque de vez en cuando su mamá le ayuda en su negocio. Nos cuenta que lleva con su negocio más de 4 años y que este le sirvió mucho para tener para sus gastos. 

Este crédito lo va a utilizar para comprar helados, sodas, energizantes, cervezas, entre otras cosas. Lleva 8 años en el Grupo De Crédito y le gusta por los beneficios adicionales como los créditos emergentes por ejemplo.
 
Su sueño es tener una gran despensa.
texts.en:
The “María Auxiliadora” communal bank meets in the La Sequita parish, which belongs to the Montecristi cantón, which is a prosperous cantón of Manabí. It is known as the birthplace of the “Old Fighter”, Eloy Alfaro. It is also famous for the straw hats that are well-known in and outside the country.

This is where we meet Mayra. She is 26 years old, married, and has two children who are 9 and 4 years old. The oldest studies at school, while the younger one goes to a kindergarten at her work. Her husband is a salesman. 

Our friend works in a tuna processing plant in the city of Manta, but in addition to this she also has a pub in her house. She sells sweets, ice creams, sodas, juices, water, and beer, among other things. She tells us that she tends her business in the afternoons when she gets home from work and on her free days, though sometimes her mother helps her with the business. She says she has had this business for more than 4 years and that it has helped her a lot in meeting her expenses.

She will use this loan to buy ice creams, sodas, energy drinks, and beers, among other things. She has been in the communal bank for 8 years and she likes the additional benefits, such as emergency loans, for example.

loans.use: to buy ice creams, sodas, energy drinks, and beers, etc.

loans.name: Esterlita

texts.en: Esterlita is a 31-year-old woman, married and humbly residing in Clarin, Misamis Occidental, Philippines. She is blessed to have three children with her. She grows corn and bananas to earn a living. After 10 years of handling this work, she finds it tiresome but enjoyable. She gets a monthly income of PHP 3,000 from this activity. Esterlita has requested a loan of PHP 5,000 to purchase fertilizers for the corn. She has been connected with GDMPC for a year. She plans to buy a lot in the future to extend the farming area and gain more income from it.

loans.use: To purchase fertilizers

loans.name: Leonora

texts.en:
Leonora, age 40, has earned her living for 20 years from farming corn and bananas. She and her family live in Clarin, Misamis Occidental. Every month, she earns PHP 3,000.00 from her farming activities. She has five children. 

Leonora has requested a loan of PHP 5,000.00 from GDMPC to pay for weeding and fertilizers. She has been a member of GDMPC for almost a year. 

She hopes to extend the business and plant other crops in order to increase her income and support her family.

loans.use: to pay for weeding and fertilizers

loans.name: Aileen

texts.en:
Aileen, age 26, has been a farmer for seven years and earns PHP 3,000 a month from her endeavors. She plans to plant more crops to gain more income, and also intends to make essential repairs to the family home. 

Aileen has been a member of GDMPC for almost a year. She has requested a loan in the amount of PHP 5,000 from GDMPC in order to buy fertilizers and pay for land preparation costs. 

She has three school-aged children and lives in Clarin, Misamis Occidental.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and pay for land preparation costs

loans.name: Emila

texts.en:
Emila, age 42, is a farmer  living in Clarin, Misamis Occidental. She generates a total of PHP 3,000.00 a month from her endeavors. She has been working as a farmer for 20 years.

Emila is requesting a loan of PHP 5,000.00 from GDMPC in order to pay for the cultivation and fertilizing of her corn crop. She has been a member of GDMPC for almost a year. She plans to extend her farming area so as to gain more income. Her goal is to make essential repairs to the family house. 

Emila and her husband have five children, some of whom are grown.

loans.use: to pay for the cultivation and fertilizing of her corn crop

loans.name: Ignacia Candelaria

texts.es:
El Grupo De Crédito María Auxiliadora se reúne en La parroquia La Sequita que  pertenece al cantón Montecristi prospero cantón manabita, conocido como la cuna  del viejo luchador Eloy Alfaro y por los famosos sombreros de paja toquilla que son apreciados dentro y fuera del país.

Aquí conocimos a la señora Ignacia tiene 35 años de edad y mantiene una relación de unión libre de la cual  tiene tres hijos los mismos que  estudian en escuela y colegio. El marido se dedica a la albañilería.

Ella tiene una pequeña granja donde cría chanchos y gallinas criollas, nos cuenta  que  compra los chanchos cuando están pequeños, luego los cría por espacio de tres a cuatro meses y luego cuando tengan un peso adecuado los vende a comerciantes que llegan hasta su localidad a comprar estos animalitos para llevarlos a los mercados de otras ciudades cercanas, trabaja todos los días unas tres a cuatro horas en el cuidado y alimentación de sus animalitos, sus hijos le ayudan en su labor.

Va a utilizar este crédito para comprar alimento y medicinas para su mejor desarrollo. Es socia fundadora del Grupo De Crédito y le gusta porque siempre con los créditos ella puede financiarse hasta vender sus animalitos.
 
Su sueño es comprar un carro.
texts.en:
The “María Auxiliadora” communal bank meets in the La Sequita parish, which belongs to the Montecristi cantón, which is a prosperous cantón of Manabí. It is known as the birthplace of the “Old Fighter”, Eloy Alfaro. It is also famous for the straw hats that are well-known in and outside the country.

This is where we meet Ignacia, who is 35 years old. She is in a common law marriage and has three children, all of whom are studying in primary school and high school. Her husband works in masonry.

She has a small farm where she raises pigs and chickens. She tells us that she buys the pigs when they are small, then she raises them for three or four months. When they reach an adequate weight, she sells them to buyers to come to her town to buy these animals and take them to the markets in nearby towns. She works three or four hours each day in caring for and feeding her animals. Her children help her in her work.

She will use the loan to buy feed and medicines so her animals will grow better. She is a founding member of the communal bank and she likes it because with the loans she can finance herself until she sells her animals. 

Her dream is to buy a car.

loans.use: to buy feed and medicines for her animals.

loans.name: Nieva

texts.en:
Nieva, age 35, farms bananas and corn for a living in Clarin, Misamis Occidental. She has been engaged in this work for 10 years and earns a monthly income of approximately PHP 3,000. She and her husband have five school-aged children living with them.

She has requested a loan of PHP 5,000.00 from GDMPC in order to add more capital to apply toward banana production and corn fertilization. Nieva has been a member of GDMPC for almost a year. She hopes to buy and own a motorcycle in the future so as to minimize delivery costs and to increase her income.

loans.use: to add more capital to apply toward banana production and corn fertilization

loans.name: Virginia

texts.en:
Virginia, age 42, is a banana farmer in Clarin, Misamis Occidental. Her banana plantation serves as her source of living and she sells her produce at market. She has been doing this for 10 years and earns a monthly income of PHP 3,000. She is a widow and has four children. 
 
Virginia has applied for a loan in the amount of PHP 5,000.00 from GDMPC in order to add more capital to apply toward banana production. She hopes to engage in another business in the future so as to bring in some additional income.

loans.use: to add more capital to apply toward banana production

loans.name: Verónica Johanna

texts.es:
El Grupo De Crédito María Auxiliadora se reúne en La parroquia La Sequita que  pertenece al cantón Montecristi prospero cantón manabita, conocido como la cuna  del viejo luchador Eloy Alfaro y por los famosos sombreros de paja toquilla que son apreciados dentro y fuera del país.

En este lugar conocimos a la señora Verónica, tiene 26 años de edad, está casada y de esta relación  tiene un hijo de 5 años de edad que estudia en escuela, actualmente está en su sexto mes de embarazo de su segundo hijo. Su esposo trabaja en una fábrica en Manta.

Ella para ganarse algo por su cuenta y poder ayudar a su esposo con los gastos del hogar hace dos años atrás emprendió un negocio el mismo que lo tiene en su casa, allí ella se dedica a la compra y venta de maíz, balanceado y otros alimentos para animales de granja, nos cuenta que este negocio es muy bueno ya que la mayoría de las personas de su localidad se dedican a la cría de estos animalitos por lo cual sus ventas están aseguradas, nos cuenta que le gusta lo que hace ya que se gana algo sin tener que salir de su casa y esto le permite estar al tanto de las necesidades de sus hijos y de su hogar.
