Va a utilizar este crédito para comprar maíz, balanceado, arrocillo y otros alimentos para animales. Es socia del Grupo De Crédito hace 4 ciclos y le gusta porque con sus primer crédito empezó su negocio.
 
Su sueño es seguir creciendo en su negocio.
texts.en:
The communal bank María Auxiliadora meets in the parish of La Sequita which belongs to the Montecristi Canton, a prosperous Manabí canton, known as the birth place of the famous fighter Eloy Alfaro and for the famous straw hats much appreciated in and outside the country.

Here we meet Mrs. Verónica, 26, who is married and has a five-year old son who is in school.  She is also expecting her second child in three months.  Her husband works in a factory in Manta.

In order to earn her own income and help her husband with the household expenses, she started a business in her house two years ago.  She buys and sells corn and balanced feeds for farm animals.  She claims the business is good and most people living in the area raise small animals so her sales are sure to be successful.  She enjoys what she does and is able to earn a living without leaving home.  This helps cover her children's and the household's needs.

She plans to use the loan to buy corn, rice, balanced and other animal feed.  She has been in the communal bank for four terms and likes it because she was able to establish her business with the first loan.

Her dream is to continue expanding her business.

loans.use: To buy corn, rice, balanced and other animal feed.

loans.name: Crecyl Jane

texts.en:
Crecyl Jane is a 23-year-old woman who is married and living in Clarin, Misamis Occidental, Philippines. She has two children to care for. She is engaged in a service-based activity. She earns a monthly income of 6,000 Philippines pesos (PHP) for two years of doing it. 

She has requested a loan of PHP 5,000 at GDMPC to purchase pedi-cab spare parts to cover the cost of repainting. Crecyl Jane has been a member of GDMPC for almost a year. She plans to buy one more pedi-cab for hire to earn more income.

loans.use: To purchase pedi-cab spare parts and to cover repainting costs.

loans.name: Elvira

texts.en: Elvira is 39 years old, single and lives in Clarin, Misamis Occidental, Philippines. She is a mother of five children. She grows bananas to earn a living and earns a total of PHP 3,000 a month from this work. She has been engaged in this activity for two years already. Elvira has requested a loan of PHP 25,000 from GDMPC to pay for the land preparation and planting costs. She has been a member of GDMPC for almost a year. Elvira hopes to reap more from her investment and expand the cultivated area.

loans.use: To pay for land preparation and planting costs.

loans.name: Charity

texts.en: Charity is 33 years old, married and lives in Clarin, Misamis Occidental, Philippines. She has four school-aged children. She sells good food at home to earn a living. She has been working on this for three years and luckily earns a monthly sum of PHP 6,000. Charity has applied for a loan of PHP 5,000 at GDMPC to purchase adequate supplies needed in her food production business undertakings. She has been a member of GDMPC for almost a year. She hopes to have a small food vending area in the marketplace to earn more income and meet her daily needs.

loans.use: To purchase adequate supplies to prepare food.

loans.name: Andrena

texts.en: Andrena, aged 39, is married with four children and lives in Baybay, Liloy, Zamboanga del Norte. Andrena sells food for snacks to earn a living and has had this business for three years. She has requested a loan of PHP 7,000 to purchase more ingredients for her snacks. Andrena has been a member of PMPC since this year. In the future, she hopes to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more ingredients for her snacks.

loans.name: Angelita

texts.en: Angelita is 41 years old, married and living in Clarin, Misamis Occidental, Philippines. She was very blessed to have nine children. She earns a living through a nipa making activity. She has been doing this business for four years and is so glad to have a total of PHP 8,000 a month from this work. Angelita has applied for a loan of PHP 5,000 at GDMPC to buy materials for nipa hut making such as bamboo stick. She has been a member of GDMPC for four years already. She hopes to have more orders to gain more income and enable her to pay the school fees of her children.

loans.use: To buy materials for nipa hut making such as bamboo stick.

loans.name: Filma

texts.en: Filma is a 42-year-old woman who is married and lives in Clarin, Misamis Occidental, Philippines. She has three school-aged children with her. She sells tasty food items in the local community to earn a living.  She has been working in this business for three years. She earns a total monthly income of PHP 3,000. Filma has requested a loan of PHP 6,000 from GDMPC to purchase feasible food items to sell. She has been a member of GDMPC for four years already. Filma hopes to build a food-vending stall in the town market.

loans.use: To purchase food items to sell.

loans.name: Chona

texts.en: Chona is a married woman living in Clarin, Misamis Occidental, Philippines. She has two school-aged children. She has been engaged in a service-based transportation activity lately to earn an additional means of living. Chona has requested a loan of PHP 20,000 at GDMPC to purchase motorbike spare parts and repair costs to maintain it in good running condition. She has been a member of GDMPC for almost a year. She hopes to repair her house in the future and earn more income for the new business undertaking.

loans.use: To purchase spare parts and pay for repair costs .

loans.name: Maria Subrado Group

texts.en:
Maria is 49 years old and lives in Maningcol, Ozamis City, Misamis Occidental. She is married with seven children. To earn a living, Maria has a seaweed production business. She has had this business for five years. She earns about PHP 2,500 each month doing this type of work. 

Maria has requested a loan of PHP 5,000 to purchase equipment for seaweed production. She has been a member of PMPC for three years. In the future, she would like to have a progressive business and better family living conditions. Maria is the leader of a 5-person group. Although they borrow as a group, each member of the group has their own business.

loans.use: To purchase equipment for seaweed production.

loans.name: Teresita

texts.en: Teresita is 51 years old and lives in P12 Northern Catadman, Ozamiz City, Misamis Occidental. She is married with three children. To earn a living, Teresita has a bakery. She earns about PHP 6,000 each month doing this type of work. Teresita has requested a loan of PHP 30,000 to purchase raw ingredients for her bakery. She has been a member of PMPC for three years.

loans.use: to purchase raw ingredients for her bakery.

loans.name: Eelzi Jen

texts.en: Eelzi Jen is a 30-year-old woman who is married and residing in Clarin, Misamis Occidental, Philippines. She has two little kids now. She owns and operates a sari-sari store for a living. She earns a total of PHP 5,000 a month for a period of 10 years while managing the store. Eelzi Jen has requested a loan of PHP 5,000 from GDMPC to buy grocery items to sell. She has been with GDMPC for one year. Eelzi Jen hopes to extend the business and gain more profit in the future.

loans.use: To buy grocery items to sell.

loans.name: Rodnie

texts.en: Rodnie is a 22-year-old married man residing in Clarin, Misamis Occidental, Philippines. He has two school-aged children with him. He has been vending barbecue for five years to earn a living. He earns a total of PHP 7,000 monthly from this activity. Rodnie has requested a loan of PHP 5,000 from GDMPC to purchase supplies needed for his barbecue vending business. He has been a member of GDMPC for four years already. He hopes to have an accessible food stall in the town market to earn more income.

loans.use: To purchase supplies needed for barbecue vending.

loans.name: Flordeliza

texts.en: Flordeliza is 52 years old and lives in Oroquieta City. She is married with three children. To earn a living, Flordeliza has a business selling fruits and vegetables. She earns about PHP 5,000 each month doing this type of work. Flordeliza has requested a loan of PHP 14,900 to purchase fruits and vegetables to sell. She has been a member of PMPC for six years.

loans.use: to purchase fruits and vegetables to sell

loans.name: Josephine

texts.en: Josephine is 45 years old, married and residing in Clarin, Misamis Occidental, Philippines. She has three grown children. She owns and operates a sari-sari store at home to earn a living. She generates a monthly income of PHP 8,000 from this activity and has been doing this for five years already. Josephine has applied for a loan of PHP 5,000 at GDMPC to purchase additional grocery items to sell. She has been a member of GDMPC for three years. She hopes to expand the business and sell hog feed to earn more.

loans.use: to purchase additional grocery items to sell

loans.name: Rufina

texts.en: Rufina, aged 58, is married and lives in Gil Sanchez, Labason, Zamboanga del Norte. She has a piggery to earn a living. She has been doing this for two years. Rufina has requested a loan of PHP 10,000 to purchase more pigs. She has been a member of PMPC for over one year. In the future, Rufina hopes to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more pigs.

location.town: Gil Sanchez, Labason, Zamboanga del Norte

loans.name: Jerelyn

texts.en: Jerelyn, aged 32, is single and lives in Lopoc, Labason, Zamboanga del Norte. To earn a living, she has a general store business. She has had this business for five years. Each month, she earns approximately PHP 4,000. Jerelyn has requested a loan of PHP 14,900 to purchase more stock for her general store. She has been a member of PMPC for over one year. In the future, Jerelyn hopes to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more stock for her general store.

loans.name: Jennifer

texts.en: Jennifer is 42 years old and lives in Olingan, Dipolog City. She is married with four children. To earn a living, Jennifer has a business selling "bibingka", a sweet pudding made from rice and fresh coconut milk. She earns about PHP 2,000 each month doing this type of work. Jennifer has requested a loan of PHP 5,000 to purchase raw ingredients for her snack vending business. She has been a member of PMPC for three years.

loans.use: to purchase raw ingredients for her snack vending business

loans.name: Maria

texts.en: Maria is 57 years old and lives in Ozamis City. She is married with two children. Maria has a shop that sells cosmetics. She has had this business for 10 years. She has requested a loan of PHP 50,000 to purchase more cosmetic products to sell. Maria has been a member of PMPC for four years.

loans.use: to purchase more cosmetic products to sell

loans.name: Editha

texts.en: Editha, aged 59, is married with seven children and lives in Gil Sanchez, Labason, Zamboanga del Norte. She has a general store to earn a living and has had this business for four years. Each month, she earns PHP 2,500 doing this type of work. She has requested a loan of PHP 40,000 to purchase more stock of products to sell. Editha has been a member of PMPC for two years. In the future, she hopes to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more stock of products to sell.

location.town: Gil Sanchez, Labason, Zamboanga del Norte

loans.name: Helen

texts.en: Helen, aged 62, is married with three children and lives in Gil Sanchez, Labason, Zamboanga del Norte. She sells different products in her general store to earn a living and has had this business for two years. Each month, she earns PHP 1,500 doing this type of work. She has requested a loan of PHP 4,500 to purchase more stock of products to sell in her general store. Helen has been a member of PMPC for over one year. In the future, she hopes to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more stock of products to sell in her general store

location.town: Gil Sanchez, Labason, Zamboanga del Norte

loans.name: Luis

texts.en: Luis is 69 years old and lives in Oroquieta City. He is married with four children. Luis has a furniture making business and earns approximately PHP 5,000 each month doing this type of work. He has requested a loan of PHP 10,000 to purchase materials needed for his furniture making. Luis has been a member of PMPC for one year.

loans.use: to purchase materials needed for his furniture making.

loans.name: Panfila Navarro Group

texts.en:
Panfila is 61 years old and lives in Siparok, Jose Dalman, Zamboanga del Norte. She is married with four children.

To earn a living, Panfila has a business selling snacks such as hotcakes, doughnuts, etc. She earns about PHP 3,000 each month doing this type of work. Panfila has requested a loan of PHP 15,000 to to fully pay for her motorcycle which is used for delivery in her snacks business and when they purchase flour, oil, etc.

Panfila has been a member of PMPC for four years. In the future, she would like to have professionally-qualified children to help her when she and her husband become old.

Panfila is the leader of a 2-person group. Although they borrow as a group, each member of the group has their own business.

loans.use: To fully pay for her motorcycle which is used for delivery in her snacks business and when they purchase flour, oil, etc.

location.town: Siparok, Jose Dalman, Zamboanga del Norte

loans.name: Snooky

texts.en: Snooky is 40 years old and lives in Dapitan City. She is married with four children. To earn a living, Snooky has a business selling fish. She earns about PHP 3,500 each month doing this type of work. Snooky has requested a loan of PHP 5,000 to purchase fresh fish to sell. Snooky has been a member of PMPC for five years.

loans.use: to purchase fresh fish to sell.

loans.name: Jovito

texts.en: Jovito is 41 years of age and is married with four school-aged children. He is a farmer working in the Philippines and at the same time he manages his hog-raising business. Jovito's wife is a housekeeper and she also sells cosmetic products like lipstick, perfumes and face powder. Jovito is asking for a loan to buy feed for his hogs. Jovito's dream is for his children to complete their studies. He plans to save more funds from his income so that he can attain his dreams of alleviating his family from poverty.

loans.use: to buy feed for his hogs

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase lotion, detergent soap, toilet cleaner and perfumes to sell in her village

loans.name: Ilumunada

texts.en:
Married and a loving mother to her children, Iluminada, 54, is a determined individual working hard to increase her income by means of her sari sari store (variety store) which she has operated for 29 years now. She has also been preparing cooked viands in their barrio for five years now. Each month, Iluminada earns an average of P2,000 in retailing and P4,000 in food selling.

Iluminda is requesting a loan of P7,000 to buy groceries such as canned goods, soft drinks and biscuits to sell in the store. She will also buy ingredients for her food business.

loans.use: to buy groceries such as canned goods, soft drinks and biscuits to sell in the store.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to pay for used clothing - 3 bales of jeans.

loans.name: Susanna

texts.ru:
Сусанна живет в городе Капане. Она замужем и имеет троих дочерей: две дочери уже замужем и живут отдельно. Свекор Сусанны пенсионер и проживает с ними. Средняя дочь живет вместе с Сусанной, занимается домашним хозяйством и ухаживает за дедушкой, пока мать и отец работают.
Сусанна занимается собственным бизнесом: продажей женской и детской одежды, белья, а также обуви в арендованном помещении. Она работает без выходных и гордится тем, что благодаря своему собственному бизнесу может покрывать часть расходов своей семьи. Муж Сусанны, который работает таксистом, помогает ей в бизнесе и раз в месяц отвозит ее в Ереван для приобретения очередной партии товара.  
Сусанне необходим кредит на сумму 600.000 драм для приобретения летней женской и детской одежды, а также для покупки купальников, которые пользуются большим спросом в июле и августе.
texts.en:
Susanna lives in Kapan. She is married and has three daughters: two of her daughters have married and live on their own. Susanna's father-in-law is retired and lives with them. The middle daughter lives with Susanna, and she does housework and cares for her grandfather while her mother and father work. 

Susanna has her own business selling women's and children's clothing, lingerie, and shoes in a rented shop. She works seven days a week and prides herself on the fact that her business can support her family. Susanna's husband, who works a taxi driver, helps her in her business once a month by driving her to Yerevan to buy more inventory. Susanna needs a loan of 600,000 drams to buy summer women's and children's clothing, as well as to buy swimsuits, which are in high demand in July and August.

loans.use: To buy women's and children's clothes and swimsuits for resale

loans.name: Aleksandr

texts.en:
Aleksandr, who was born in 1960 in the village of Acharkut, Tavush region, studied in the mechanics department of the Ijevan technical secondary school, after which he served in the army. He then worked at an Ijevan carpet enterprise till 1996, the year he established his own business selling men's trousers, T-shirts and belts. Aleksandr rents a stall at the Ijevan Fair and buys merchandise two to four times a month (depending on season) from Yerevan.

Aleksandr’s business allows him to support his family which consists of his wife, his daughter, his son and daughter-in-law. Aleksandr’s wife keeps house and other members of the family have their permanent work and as far as possible help their father to support the family. Aleksandr is now requesting a loan of 1.000.000 AMD to buy a summer assortment of jeans and classical models of trousers.

loans.use: to buy a summer assortment of jeans and classical models of trousers.

loans.name: Abu Bakarr

texts.en:
Abu Bakarr, age 53, owns a used footwear sales business. He began his business because he wanted to provide as well as possible for himself and his family. He and his wife have five children aged 13, 13, 16, 19, and 27. He has two additional dependents, his niece and nephew, living with the family. 

Working seven days a week and 10 hours a day, he earns about Le 1,000,000 every month from this business. 

Abu Bakarr would like to request a loan in the amount of Le 3,000,000. He requires this loan in order to buy an additional five bales of used shoes to offer for sale. He is confident that this loan will enable him to increase his monthly profits by approximately Le 250,000. 

In the future, he plans to provide for the education of his children to the university level. He hopes eventually to become a top leader in the community.

loans.use: to buy used shoes to offer for sale

loans.name: Jackson

texts.en: Jackson is 47 years old and lives in Kakata. He is married and has four children ages 1 to 27. All of the children are presently in school. For the past three years, Jackson has been operating a provisions shop where he sells many items like candles, soap, and rice among other items. He is requesting a loan to purchase a motor bike to be used for commercial purposes. He plans to build a house in the near future.

loans.use: to purchase a motor bike

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy grocery items such as soft drinks, canned goods, biscuits, and oil to sell in her store

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to purchase more drugs to stock in his pharmacy

loans.name: Madelyn

texts.en:
Madelyn is 39 years old and is married to a farmer. Together they raise their two children well and send them to school for their bright future. As farmers working in the Philippines, this couple is earning P30,000 average net income every crop season during the months of April through November .

They grow rice and have been doing this for 10 years. Madelyn is asking for a loan of P10,000 to pay for labor fees and to buy seeds and fertilizers for the  maintenance of their farm.  They hope to eventually improve their crop production. 

In the future, Madelyn hopes to make a consistent increase of profits to uplift her family's living condition.  She also wants to save some of their income for the studies of her children.

loans.use: to pay for labor fees and to buy seeds and fertilizers.

loans.name: Edilon

texts.en:
Edilon, 39 years old, is a mother of six children and is married to a farmer.  P20,000 is the average net income she gets from her farming every harvest season. Income generated from the business goes to school fees and sundry needs at home.

Edilon grows rice and has been doing it for 25 years now. She is asking for a loan to purchase hybrid seeds of rice, fertilizers, and insecticides to improve the production of her farm. 

In the future, Edilon hopes to educate all her children to assure them a brighter future.

loans.use: to purchase hybrid seeds of rice, fertilizers, and insecticides.

loans.name: Kibasi Tweimukye Group

texts.en:
Eric is a 31 year-old married man with four children, living in a semi-permanent house in Fort Portal, Uganda.  He is the bread winner of the family and his dream is to have enough income-generating projects to eliminate poverty from his home.

His main challenge has been limited funds to meet the increasing demand, and his dream is to have a wholesale shop.  Eric needs the loan to buy  beans, sugar and maize flour for resale.

loans.use: To buy beans, sugar and maize flour for resale.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to clear a portion of his land for onion farming

loans.name: Jackson

texts.en:
Jackson, age 58, is a vendor of farm produce, a business in which he has been engaged for seven years. He also sells secondhand clothes. He generated his initial capital from farming. His primary hardship is price fluctuation. 

He has a vision of expanding his business so that he can provide for the education of his children. He and his wife live in Kasese, Uganda, and have seven children.

Jackson has requested this loan in order to buy maize and beans to offer for sale.

loans.use: to buy maize and beans to offer for sale

loans.name: Silvia

texts.es:
La señora Silvia tiene ya más de tres años dedicándose a la venta de ropa usada. 
Esta solicitando un préstamo para poder compra mas mercancía que es ropa para hombre, juguetes, zapatos y accesorios de para los bebes, ya que en este momento no cuenta con el dinero necesario para la inversión que su negocio esta necesitando. 
Con las ganancias que obtiene de su negocio planea pagar el crédito ya que su esposo se encargara de los gastos familiares y escolares de sus cuatro hijos, con el sueldo.
texts.en: Silvia has worked for more than three years selling used clothing.  She is requesting a loan to be able to buy more merchandise such as clothing for men, toys, shoes, and accessories for babies as right now she doesn’t have as much money to invest as her business requires.  With the profits she earns from her business she plans to pay off her loan as her husband takes care of the household and schooling expenses for their four children with his salary.

loans.use: to buy merchandise for her business.

loans.name: Angela Del Socorro

texts.es:
Doña Angela, muy trabajadora, de oficio afanadora, durante once años apoyando a su familia, tambien lava y plancha por la tarde, ya que su salida es a las cuatro,  asi como los fines de semana. Logrando con esto ayudarse para la mejora de los alimentos. Cuenta con el apoyo de su esposo, el cual labora en servicios de seguridad.
El objetivo de Angela es la mejora a su vivienda, el cual ha estado reparando gracias a los financiamiento que Afodenic, ah otorgado en cuatro ciclos. hoy con este nuevo prestamo sera para repellar paredes, y terminar de cerrar el cuarto que logro hacer con el credito anterior, ya que por falta de material no termino la obra.
Comprara materiales como: bloques, arena, cemento, esponjas, y comenzar la contruccion. El cual esta contenta por que cada dia, su vivienda esta en mejores condiciones.
texts.en:
Angela, very much a worker in a tough job, has been helping her family for 11 years. She washes and irons clothes afternoons until 4:00 when she finishes, plus weekends. What she achieves is to provide improvements in food for her family. She can count on help from her husband, who works in security services.

Angela's objective is to improve her house, which they have been repairing, thanks to financing from Afodenic during 4 loan cycles. Now, this new loan will be used to plaster walls and finish closing the room they began with the last loan and failed to finish due to lack of construction materials.

Angela will buy materials such as cement blocks, sand, cement, and sponges, and then start the construction. She is content because each day, her house is in better condition.

loans.use: buy construction materials to plaster walls and finish a room in her house.

loans.name: Veronica Magalis

texts.es:
Veronica de profesion docente, con ocho años laborando en el majisterio, casada, su esposo es cajero, y aun no tienen hijos. Como meta para los dos, en la terminacion de su propia casa, en donde  se le ha hecho mas facil con los financiamiento que Afodenic, ha dado en cuatro ciclo.
Lo que esta haciendo es la cocina que aun falta techo, repellar paredes, el pantry, azulejos, entre otros materiales como: perlines, laminas de zinc, cemento, arena, cemento box, golosos. Lo que con este credito espera terminar, y poder gozar de mejor higiene como mejor techo. Y que espera seguir mejoranto atravez de los presamo con Afodenic.
texts.en: Veronica is a teacher and has eight years of experience working in her profession. She is married and her husband is a cashier. They don’t have children yet.  Their joint goal is the completion of their home, which has been made easier with funding from Afodenic in the fourth cycle.  They are working on the kitchen, which doesn’t have a roof yet; plastering the walls, and installing kitchen cabinets and tiles.  She will use the loan to purchase purlins, zinc metal sheeting, cement, sand, concrete blocks, and screws. She hopes this loan will make it possible to complete their home and enjoy better hygiene as well as a better roof. They hope to continue their home improvements through Afodenic loans.

loans.use: to buy building materials to finish the roof and the walls in the kitchen and to buy kitchen cabinets and tile.  She hopes to attain better living conditions such as better hygiene.

loans.name: Ana Maria

texts.es:
La señora Ana Maria tiene nueve años de dedicándose a la venta de abarrotes. 
Está solicitando un préstamo para poder invertir en comprar de mercancía que es productos de carnes frías, latíos, verduras y fruta, ya que sus clientes le están solicitando que tenga estos productos a venta.
Planea pagar el crédito con una parte de las ganancias que obtiene de su negocio ya que es la fuente de ingreso para su familia, ya que es madre soltera y tiene un hijo bajo su responsabilidad y desea mejorar la calidad de vida y tener mayor ingreso en su negocio.
texts.en:
Mrs. Ana Maria has been running a grocery store for nine years.  She is requesting a loan to buy merchandise such as cold meats, vegetables and fruit since her customers are asking for these products.

She plans to pay back the loan with part of the earnings from her business since it is the source of income for her family.  She is a single mother and has a son in her care, and wants to improve her lifestyle and increase her income.

loans.use: To buy merchandise for her store.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy bars for her windows.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy repair parts and pay for vehicle maintenance.

loans.name: Maria Isabel

texts.es: María Isabel desde hace varios años quedo viudo, y su única fuente de ingresos que le quedo fue la pensión por viudez, dinero que solo se le otorga por cada primero de cada mes. Para tener un ingreso mayor opto por vender comida en la maquiladora donde su hija trabaja, el producto lo ofrecen sobre pedido a sus compañeros donde le solicitan taquitos,  chiles rellenos, tamales y mas. Para seguir con su venta necesita comprar la materia prima y de esta manera ella obtendrá mayores ganancias.
texts.en: María Isabel has been a widow for several years.  Her only source of income is her widow's pension which she receives the first of every month.  In order to increase her income, she started selling food at the factory where her daughter works.  She receives orders from the workers for items such as taquitos (small tacos), chiles rellenos (stuffed peppers), tamales, etc.  In order to continue with sales she needs to buy ingredients so she can increase her earnings.

loans.use: To buy food ingredients.

loans.name: Rosa Ema

texts.es: Rosa Ema una mujer muy trabajadora y emprendedora, desde hace 5 años cuenta con un negocio de la venta de ropa usada  donde ofrece variedad de artículos como lo es ropa en diferentes tallas, zapatos, calcetines, zapatos y venta de comida. En este momento el desea invertir en su negocio como compra de mercancía para tener mayor variedad y así sus ventas se incrementen.
texts.en: Rosa Ema is a hard-working entrepreneur who has been selling clothing for five years.  She offers a variety of articles ranging from different size clothing to shoes, socks, and even food.  She is currently interested in buying more merchandise for her business in order to offer a wider variety and increase sales.

loans.use: To buy clothing.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Comprar maquinaria

loans.name: Paulin

texts.es: El señor Paulin y su esposa son una pareja muy trabajadora que con esfuerzo y dedicación construyeron su patrimonio para ofrecer a sus 3 hijos. La casa que el tiene es muy pequeña por lo que desea terminar de construir un cuarto en su vivienda para tener mas espacio y vivir con mayor comodidad. Para esto requiere comprar material de construcción para realizar su proyecto.
texts.en: Paulin and his wife are a very hard-working couple who, with effort and commitment, built a home to offer their three children as an inheritance.  Their home is very small and Paulin would like to finish building an extra room so that they can have more space and live more comfortably.  He needs to buy building supplies in order to carry out his project.

loans.use: to finish building a room

loans.name: Reyna

texts.es:
La señora Reyna tiene ya más de tres años con su negocio de salón de belleza. 
Esta solicitando un préstamo para poder comprar equipo nuevo como son sillones especiales para cortes y peinados, también quiere realizarles los acabados del interior y exterior del local.
Doña Reyna desea mejorar su negocio y darle un buen servicio a si clientes y que estén cómodos mientras ella los atiende. 
Planea pagar el crédito con las ganancias que obtiene de su negocio ya que su esposo el señor Hilario se encargara de los gastos familiares y escolares de su hijo con el sueldo.
texts.en:
Reyna has owned a beauty salon business for more than three years.  She is requesting a loan to buy new equipment such as special salon chairs.  She would also like to do some painting and decorating to the inside and outside of her premises.

Reyna would like to improve her business, provide a good service to her customers and ensure that they are comfortable while she is serving them.

Reyna plans to repay her loan with the profits that she makes in her business as her husband, Hilario, will take care of covering their family expenses and their son's school expenses with his salary.

loans.use: to buy equipment and make improvements to her business premises

loans.name: Bijahual (Portoviejo) Group

texts.es:
En el sitio Bijahual de  la  parroquia Calderón en la ciudad de Portoviejo,  cada quince días se  reúnen las socias del Grupo De Crédito Bijahual. Este lugar se lo conoce por su vegetación y naturaleza, es este lugar la mayoría de sus habitantes se dedican a la agricultura, ganadería y cría de animales.

Este es un grupo de personas que decidieron unirse y formar este Grupo De Crédito que les va a servir  de mucho ya que con los créditos ellos pueden mejorar sus pequeños negocios. Se dedican a diversas actividades tales como  agricultura, cría de animales, comercio, entre otras actividades.

En este lugar conocimos a la señora Aura, tiene 57 años de edad, está casada y de esta relación tienen siete hijos todos mayores de edad e independientes, con ella vive un nieto de 10 años que es como su hijo y estudia en escuela, también un señor que es especial y a quien ayuda. Su esposo trabaja en el campo.

Ella con este crédito quiere comprar pollos para la cría, además de chanchos, nos cuenta que hace varios años se dedica a la cría de estos animalitos ya que cuenta con el espacio suficiente para esto y es algo que no le quita mayor tiempo.

Con este crédito va a comprar 100 pollos y alimentos para los mismos además de dos chanchos pequeños. Este es el primer ciclo al igual que todas sus compañeras y espera quedarse por mucho tiempo.
 
Sus metas son tener salud y salir adelante en su negocio.
texts.en:
Every two weeks the members of the Bijahual loan group meet in Bijahual, in Calderón parish, in the city of Portoviejo.  This area is known for its vegetation and natural beauty.  Most local people farm and raise animals and livestock.

This is a group of people who decided to come together and form a loan group which would help them a lot as they would be able to use the loans to improve their small businesses.  The members are engaged in different business activities such as farming, animal raising, commerce, etc.

Here we meet 57 year-old Aura who is married and has seven grown-up children who live independently.  She has a 10 year-old grandson who lives with her like a son and attends school.  She also lives with a gentleman who is special and who she helps.  Her husband works on the land.

Aura will use this loan to buy chickens to raise and pigs.  She tells us that she has been raising these animals for several years as she has enough space for this business and it is something that doesn't require too much time.

Aura will buy 100 chickens, feed for the chickens and two young pigs with this loan.  This is the group's first loan cycle and they hope to remain together for a long time.

Aura's goals are to enjoy good health and get ahead in her business.

loans.use: to buy 100 chickens, 2 young pigs and chicken feed

loans.name: Maluay De Curiquinga (Cuenca) Group

texts.es:
El banco comunal Maluay de Curiquinga está formado por 12 mujeres trabajadoras, luchadoras y muy alegres, nuestras socias  trabajan día a día para sacar adelante a sus familias y para mejorar la económica de sus hogares. Viven por la comunidad de Maluay que pertenece a la parroquia del Valle, esta parroquia es reconocida por la belleza de sus paisajes, su gente se dedica al comercio, cría de animales, agricultura y mucha de su población labora en diferentes áreas en la ciudad de Cuenca.

Una de las socias es la Señora María Eugenia vive por la comunidad de Maluay, tiene 24 años, es casada y fruto de su unión conyugal ha concebido 2 hijas de 3 y 1 año de edad. Su esposo labora como albañil, la casa en la que habita es de su propiedad.
 
La Señora. María Eugenia pasa al cuidado de sus hijos que aun son muy pequeños pero hay veces que le llaman para qué lave ropa ajena, esta actividad la realiza hace 4 años. 

Este es su primer crédito que realiza en el banco comunal al cual fue invitada por su suegra, con este crédito va a comprar pollos para iniciar con este negocio.
 
Sus sueños son que le vaya muy bien en sus proyectos, crecer en la cría de pollos y sacar  adelante a sus hijas.
texts.en:
The "Maluay de Curiquinga" community bank is made up of 12 hard-working, tenacious and very cheerful women.  Our members work daily to get their families ahead in life and improve the financial situation of their households.  They live in the community of Maluay which is located in El Valle parish.  This parish is well known for the beauty of its landscape.  The local people work in commerce, animal raising and farming.  Many also work in different parts of the city of Cuenca.

One of the members of this group is María Eugenia who lives in Maluay community.  She is 24 years old, married, and has two daughters aged 3 and 1 from her marriage.  Her husband works as a builder and they own the house in which they live.

María Eugenia looks after her children who are still very young.  However, there are occasions when people call on her to wash clothes for them.  She has been doing this for four years.

This is María Eugenia's first loan as a member of her community bank, which she was invited to join by her mother-in-law.  She will use this loan to buy chickens to start out in this business.  Her dreams are to be successful in her projects, to grow in her chicken-raising business and to get her daughters ahead in life.

loans.use: to buy chickens

loans.name: Sandra Aelizabeth

texts.es:
La Señoirita. Sandra es socia del banco comunal Los Talvos, vive por una comunidad aledaña a la parroquia del Valle, este lugar es de clima frió y nos regala una hermosa vista de sus paisajes, su gente se dedica al comercio, cría de animales, agricultura y mucha de su gente labora en la ciudad de Cuenca en diferentes áreas de trabajos.

La Señorita. Sandra tiene 19 años de edad, es soltera y vive con sus padres, su papá labora en una carpintería y su mamá se dedica a los quehaceres domésticos, la casa en la que habitan es de su propiedad.

Nuestra socia labora en el área de la costura, esta actividad lo aprendió trabajando, labora de lunes a viernes desde las 8 de la mañana hasta las 5 de la tarde y los sábados medio día.
 
Este es su segundo crédito que realiza en el banco comunal y lo va a invertir para pagar la entrada de una máquina de coser industrial.
 
Su meta es culminar sus estudios universitarios y llegar a ser Licenciada en Educación Física.
texts.en:
Sandra is a member of the 'Los Talvos' community bank.  She lives in a neighboring community, in El Valle parish.  This is a cold-climate area which affords us a beautiful view of the landscape.  The local people work in commerce, animal raising and farming.  Many people work in the city of Cuenca in various jobs.

Sandra is 19 years old, single, and lives with her parents.  Her dad works in a carpenter's workshop and her mom does the housework.  They own the house in which they live.

Sandra is in the sewing business.  She learned the trade on the job.  She works from Monday to Friday, from 8.00am to 5.00pm.  She works half day Saturdays.

This is Sandra's second loan through her community bank and she will invest it in making a down payment on an industrial sewing machine.

Sandra's goal is to finish her university course and get her degree in Physical Education.

loans.use: to make a down payment on an industrial sewing machine

loans.name: Narcisa De Jesús

texts.es:
La Señora. Narcisa es socia del banco comunal Los Talvos, vive por una comunidad aledaña a la parroquia del Valle, este lugar es de clima frió y nos regala una hermosa vista de sus paisajes, su gente se dedica al comercio, cría de animales, agricultura y mucha de su gente labora en la ciudad de Cuenca en diferentes áreas de trabajos.

Doña Narcisa tiene 31 años, es madre soltera de 2 hijos de 14 y 9 años de edad, su primer hijo está estudiando en el colegio y su segundo hijo en una escuelita de la ciudad. La casa en la que vive es propia siendo el sacrificio de su trabajo.

La Señora. Narcisa labora como empleada domestica, este trabajo lo ejerce hace un año, trabaja de lunes a viernes todo el día y los sábados medio día. En su casa se dedica a la cría de gallinas y cerdos a los que los vende en su propia comunidad.

Se encuentra en su tercer crédito que realiza en el banco comunal y lo va a invertir en la compra de materiales de construcción para terminar su casa.

Su meta es terminar su casa ya que aun le hacen falta algunos acabados.
texts.en:
Ms. Narcisa is a member of the Los Talvos communal bank. She lives in a community near the Del Valle parish, where the climate is cold and the landscape provides beautiful views. The people there work in trade, animal husbandry, and agriculture, and many people work various jobs in the city of Cuenca.

Narcisa is 31 years old. She is a single mother with two children who are 14 and 9 years old. Her first son is studying in high school and her younger son is in a little school in the city. The house they live in is her own thanks to her work and sacrifice.

Narcisa has been working as a domestic employee for one year. She works all day from Monday to Friday and a half-day on Saturdays. At home, she also raises chickens and pigs, which she sells in her community.

This is the third loan she has taken out through the communal bank and she is going to invest it in construction materials to finish her house.

Her goal is to finish her house as it is still missing a few things.

loans.use: to buy construction materials

loans.name: Laydy Marlene

texts.es:
La Señora. Laydy es socia del banco comunal Los Talvos, vive por una comunidad aledaña a la parroquia del Valle, este lugar es de clima frió y nos regala una hermosa vista de sus paisajes, su gente se dedica al comercio, cría de animales, agricultura y mucha de su gente labora en la ciudad de Cuenca en diferentes áreas de trabajos.

La Señora. Laydy tiene 21 años, es casada y fruto de su unión conyugal ha concebido una hija de 3 meses de edad. Su esposo labora como albañil, la casa en la que viven es propia. 

Nuestra socia trabaja en un gabinete de belleza, es profesional y esta actividad la aprendió en tres años ya que estudio en una academia, trabaja de lunes a sábados desde las 9 de la mañana hasta las 7 de la noche.
 
Este es su primer crédito que realiza en el banco comunal al cual fue invitada por su suegra, su crédito lo va a invertir para comprar algunos  materiales e instrumentos de belleza para iniciar con su propio gabinete.
 
Su meta es  llegar a tener su propio gabinete y continuar con sus estudios.
texts.en:
Sra. Laydy is a member of the Communal Bank “Los Talvos” and lives in a community next to El Valle Parish. This place has cold weather and picturesque views. The people engage in trade, raising animals, and agriculture. However, many of them also work in the city of Cuenca in various jobs.

Sra. Laydy is 21 years old, married, and has a three-month-old daughter. Her husband works as a mason. They live in their own home.

Laydy works in a beauty salon as a professional stylist. She learned her trade three years ago at an academy. Laydy works Monday through Saturday from 9am to 7pm.

She was invited to join the Communal Bank by her mother-in-law and is now taking out her first loan. The money will be invested in the purchase of a few materials and beauty implements so that she can start her own salon. Her goals are to open her own salon and to continue with her studies.

loans.use: to purchase supplies and beauty implements.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To pay for textiles.

loans.name: Najah

texts.en: Najah is a 60-year-old divorced woman who has started a small retail business at home selling clothes. She started her business to support her by having a good basic monthly income to help her pay her home rental fees. Now Najah has been in the business for four years and is happy that she became one of the productive hard working women in society. That’s why she decided to expand her business and open her own store in the future. In order to do that, Najah has applied for this loan to increase her capital base, which will allow her to buy a more fashionable collection of clothes.

loans.use: To buy more fashionable collections of clothes to sell

loans.name: Ikhlas

texts.en: Ikhlas is a 50-year-old woman who started a small retail business at home 11 years ago to help her retired husband support their family of nine sons and daughters. Ikhlas’ business is based on selling different products such as cosmetic materials, cleaning products, and even clothes. From the profit she earned besides her husband retirement salary, they were able to raise their children properly and send them to school. And because of her good reputation in the neighborhood, she was able to keep on going for the last 11 years of business, Now Ikhlas wants to expand her business and open a small retail store that would be more accessible to others.

loans.use: To open a small retail store

loans.name: Fedaa

texts.en: Fedaa is a 26-year-old young mother of two children. Her husband Suhail is an air conditioning technician. Since they are a small young family, Fedaa decided to start a small business that could help her husband and her family have a good respectable life. She started her business five years ago selling clothes at home. Fedaa is hoping that one day she will be able to open her own boutique. To do that, she has applied for this loan as a start to add more new fashionable items to the products she sells.

loans.use: To buy more new fashionable items to sell

loans.name: Rania

texts.en: Rania is a 31-year- old mother. She is married to Haitham and has three beautiful girls. Rania is also a governmental employee at the Ministry of Education. Her husband Haitham started his own business two years ago selling gas drums that are used mostly for cooking purposes. In order to help her husband, Rania has decided to apply for a loan to help him pursue his dream and open his own gas agency. Because Rania is a conservative person, she requested that her husband appear in the picture instead of her.

loans.use: To help her husband open his own gas retail agency

loans.name: Suhailah

texts.en: Suhaila is a 46-year-old woman who has started a small retail business at home buying and selling different types of cover sheets such as blankets. It has been four years now since she started. During these four years, she was able to help her husband who is a bus driver support the family of seven members including them. Suhaila has applied for this loan to buy other types of blankets that her customers requested, so she can continue to keep them as loyA. customers.

loans.use: To buy other types of blankets and cover sheets to sell

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To pay for ready-made textile items to sell.

loans.name: Raed

texts.en: Raed is a 38-year-old man who has retired from the military. He is married to Manar, a nutrition specialist who works at the Ministry of Health. They have three daughters. Raed opened a small store a year ago to sell food products. To get more customers, he needs to add more types of food products and wants to have a section to make tea and coffee. That's why he applied for this loan.

loans.use: To add a section for drinks in his food store

loans.name: Fannie

texts.en:
This is 28-year-old Fannie. She is married to a petty trader and has three children age 4, 6 and 14 years. 

In 2001, Fannie established her used clothing business. She began her business because she was brought up by her aunt who did not let her go school because she is a prominent trader so everyone in her care must sell. Therefore, Fannie became a good trader. 

When she got married, her husband helped her with some funds to start her own business. Working seven days a week and 10 hours a day, she earns about SLL 650,000 every month from this business. 

She would like a loan in the amount of SLL 3,000,000. Fannie has already received and successfully repaid one loan, and now she requires a new loan in order to buy one bale of used tops at SLL 700,000, one bale of girls dresses at SLL 750,000, one or two bales of dresses for toddlers at SLL 750,000. 

She hopes that this loan will enable her to increase her monthly profits by approximately SLL 200,000. 

In the future, Fannie plans to be a supplier to retailers who move to villages on market days. 

Her challenges include transport costs, price inflation and rains that sometimes stop customers from coming to the stall and even prevent her from hanging the items for display.  

Fannie plans to help her husband with some money to build a house for the family and open another stall for her nephew, who will be coming to stay with them. She is very much interested to visit the holy land, Mecca. 

She wants to continue accessing loans because they lead her to do better things in the future and make good profits. She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: To pay for assorted used clothing.

loans.name: Raeda

texts.en:
Raeda is a 28-year-old housewife. She is married to Emad, a soldier in the military and has a son and a daughter. Raeda is known for her quiet character that is reflected in the business she started, arranging artificial flowers. It has been two years now since she started her business at home. When her husband is not on duty, he helps her to deliver a good quality of service to their customers. During these two years, Raeda has find that importing the materials she is using from outside Jordan is much cheaper for her. So she has applied for a loan to be able to import new material that could add a new flavor to the works of art she makes.

And because Raeda is a conservative person, she requested that her husband appear in the picture instead of her.

loans.use: to import new flower-arranging materials

loans.name: Muhsin

texts.en: Muhsin is a 33-year-old hardworking man who started at a young age by opening a small buffet selling different kind of drinks such as coffee, tea, and juice. It has been 10 years now since he started, and through those years, he was able to add a new line to the buffet selling some snacks such as biscuits and noodles. Now Muhsin want to expand his business and add more food products to his buffet. That's why he applied for this loan.

loans.use: To expand his business and add more food products to his buffet

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To pay for bales of used shoes and crates of water.

loans.name: Mariatu

texts.en:
This is 30-years-old Mariatu. She is married to a petty trader and has three children age 4, 7 and 12 years. 

In 1996, Mariatu established her business in used clothing: underwear, dresses, trousers and skirts. She began her business because she decided to marry after the war when things were very hard for her parents.  

Working six days a week and 10 hours a day, she earns about SLL 900,000 every month from this business. 

She would like a loan in the amount of SLL 5,000,000. Mariatu has already received and successfully repaid one loan, and now she requires a new loan in order to pay for four bales of dresses at SLL 450,000, two bales of skirts at SLL 600,000 and two bales of trousers at SLL 500,000 and three bales of underwear at SLL 300,000.  

She hopes that this loan will enable her to increase her monthly profits by approximately SLL 200,000. 

In the future, Mariatu plans to educate her children to college level and visit the holy land, Mecca, some day. 

She is well known because of the type of items she is selling, which are in high demand. Mariatu is hard-working and honest. She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: To pay for four bales of dresses at SLL 450,000, two bales of skirts at SLL 600,000 and two bales of trousers at SLL 500,000 and three bales of underwear at SLL 300,000.

loans.name: Mariatu J.l.

texts.en:
Mariatu, age 41, sells grocery items such as bagged rice, milk, butter, beverages, five-gallon containers of oil, batteries, cosmetics, and soaps. She established her business in 2003. She had left school and got married, and her husband urged her to start a business to help provide a livelihood for their family. Working six days a week and 10 hours a day, she earns about Le 1,300,000 every month. 

Mariatu is requesting a loan in the amount of Le 5,000,000. She has already received and successfully repaid three loans, and now requires a new loan in order to purchase cartons of maggi, bags of rice, crates of eggs, containers of oil, and cartons of paste. She is confident that this loan will enable her to increase her monthly profits by approximately Le 200,000. 

In the future, Mariatu plans to increase business by opening another shop, hiring workers, traveling to Guinea where she will serve as a supplier, and adding basic pharmacy items to her inventory. She plans to gain a larger number of customers, particularly for rice.  

Mariatu and her husband have two children, ages seven and 13. She has five additional dependents who live with her because they are relatives from both her own and her husband's sides of the family, and she and her husband support these dependents in their senior secondary schooling. 

Mariatu is a hard-working and reliable entrepreneur. She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to purchase cartons of maggi, bags of rice, crates of eggs, containers of oil, and cartons of paste to stock in her store

loans.name: Mariatu

texts.en:
This is 30-year-old Mariatu.  She is married to a driver and has two children aged one and 14 who are both school-going children. She has one additional dependent, who lives with her because she is her sister and she has opted to take care of her throughout her schooling.

In 2009, Mariatu established her cooking utensils and foodstuffs business selling dishes, plastic buckets and palm oil. She began her business because she was brought up by her elder sister who trained her to do business.  When she got married her husband helped her get started with a business.  Working six days a week and eight hours a day, she earns about Le 800,000 every month from this business. 

Mariatu would like a loan in the amount of Le 3,000,000. She has already received and successfully repaid one loan, and now requires a new loan in order to pay for dishes - 8 cartons @ Le 160,000, plastic buckets - 3 doz @ Le 90,000 and palm oil  (50 gallons) @ Le26,000. She hopes that this loan will enable her to increase her monthly profits by approximately Le 200,000. 

In the future, Mariatu plans to export palm oil and open a big shop in the business district of Makeni and educate her children to university level. Her challenges are the rainy season and the rise of transportation costs and inflation. She is hard-working and honest. She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: To pay for household utensils - ishes - 8 cartons @ Le 160,000, plastic buckets - 3 doz @ Le 90,000 and palm oil  (50 gallons) @ Le26,000.

loans.name: Rehema's Group

texts.en:
Rehema‘s group is comprised of five hard-working young women. Rehema is 21 years old and lives in the town of Lugazi in the Mukono region of Uganda.  She is married and has three children.  One of her children is currently in school.  Rehema has a business selling food, which she has had for three years.  She has a small retail shop that sells sugar.  

To help expand her business, Rehema has requested a loan of 450,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda.  The loan will be used to purchase food for resale.  With the help of the loan from BRAC, Rehema hopes to generate greater profits and buy new clothes for herself.  In the future, Rehema hopes to build a house for herself. 

Rehema is a member of BRAC’s Empowerment and Livelihood for Adolescents (ELA) program, which has helped her prospects for the future by improving her business with capital that helped her buy four cows of her own.

loans.use: to purchase food for resale.

loans.name: Aisha

texts.en:
Aisha is 19 years old and lives in the town of Lugazi in the Mukono region of Uganda.  She is single and has no children. Aisha has a business selling food, which she has had for two years.         

To help expand her business, Aisha has requested a loan of 350,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda.  The loan will be used to purchase food for resale.  With the help of the loan from BRAC, Aisha hopes to generate greater profits and buy new clothes for herself.  In the future, Aisha hopes to build a house for herself.  

Aisha is a member of BRAC’s Empowerment and Livelihood for Adolescents (ELA) program, which has helped her prospects for the future by improving her business.

loans.use: to purchase food for resale.

loans.name: Justine's Group

texts.en:
Justine‘s group is comprised of three hard-working young women. Justine is 16 years old and lives in the town of Lugazi in the Kampala central region of Uganda.  She is single and has no children. Justine has a business selling food, which she has had for less than one year.         

To help expand her business, Justine has requested a loan of 300,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda.  The loan will be used to purchase food for resale.  With the help of the loan from BRAC, Justine hopes to generate greater profits and buy food for her family.  In the future, Justine hopes to become a doctor after her studies.

Justine is a member of BRAC’s Empowerment and Livelihood for Adolescents (ELA) program, which has helped her prospects for the future by improving her business.

loans.use: to purchase food for resale.

loans.name: Esther's Group

texts.en:
Esther‘s group is comprised of two hard-working young women. Esther is 21 years old and lives in the town of Lugazi in the Mukono region of Uganda.  She is single and has no children. Esther has a small retail shop that sells sugar, which she has had for two years.  She has a poultry farm as her secondary business.  

To help expand her business, Esther has requested a loan of 400,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda.  The loan will be used to purchase essential goods like sugar for resale.  With the help of the loan from BRAC, Esther hopes to generate greater profits and buy new clothes for herself.  In the future, Esther hopes to own a boutique that sells clothes.  

Esther is a member of BRAC’s Empowerment and Livelihood for Adolescents (ELA) program, which has helped her prospects for the future by improving her business.

loans.use: to purchase essential goods like sugar for resale.

loans.name: Irene

texts.en:
Irene is 20 years old and lives in the town of Lugazi in the Mukono region of Uganda.  She is married and has one child.  Her child is not currently in school.  Irene has a business selling clothes, which she has had for less than one year.         

To help expand her business, Irene has requested a loan of 300,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda.  The loan will be used to purchase clothes for resale.  With the help of the loan from BRAC, Irene hopes to generate greater profits and buy new clothes for herself.  In the future, Irene hopes to own a wholesale shop.  

Irene is a member of BRAC’s Empowerment and Livelihood for Adolescents (ELA) program, which has helped her prospects for the future by improving her business.

loans.use: to purchase clothes for resale.

loans.name: Amelita

texts.en:
Amelita is 44 years old and is a married woman with a 13-year-old child. She is a farmer and tills their land together with her husband. They have been growing and selling rice for 11 years. Amelita also put up a sari-sari store to help augment their income.

Amelita is now requesting a loan to purchase seeds, fertilizers and more items to sell at the store. She hopes to be able to buy another farm lot in the future.

loans.use: to purchase seeds, fertilizers and more items to sell at her store.

loans.name: Ana Marie

texts.en:
Ana Marie is 28 years old and is a married woman with four children. Her eldest child is 13 years old.

Married at a young age, Ana Marie did her best to help her husband in providing for their household needs. Now, she helps her husband till the land where they grow rice crops. She also runs a small sari-sari store business where she sells items like vinegar, soy sauce, eggs and others.

Ana Marie is requesting a loan to purchase seeds, fertilizers and other farm inputs. She hopes this loan will help improve their harvest. She also hopes for her children to have bright futures.

loans.use: to purchase seeds, fertilizers and other farm inputs.

loans.name: Prossy's Group

texts.en:
Prossys‘s group is comprised of four hard-working women. Prossys is 20 years old and lives in the town of Nasana in the Kampala central region of Uganda.  She is married and has two children.  One of her children is currently in school.  Prossy has a beauty salon, which she has had for two years.  She sells food as her secondary business.  

To help expand her business, Prossy has requested a loan of 300,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda.  The loan will be used to purchase braids for the hair for resale.  With the help of the loan from BRAC, Prossy hopes to generate greater profits and pay school fees for her children.  In the future, Prossy hopes to expand her business. 

Prossy is a member of BRAC’s Empowerment and Livelihood for Adolescents (ELA) program, which has helped her prospects for the future by expanding her capital that has helped her pay school fees for her child.

loans.use: to purchase braids for the hair for resale.

loans.name: Sarah

texts.en:
Sarah is 21 years old and lives in the town of Nasana in the Kampala central region of Uganda.  She is married and has one child.  Her child is not currently in school.  Sarah has a business selling shoes, which she has had for one year.         

To help expand her business, Sarah has requested a loan of 400,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda.  The loan will be used to purchase shoes for resale.  With the help of the loan from BRAC, Sarah hopes to generate greater profits and buy new clothes for herself.  In the future, Sarah hopes to expand her business.        

Sarah is a member of BRAC’s Empowerment and Livelihood for Adolescents (ELA) program, which has helped her prospects for the future by improving her business.

loans.use: to purchase shoes for resale.

loans.name: Belinda

texts.en:
Belinda is 42 years old and married with three children. She is a farmer who grows rice in Banga, South Cotabato. Belinda sells her crop to rice traders. She also raises pigs in her backyard to sell at her town’s market.

Belinda is requesting a loan to purchase seed, fertilizer, and feed. In the future, she hopes to have a stable income to help support her children’s education.

loans.use: to purchase seed, fertilizer, and feed

loans.name: Charlene

texts.en:
Charlene is 25 years old and is married with two children ages five and seven. She is a farmer who grows rice and vegetables to sell at market. Charlene works with her husband to till their land in Banga, South Cotabato. She works hard to support her family. 

Charlene is requesting a loan to purchase seed, fertilizer, and other farm inputs. In the future, she hopes to improve her family’s house.

loans.use: to purchase seed, fertilizer, and farm inputs

loans.name: Mercy's Group

texts.en:
Mercy is 17 years old and lives in the town of Zanna in the Kampala Central Region of Uganda. She is single and has no children. Mercy runs a business selling vegetables and fruits, which she has had for less than a year. 

Mercy is a member of a loan group comprised of three hardworking women. She is also a member of BRAC’s Empowerment and Livelihood for Adolescents (ELA) program, which has helped her prospects for the future by improving her business.   

Mercy is requesting a loan of 250,000 UGX from BRAC Uganda to purchase vegetables and fruit to sell. With the help of her loan, she hopes to generate greater profits and buy food for her family.  In the future, Mercy hopes to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase vegetables and fruit to sell

loans.name: Evelyn

texts.en:
Evelyn is 48 years old and a widow with a seven-year-old child. For the past 12 years, she has been a farmer, growing rice, corn, and cassava at her farm. Evelyn works hard to improve her business and save for her child’s future. 

Evelyn is requesting a loan to purchase seedlings, fertilizer, and herbicide. In the future, she hopes to increase her earnings and improve her family’s house.

loans.use: to purchase seedlings, fertilizer and herbicide

loans.name: Kenneth Joy

texts.en:
Kenneth Joy is 23 years old and is a married woman with a two-year-old child. She and her husband are both farmers and have been growing and selling rice for six years.

Kenneth Joy is requesting a loan to purchase seed, fertilizer, and other farm inputs. This loan will help Kenneth Joy and her husband achieve an abundant harvest.

loans.use: to purchase seed, fertilizer, and farm inputs

loans.name: Laarnie

texts.en: Laarnie, a 21-year-old married woman with an eight-month-old child, is a farmer who, along with her husband, has been growing rice for five years. Laarnie, who does her best to improve their income and save for the future, is requesting a loan to purchase four sacks of rice seeds and three sacks of fertilizers. She hopes to have a bigger farm in the future.

loans.use: to purchase 4 sacks of rice seeds and 3 sacks of fertilizers.

loans.name: Meriecris

texts.en:
Meriecris is 32 years old and married. She has two children aged 3 and 7. Her husband works as a farmer and a technician.

Meriecris is a farmer who works in the town of Banga, South Cotabato. She grows rice and vegetables to sell. Meriecris requested a loan to purchase seedlings, fertilizers and other farm inputs. She hopes to own a bigger farm in the future.

loans.use: to purchase seedlings, fertilizers and other farm inputs.

loans.name: Nimfa

texts.en:
Nimfa is 50 years old and is a married woman with two children aged 23 and 21. She earns a living through farming. Nimfa primarily grows rice to sell. She has been in this business for 10 years now. Nimfa said she earns about 10,000 PHP per month from farming. Nimfa works hard to support her family and her children's education. 

Nimfa is requesting a loan to purchase seeds and fertilizers. She hopes to achieve an abundant harvest.

loans.use: to purchase seeds and fertilizers.

loans.name: Walter

texts.en:
Walter is a 38-year-old married man with two children. His children are 19 and 17 years old.

Walter is a hard-working farmer. He tills a plot of land located in Banga, South Cotabato. He grows rice, corn and vegetables and sells his harvest at his town’s market. Walter is now requesting a loan to purchase seeds, fertilizers and insecticides. Walter hopes to have a stable business. He also desires to see his children finish college and succeed.

loans.use: to purchase seeds, fertilizers and insecticides.

loans.name: Christine's Group

texts.en:
Christine‘s group is comprised of three hard-working young women. Christine is 18 years old and lives in the town of Kyengera in the Kampala central region of Uganda.  She is single and has no children. Christine has a beauty salon, which she has had for five years.         

To help expand her business, Christine has requested a loan of 350,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda.  The loan will be used to purchase braids for the hair for resale.  With the help of the loan from BRAC, Christine hopes to generate greater profits and pay her school fees.  In the future, Christine hopes to become an accountant after her studies.

 Christine is a member of BRAC’s Empowerment and Livelihood for Adolescents (ELA) program, which has helped her prospects for the future by improving her business so she has enough capital which has helped her pay her school fees.

loans.use: to purchase braids for the hair for resale.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To pay for bowls and pans for resale.

loans.name: Prince

texts.en:
This is 43-year-old Prince. He is married to a trader and has two children age 4 and 10 years. 

In 1990, Prince established his essential drugs business. He began his business because after his fifth form his parents did not have enough money to pay for his education. He decided to move in with a friend who was trading in essential drugs, and he lived with him for half a year. Later the friend helped him with some drugs and some money to start on his own. 

His business is located in a popular area. Working six days a week and 10 hours a day, Prince earns about SLL 1,000,000 every month from this business. 

He would like a loan in the amount of SLL 5,000,000. Prince requires a loan in order to buy six cartons of syrups at SLL 200,000, four cartons of panadol at SLL 100,000, four cartons of antibiotic tablets at SLL 150,000, 10 cartons of drips at SLL 50,000. 

He hopes that this loan will enable him to increase his monthly profits by approximately SLL 200,000. 

In the future, Prince plans to open a pharmacy and hire pharmacist to run a small clinic, construct a dwelling house and educate his children to university level.   

Transportation costs and inflation on prices are his business challenges.

loans.use: To pay for essential drugs.

loans.name: Huzainatu G.

texts.en:
This is 35-year-old Huzainatu. She is married to an education secretary and has four children ages five, nine, 10 and 12. All of her children attend school. In 2001, Huzainatu established a business selling soft drinks. She began her business because she learned from her mother how to attract customers and make good bargains. Working 10-hour-days, seven days a week, she earns about 1,000,000 SLL each month. Huzainatu travels by public transportion twice every month to buy her stock.

Huzainatu is requesting a 5,000,000 SLL loan to buy assorted soft drinks to sell. She will buy 200 crates of soft drinks to increase her monthly profit by approximately 300,000 SLL. Huzainatu has successfully repaid two previous loans. In the future, Huzainatu plans to continue to expand her business and generate more income to support her children’s education and give them a better future. She also plans to save some of her profit and reinvest it into her business as she accesses more loans.  

Huzainatu thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to buy assorted soft drinks to sell

loans.name: Mama

texts.en:
This is 50-year-old Mama. She is a widow and has three children, aged 30, 32 and 38 years. Mama has one additional dependent who lives with her because she assists her with her schooling.  

In 2001, Mama established her palm oil and African costumes business. She began her business after gaining enough experience from her late husband.  They were doing business together until he died. Then she started her own business to help her support her children.  

Working six days a week and eight hours a day, she earns about SLL 1,100,000 every month from this business. 

She would like a loan in the amount of SLL 3,000,000. Mama has already received and successfully repaid one loan, and now requires a new loan in order to purchase 20 40-gallon containers of palm oil at SLL 100,000 and 20 suits of cotton textiles at SLL 40,000. 

She hopes that this loan will enable her to increase her monthly profits by approximately SLL 250,000. 

In the future, Mama plans to build a house. She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to pay for palm oil and textiles.

loans.name: Zainab A.

texts.en: This is 34-year-old Zainab.  She is married and has three children aged 5, 14 and 18 years. All of them are school-going children. She has three additional dependents who live with her because they are her brother's children. She takes cares of them like her own children. In 2007, Zainab established her ready-made ladies and gents wear business. She began her business because she wanted to be self-reliant and able to provide a livelihood for her family. Working seven days a week and eight hours a day, she earns about Le 1,000,000 every month from this business. She would like a loan of Le 5,000,000.  Zainab  has already received and successfully repaid one loan and now requires a new loan to buy jeans - 3 doz @ Le35,000, Snickers - 10 doz @ Le35,000, Office shirts - 10 doz @ Le37,000, Ladies Bags 8 - doz @ Le35,000. She hopes that this loan will enable her to increase her monthly profits by approximately Le 250,000.  In the future, Zainab plans to import and open another business center so that she can employ more people and  give her children a quality education for them to be very good citizens. She treats the customers she serves in the entire Makeni town as special.  A reasonable amount of people visit her shop every day because she has good products. She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: To buy more ladies and gents wear to sell

loans.name: Rubie

texts.en: This is 38-year-old Rubie. She is married to a petty trader and has one child who is 14 years old. In 1996, Rubie established her assorted textiles - cotton, lace and ready-made bags business. She began her business because she needed to help her husband provide a livelihood for their family. Working 6 days a week and 10 hours a day, she earns about Le Le900,000 every month from this business. She would like a loan of Le Le5, 000,000. Rubie has already received and successfully repaid one loan, and now requires a new loan to purchase one bale of wax cotton @ Le1,900,00, two bales of local cotton @ Le1200,000 and 40 bags @ Le30,000. She hopes that this loan will enable her to increase her monthly profits by approximately Le Le200,000. In the future, Rubie plans to travel to Dubai for modern designs, quality and lower cost of her products.  She wants to educate her children and become a supplier to retailers in the surrounding villages. She is hard working and honest. She thanks you for your support

loans.use: To purchase textiles to sell

loans.name: Kimly

texts.en:
Kimly is a mason, while his wife stays at home and does house work. They live along National Road Number Five about 20 kilometers from Phnom Penh. They have two sons and two daughters. One is married and lives outside the family home, two are garment workers and another one is in school.

Kimly is asking for a loan of $1,000 to build a new house and pay for house moving fees. Because the house where he lives is located on his parents’ land, he wants to move to his own land. 

Hence he decided to apply for a loan to use for the purpose. 

Photo: Kimly and his wife.

loans.use: To build a new house and pay for house moving fees.

loans.name: Sa

texts.en:
Mr. Sa of Reussey Keo commune of Phnom Penh City is the head of the family. To support his family, Mr. Sa provides a motorcycle taxi service to passengers who live in and around his community.  He earns about $5 each day. His wife is a homemaker and she stays at home to care for her children.

To generate more income, two of his children have found jobs in Phnom Penh as sewing workers.  This job would afford them the opportunity to earn a monthly salary.  He would like his children to be able to move in with him so they can be close to work in Phnom Penh, but his house is too small for them to live in.  He would like to request a loan to build a new room for his family members to live in.  With any remaining part of the loan, he will support his son-in-law's business.

loans.use: to build a new room and also support his son-in-law’s business.

loans.name: Somaly

texts.en:
Somaly is a widow mother with one son and two daughters. She lives in a village along National Road Number Five about 17 kilometers from Phnom Penh City.

Somaly transferred her grocery store to her daughter because she has full-time employment. Previously, she requested a loan to buy a motorcycle and her daughter uses that motorbike for commuting and to carry grocery items from market to home. 

Hence Somaly decided to apply for another loan of $1,200 to buy one more motorbike to drive to work.  

Photo: Somaly is standing in her daughter’s grocery store.

loans.use: To purchase a motorbike to drive to work.

loans.name: Man

texts.en:
Man (pictured with her daughter) sells vegetables and fish. She has nine children, five sons and four daughters. Three are married and live in separate homes, five are garment workers and another is a security guard. They live on an island in the Mekong River about 15 kilometers from Phnom Penh City. 

Man is asking for a loan of $1,000 to purchase a motorbike for her children to drive to work.

loans.use: To purchase a motorbike for her children to drive to work.

loans.name: Sengkun

texts.en:
Sengkun, pictured here, is a weaver. She lives on an island in the Mekong River about 15 kilometers from Phnom Penh City. She has three sons and one daughter. Two of her children are married and live outside the family home, one child is a garment worker, and another one weaves silk at home. 

Sengkun is requesting a 600 USD loan to purchase silk materials to continue her weaving business, which is a traditional profession. This will be her second loan.

loans.use: to purchase silk material

loans.name: Bora

texts.en:
Bora and his wife, Soda, are teachers in the same village high school. They have been married since 1992 and have three daughters. The family lives on an island in the Mekong River about 15 kilometers from Phnom Penh City.

Bora is requesting a loan of 1,000 USD to purchase a motorcycle for commuting and teaching. In this photo, Bora is standing next to the motorbike that he wants to buy from his neighbor. He does not yet have the money and is therefore asking for a loan to purchase the motorcycle.

loans.use: to purchase a motorcycle for commuting

loans.name: Vibol

texts.en: We know that most of the people in Cambodia work as farmers. Some are poor but not all, because some of them are rich. Mrs. Vibol is also a farmer. Everyday she and her husband always go to the farm and take care it. The outcome is that she could earn more per year. Both of them get a profit of  about $8 per day. Although they live in the country, they live in happiness. Both of them birthed three kids. For living in a modern family, she requests a loan of $1,200 to buy a pumping machine.

loans.use: to buy a pumping machine.

loans.name: Yary

texts.en:
Yary is 36 years old. She is pictured here with her husband, Saveun, who is 33 years old. The couple lives in a village across the Mekong River about 17 kilometers from Phnom Penh City. They have three children, two sons and one daughter, who all attend school. Yary is a construction worker and her husband is a mason. Yary wants to quit construction work and launch a new business selling sugarcane juice. 

Yary is requesting a 1,000 USD loan of to buy a sugarcane juicing machine. She will also use a part of her loan to build a restroom for family use.

loans.use: to buy a sugarcane juicing machine and build a family restroom

loans.name: Sa Um

texts.en:
Sa um, pictured here, weaves scarves and also assists her husband in his farming business. Her husband grows corn, banana, papaya and yams. The couple lives on an island in the Mekong River about 15 kilometers from Phnom Penh City. They have seven children, four sons and three daughters. 

Sa um is requesting a 1,000 USD loan to renovate her house.

loans.use: to renovate her house

loans.name: Midy

texts.en:
Midy, 32, is a farmer. He has been married since 2007 and has no children yet. He lives in a village along National Road Number One, about fifteen kilometers from Phnom Penh City. 

Midy is asking for his first loan of $1,000 to repair his tractor because it breaks down.

loans.use: To repair his tractor.

loans.name: Helen

texts.en:
