Helen is married with five children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. Helen is 48 years old and has five children who are in school.

Helen has a fishing business in the Philippines. Helen requested a PHP 25,000 loan through NWTF to purchase a new engine for her fishing boat.

Helen has been in this business for 10 years. In the future, Helen would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase a new engine for her fishing boat

loans.name: Jocelyn

texts.en:
Jocelyn is 45 years old and married with six children.

Jocelyn works hard to provide for her family. She runs a sari-sari store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 20,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more stocks to sell.

Jocelyn has borrowed and paid back seven loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the sari-sari store for six years. She earns additional income from fishing.

Jocelyn aspires to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more stock to sell

loans.name: Ra

texts.en:
Ra, 25, sells grocery items, CDs, and VCDs. Her husband has full-time employment. She lives in a village along National Road Number Three about twenty kilometers from Phnom Penh City and has no children yet.     
 
Ra is asking for a loan of $1,000 to purchase additional grocery items, CDs, and VCDs for sale.

loans.use: To purchase additional grocery items, CDs, and VCDs for sale.

loans.name: Saron

texts.en:
Saron is 31 years old and his wife is 28 years old. They have been married since 2001 and have two children--one son and one daughter. One is in school and another in still young. They live along National Road Number Six, about seventeen kilometers from Phnom Penh City. 

Saron is a fisherman and assists his wife in their farming business. His wife is a lotus farmer. He is asking for a loan of $1,200 to purchase a boat and boat motor.

loans.use: To purchase a boat and boat motor.

loans.name: Prak

texts.en: Mr.Prak tries to do everything to feed the family and live in happiness. He thinks at night with his wife that he wishes to open a small business in his village to transport firewood to sell in his village. His wife plants crops. When she takes time away from farming, she always sells fish in one market near her village. Both of them earn about $6 per day. To earn a good living standard like the rich family near his house, Mr.Prak would like to ask for $300 for the purpose of purchasing a new motorbike.

loans.use: to purchase a new motorbike.

loans.name: Flora

texts.en:
Flora is married and has four children. She is 38 years old and lives in Triunfo, Ozamiz City, Misamis Occidental. To earn a living, Flora has a restaurant. Each month, she earns approximately 16,000 Philippine Pesos (PHP). 

Flora has requested a loan of 25,000 PHP to pay her children's tuition. Flora has been a member of PMPC for over two years. In the future, Flora would like her family to have a better standard of living.

loans.use: to pay her children's tuition

loans.name: Jose Renale

texts.en:
Jose Renale is single, 38 years old, and lives in Green Valley, Tinago, Ozamiz City, Misamis Occidental. He has had an Internet cafe for five years. Each month, he earns approximately 5,000 Philippine Pesos (PHP). 

Jose Renale has requested a loan of 15,000 PHP to purchase equipment upgrades for his business. 

Jose Renale has been a member of PMPC for over a year. In the future, Jose Renale hopes to expand his business.

loans.use: to purchase equipment upgrades for his business

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.en: Elizabeth is 42 years old, married, has five children and has made a living for the last four years by running a sari-sari (or variety) store. In her store, she sells soft drinks, snacks, eggs and other food items to people who live in her community. She usually earns about 4,000 PHP a month, and is applying for a loan for 15,000 PHP to buy more items to sell to her customers. In the future, she hopes to expand the size of her store, and earn enough money to send her children to college and help them find good jobs.

loans.use: to buy items such as as soft drinks, eggs, noodles and sugar to sell to her customers.

loans.name: Zenaida

texts.en:
Zenaida is married and has five children. She is 52 years old and lives in Dapitan City. 

Zenaida sells clothes to earn a living and has had this business for three years. Each month, she earns 4,000 Philippine Pesos (PHP) doing this type of work. She has requested a loan of 10,000 PHP to purchase clothing to sell. 

Zenaida has been a member of PMPC for three years.

loans.use: to purchase clothing for resale

loans.name: Ninfa

texts.en:
Ninfa is 50 years old and lives in La Libertad, gutalac, Zamboanga del Norte. She is a widow with two children. 

Ninfa catches and sells fish for living. This is her new business. She has requested a loan of 20,000 Philippine Pesos (PHP) to purchase fishing equipment for her fish cage. 

Ninfa has been a member of PMPC for just this year. In the future, Ninfa hopes to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase fishing equipment for her fish cage

location.town: La Libertad, Gutalac, Zamboanga del Norte

loans.name: Margielynne

texts.en:
At 33, Margielynne is married and has two children. She and her husband are farmers. They have been farming rice for 10 years now. 

She earns an average net income of 16,000 Philippine Pesos (PHP) every season during the months of April and November. Income generated from farming goes for school fees and basic needs at home. 

She is asking for a loan of 10,000 PHP to pay for labor and to purchase hybrid seeds for rice farming. 

In the future, Margielynne hopes to harvest consistent profits for her family's economic stability.

loans.use: to pay for labor and to purchase hybrid seeds for rice farming.

loans.name: Jose

texts.en:
Jose is 46 years old and is a married man with four children. The oldest child is 19 years old and the youngest is 9. 

Jose is a farmer who works a property in Trinidad, Bohol. He has been growing and selling rice for 20 years now. Jose earns about 6000 Philippine Pesos (PHP) per month from farming. Jose works hard to improve his family's living conditions. 

Jose is requesting a loan to purchase fertilizer and other farm inputs. He hopes to have his children finish college and be successful in their own fields.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizer and other farm inputs

loans.name: Cynthia

texts.en:
Cynthia is married with one child. She is 41 and lives in Ozamis City. 

Cynthia sells spare parts, specifically chainsaw parts, and has had this business for 14 years. Each month, she earns 5000 Philippine Pesos (PHP) doing this type of work. She has requested a loan of 20,000 PHP to purchase more spare parts for chainsaws. 

Cynthia has been a member of PMPC for two years.

loans.use: to purchase spare parts for chainsaws

loans.name: Josephine

texts.en: Josephine is 25 years old, married and has a 12-year-old daughter. Her husband makes a living as a farmer while she earns an income by running a manicure/pedicure business. She has been in this line of work for the last five years and earns about 5,000 PHP a month. In her free time, she also helps her husband run their farm, where they grow rice. She is applying for a loan to buy manicure materials such as nail polish and tools as well as fertilizer for her farm. She hopes to expand her businesses and have a more stable income in the future.

loans.use: to buy supplies for a farm and a manicure/pedicure business.

loans.name: Jelly

texts.en: Jelly is married with 4 children. She is 52 years old and lives in the Philippines. Jelly is a farmer and grows corn to earn a living. She has been doing this for 15 years. She has requested a loan for 10,000 PHP to purchase spare parts for her motorcycle. Jelly has been a member of PMPC for 3 years.

loans.use: to purchase spare parts for her motorcycle

loans.name: Lilibeth

texts.en:
This is Lilibeth, 39, a resident of Payatas, Quezon City, Philippines. She is married to Rufo who is a driver. She is a mother of four children, three of whom are in high school, while the youngest is in elementary school. By the grace of God, Lilibeth has managed to support her older children's schooling; a dream for most poor Filipino parents like Lilibeth as she herself has only been a high school graduate. She believes that a college diploma is the best inheritance parents could leave to their children.

Lilibeth operates a "buy and sell" business. What she basically does is buy general merchandise from wholesalers, then sell the items with a small profit. Products can range from furniture to household appliances, electronic devices and other items of the like. Customers are attracted due to the low selling prices and the many options they are offered. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community. She earns a minimum of 4,500 PHP in sales every week.

To help her continue operations of her business, she is requesting a 27,000 PHP loan. She will be utilizing the loan to buy more quantities and varieties of products to expand her product inventory. She expects a boost in her business income as she expands her business.  

Lilibeth dreams to be able to give her all her children a good and high quality education through all her hard work on her business. She also hopes to have her house renovated by the end of the year. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship members* to share stories of her work every week.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: To pay for appliances and electronic items that she sells in her business

loans.name: Marife

texts.en:
This is Marife, 43, a resident of Payatas,Quezon City, Philippines. Single, she manages her own household while operating the business. At this time, she is working hard to continually provide income for her everyday expenses. 

Marife operates a variety store. In the Philippines, a variety store is basically a small convenience store, which retails groceries, toiletries and beverages to the local neighborhood. It is the place to go to buy one sachet of shampoo, 5 PHP-worth of cooking oil, or an egg. She also sells frozen food products like hotdogs and ham. Marife earns income by getting supplies at wholesale prices, then selling by the piece. Her store is located adjacent to her house. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community. She earns a minimum of 500 PHP in sales every day.

To help her continue operations of her business, she is requesting an 8,000 PHP loan. She will be utilizing the loan to buy groceries, toiletries and beverages to expand her product inventory. She expects a boost in her business income as she expands her business. 

Marife faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work every week and where she can also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: To pay for grocery items and other products needed in her business

loans.name: Analyne

texts.en: Analyne is 29 years old, married and has three children. As a farmer in the Philippines, she earns about PHP 50,000 per harvest season, which runs from May through October. For the last 10 years, her main crop has been rice. She would like to increase the size of her crop by securing a loan which will allow her to buy farm supplies such as seeds, fertilizer and insecticides. Her goal is to lift her family out of poverty and educate her children so that they can have a bright future.

loans.use: to buy farm supplies such as seeds, fertilizer and insecticides.

loans.name: Majelis Taqlim Group

texts.en:
Masyatie is 54 years old and has three children. She opened a grocery store in 2001. She borrowed 2,000,000 Indonesian Rupiah from VisionFund Indonesia to buy daily need items like eggs, rice, flour, cooking oil, etc. 

Up to now, with her grocery store, she has been able to send her children to school. She hopes she can expand her grocery store and continue to send her children to school through the university level.

loans.use: to stock daily needs like eggs, cooking oil, flour, etc.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase a new motorbike.

loans.name: Saidamad

texts.ru: Саидамад проживает в городе Куляб. Ему 49 лет. Он женат. У него пятеро детей. Его старший сын находится на заработках в Российской Федерации. Сам Саидамад имеет высшее педагогическое образование. По профессии проработал два года. На сегодняшний день он занимается торговлей. У него имеется магазин в центре города, где он продает продукты питания. В этой области он работает уже 6 лет. Кредит берет для покупки колбасных изделий, натуральных соков, муки и приобретения холодильника для торговли мороженного.
texts.en: Saidamad lives in the city of Kulob.  He is 49 years old, married and has five children.  His oldest son works in the Russian Federation.  Saidamad has a higher education as a teacher.  He spent two years working in his profession.  Today, he is involved in retail sales.  He has a store in the center of the city, where he sells food products.  He has been working in this field for six years.  He is requesting this loan for the purchase of sausage goods, natural juices, flour and a refrigerator, needed to sell ice-cream.

loans.use: to purchase sausage goods, natural juices, flour and a refrigerator

loans.name: Joseph

texts.en:
Joseph has a mixed farm in his hometown in eastern Kenya that produces milk, potatoes, maize and French beans. He has been in the farming business for 20 years now, selling all his farm produce at the local market. He employs one farmhand. He also depends on his pension pay to cater to the needs of his family. His major challenges in farming have been insufficient water for irrigation and pests and diseases that affect his production.

Joseph has made a loan request of 30,000 Kenyan shillings in order to cultivate french beans and cowpeas. He says that the income that will be generated from this project will enable him start a small grocery shop. He intends to acquire at least five dairy cows and an acre of land to expand his horticultural farming in the next five years. 

Joseph is 67 and a married father of four children who are all adults.

loans.use: To cultivate french beans and cow peas.

loans.name: Estrella

texts.en:
Estrella is 50 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married and has four children. 

Estrella has a shop that sells canned goods, beverages, & snacks. She has had this business for three years. She requested a loan for 10,000 Philippine Pesos (PHP) to buy more of the items she sells.

Estrella has been a member of HSPFI since 2010. In the future, Estrella hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, beverages & snacks

loans.name: John

texts.en:
John has been practicing mixed farming for 15 years in his hometown in eastern Kenya. His mixed farm produces cabbages, potatoes, maize and milk, which he sells to brokers. He earns additional income from his grocery shop in the same area. His biggest challenges have been pests and diseases, insufficient water for irrigation and a poor market for his farm produce.

John has made a loan request of 30,000 Kenyan shillings in order to cultivate potatoes and cabbages. He says that the income that will be generated from this project will enable him to pay school fees for his children. In the future, he plans to acquire more dairy cows and buy a chuff cutter that will enable him to expand his dairy farm.

John is 59 and married with three children who all attend school.

loans.use: To cultivate potatoes and cabbages.

loans.name: Silvestra

texts.en:
Silvestra is 54 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married and has nine children. 

Silvestra has a shop that sells snacks, detergents, & noodles. She has had this business for one year. She requested a loan of 5,000 Philippine Pesos (PHP) to buy canned goods, snacks & beverages. 

Silvestra joined HSPFI this year. In the future, Silvestra hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, snacks & beverages

loans.name: Eliseo

texts.en:
Eliseo is 47 years old and lives in the Philippines. He is a widower and has four children. 

Eliseo is providing motorcycle transport services (known as motorela or habal-habal services). He has had this business for two years. He requested a loan for 5,000 Philippine Pesos (PHP) to buy tools & pay for the utilities needed for the service. 

Eliseo has been a member of HSPFI since 2011. In the future, Eliseo hopes to improve his business.

loans.use: to buy tools & pay for the utilities needed for the service

loans.name: Aiza

texts.en:
Aiza is 19 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married and has one child. 

Aiza has a retail shop that sells snacks, beverages, & canned goods. She has had this business for one year. She requested a loan for 5,000 Philippine Pesos (PHP) to buy canned goods, beverages & snacks. 

Aiza is a new member of HSPFI. In the future, Aiza hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, beverages & snacks

loans.name: Abduvali

texts.ru: Абдували житель города Куляб. Ему 24 года. Он женат. Его жена домохозяйка. Сам Абдували имеет высшее экономическое образование. По профессии - не работает. На сегодняшний день он предоставляет услугу. У него имеется дилерский центр, где он пополняет балансы телефонов, продает мобильные телефоны, зарядные устройства и сим-карты. Этим видом деятельность он занимается пять лет. Кредит берет для покупки сим-карт, запасных частей мобильных телефонов и для приобретения новых моделей мобильных телефонов.
texts.en: Abduvali lives in the city of Kulob.  He is 24 years old and married.  His wife is a homemaker.  Abduvali has a higher education as an economist.  He does not work in that field.  Today, he provides a service.  He has a dealer center, where he refills mobile phone balances, sells mobile phones, chargers and SIM cards.  He has been involved in this business for five years.  Abduvali is requesting this loan for the purchase of SIM cards, spare parts for mobile phones and for the purchase of new mobile phones.

loans.use: to purchase SIM cards, spare parts for mobile parts and new mobile phones

loans.name: Nancy Hilay Group

texts.en: Nancy is 42 years old and lives in Pangalalan, Sindangan, Zamboanga del Norte. She is married, has five children and earns about PHP 2,000 a month by selling dried fish. She is applying for a loan for PHP 3,000 to buy more dried fish to sell. She has been a member of PMPC for three years and is committed to expand her business and improve her family's living conditions. Nancy leads a two-person loan group. Each member of the group is responsible for paying back entire loan should the other person not be able to make payments.

loans.use: to buy dried fish to sell to her customers.

loans.name: Jojen

texts.en: Jojen is 35 years old, separated from his wife and lives in the Philippines. For the last five years, he has made a living by providing transportation services. He is applying for a loan for PHP 5,000 to buy tools and pay utility bills. He is a new member of HSPFI, but is very committed to expand and improve his business.

loans.use: to buy tools and pay utility bills.

loans.name: Rose Marie

texts.en: Rose Marie is 33 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with two children. Rose Marie has a retail shop that sells rice by the kilogram and homemade sausage, or chorizo. She has had this business for five years. She requested a loan of 5,000 Philippine pesos (PHP) to buy rice by the kilogram and raw ingredients for homemade sausage. Rose Marie is a new member of HSPFI. In the future, Rose Marie hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy rice by the kilogram and raw ingredients for homemade sausage

loans.name: Hatem

texts.en:
This borrower is from Iraq. He is 58 years old, married and has three children.

Hatem has owned a food market since 2005, selling soft drinks, juices, sweets, cheese and dairy products. He has a deep understanding of local consumer needs. His market is situated in a crowded area so there are a good number of customers passing by. 

He is requesting a $2400 loan to buy two refrigerators and to add more foodstuffs for his market. He is aiming to gain more profits to improve his family’s quality of life.

loans.use: To buy two refrigerators and more foodstuffs to sell

loans.name: Laurah

texts.en: Laurah is a 38-year-old married woman with two children. She lives in her own house in Fort Portal, Uganda. She dreams of educating her children up to university level. For five years she has operated a retail shop, where her major challenge is the ever-increasing costs of commodities and power. She has a goal of setting up a wholesale shop in town. Laurah needs the loan to buy salt, sugar, and rice for resale.

loans.use: to buy salt, sugar, and rice for resale

loans.name: Lucas

texts.en:
Lucas, age 43, is married to Margaret. They are blessed with four children. He practices goat keeping, which he has been doing for six years. The business earns him a monthly income of 20,000 Kenyan shillings (KES).

This is his second loan from KADET LTD. He repaid the previous loan successfully. He will use part of the loan to buy goats for resale and part of it to pay school fees for his children. Lucas hopes to be a large-scale farmer in the future.

loans.use: to buy goats and pay school fees for his children

loans.name: Aron

texts.en:
Aron is 42 years old and married with six children between 2 and 19 years old. He is a farmer from Eldoret town in Rift Valley, Kenya where he has been farming for 10 years. His mixed farm produces potatoes, maize, vegetables and milk, which he sells at the local market. Farming has been his only source of income.

Aron has requested a loan of 30,000 Kenyan shillings to buy chickens and chicken feed. The extra income from this project will enable him to improve his family's livelihood. He faces the challenge of fluctuation in the prices of farm produce, which affects his cash flow. He hopes that in the next five years, he will have improved his dairy cows to the pedigree level.

loans.use: To buy chickens and chicken feed

loans.name: Ou

texts.en:
Mrs. Ou and her husband are local rice cultivators in Baray district.  Beside of farming business, Mrs. Ou also sells fresh fish which she gets from her husband's work as a fisherman.  Together, she and her husband earn about $7.50 per day. 

As the rainy season is coming, she would like to prepare to plant her rice crop but lacks money for seeds and fertilizer.  She would like to request a loan to buy two sacks of fertilizer and seed for planting.  She hopes that by planting and fertilizing her crop with finance from a Kiva loan, she will be able to increase her farming output over last year.  She will use her income to support her two children who are enrolled in the local school.

loans.use: to buy two sacks of fertilizer, seed for planting.

loans.name: Fatima

texts.en: Fatima is 41 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with six children. Fatima has a retail shop that print designs and sells T-shirts. She has had this business for five years. She requested a loan for 4,000 Philippine pesos (PHP) to buy raw materials needed for T-shirt printing. Fatima is a new member of HSPFI. In the future, Fatima hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy raw materials needed for T-shirt printing

loans.name: Jennifer

texts.en: Jennifer is married with one child. She is 25 years old and lives in El Paraiso, Liloy, Zamboanga del Norte. To earn a living, Jennifer has a general-store business. It is a new business. Jennifer has requested a loan for 5,000 Philippine pesos (PHP) to purchase additional stock for her general store. Jennifer has been a member of PMPC for over two years. In the future, Jennifer hopes to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional stock for her general store

location.town: El Paraiso, Liloy, Zamboanga del Norte

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy more chickens for resale.

loans.name: Ahmad

texts.en:
This borrower is from Iraq. He is 25 years old; single and lives with two family members. One of the family members works.

Ahmad has had a barber shop since 2009 .He has more than five years experience,  a deep understanding of local consumer and he is well known in his area.

He is requesting a $2,500 loan to pay the annual rent for his shop and to buy shaving supplies. He is aiming to gain more profits to improve his family’s quality of life.

loans.use: To pay the annual rent for his shop and to buy shaving supplies.

loans.name: Anita

texts.en:
Anita, 56, lives in the Philippines. She is married with five children. Anita provides multi-purpose cab services, with her husband as the driver. She has had this business for four years. Anita has requested a loan of 5,000 PHP to buy tools and pay for the utilities of the Multicab.

Anita is a new member of HSPFI. In the future, she hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy tools and pay for the utilities of her Multicab.

loans.name: Hoda

texts.en:
Hoda, 54, is a widow and has struggled since her husband's death to make a living. She is a kind woman, loved by most of her relatives, neighbors and friends. For work, she prepares "Malban", a classic dessert which traces back to the Middle East and consists of gelatin, sugar, starch and honey. Cooked then cooled, they are made into cubes or any other shape, covered with sugar and mixed with many kinds of nuts.

Hoda is a hard worker. In addition to her famous homemade sweets, Hoda also sells underwear and clothes. She is requesting a loan from Kiva partner A. Majmoua in order to prepare herself for Holy Ramadan. With this loan, Hoda will buy extra nuts to prepare requested sweets, in addition to a new clothes collection. Hoda has been an A. Majmoua borrower for eight consecutive cycles and is in good-standing with an excellent reputation. She has a smile that never leaves her face. Even if she's experiencing the worst moment, she won't let you know she's suffering. She hopes to stay capable of making her own living.

loans.use: to buy extra nuts to be prepared for requests during the Holy Ramadan months.

loans.name: Cita

texts.en:
Cita is 28 and has a five year old child. She has been a seaweed farmer for five years. Cita shared that sometimes seaweed farming is not easy, as weather conditions and lack of financial support can hinder earnings. Despite these challenges, Cita still does her best and finds ways to support her child.

Cita has requested a loan to buy straw, rope, bamboo and other materials for seaweed farming. She hopes to be able to save for her child's future.

loans.use: to buy straw, rope, bamboo and other materials for seaweed farming.

loans.name: Amos Group

texts.en:
Lisnah and her husband have been running a fried bread business for four years. They sell fried bread from their home and in the surroundings. 

Lisnah has asked for 3,000,000 Indonesian Rupiah to pay for white bread. She and her husband are doing well in this business with the aim to send their five children to school. Lisnah hopes to fulfill her family's daily needs, send her children to school and to someday also open a voucher kiosk.

loans.use: to pay for white bread.

loans.name: Marites

texts.en:
Marites is 19 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is single. 

Marites has a retail shop where she sells electronic loads for several networks like GLOBE & SMART. She has had this business for one year. She requested a loan for PHP 5,000 to buy additional electronic loads to sell.

Marites is a new member of HSPFI.  In the future, Marites hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy additional electronic loads to sell.

loans.name: Fidel

texts.en:
Despite financial constraints, Fidel wants to increase his rice production to earn income for the sake of his family. He is 47 years old, married and has four school-aged children. Fidel is a farmer working in the Philippines for almost 20 years, earning a net profit of Php 35,000 per harvest.

He is asking for a loan of Php 8,000 to buy fertilizers and pesticides to sustain his rice production. He hopes that he can have a plentiful harvest and earn income to satisfy his family's daily basic needs and finance their children's education until they finish college. He is thankful that Kiva lenders offer their financial assistance to help people improve their source of livelihood.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and pesticides for rice farming.

loans.name: Najat

texts.en:
This borrower is from Iraq. She is 45 years old, married and has seven children.

Najat is a midwife. She has owned a clinic since 2002. She has good experience in obstetrics and childbirth, a good reputation and she is well known in her area.

She is requesting a $2,800 loan to buy medical supplies, a split air conditioner and to make a ceiling for the clinic. She is optimistic about her business development and hopes that the coming years will continue to bring her positive growth.

loans.use: to buy medical supplies and a split air conditioner and to make a ceiling

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy items such as rice, sugar, flour, etc. for resale.

loans.name: Joseph

texts.en:
Joseph is aged 52 and married with six children, five of whom are currently attending school. He has been practising poultry farming for the last five years in Eldoret town in the Rift Valley, Kenya. He sells most of his eggs and chickens to the local market.  He also owns a retail shop which supplements his farming income. His biggest challenge in farming has been poor market prices for farm produce.

Joseph has requested a loan of 40,000 Kenyan shillings in order to buy additional stock of chickens and chicken feed. He says that this loan will enable him to expand his poultry farm and this means increased production. The proceeds from this project will help him to expand his farming activities and improve his family's livelihood.

loans.use: To buy chickens and chicken feed.

loans.name: Anthony

texts.en:
Anthony  is 36 years old and lives in the Philippines. He is single. 

Anthony  has a shop that sells dried fish of different types. He has had this business for five years. He requested a loan of PHP 5,000 to buy stock of dried fish.

Anthony  is a new member of HSPFI.  In the future, Anthony  hopes to improve his business.

loans.use: to buy stock of dried fish.

loans.name: Saadiyeh

texts.en:
This borrower is from Iraq. She is 40 years old, married and has five children. Three of her children work.

Saadiya has been a tailor since 2007. She makes and repairs women’s clothing. She has a deep understanding of local consumer needs, a good reputation and is well known in her area.
 
She is requesting a $2,400 loan to buy a generator and an embroidery machine. She is aiming to gain more profits so she can improve her family’s quality of life.

loans.use: To buy a generator and an embroidery machine.

loans.name: Yam

texts.en: Responsibility for the family is the big responsibility of Yam who is the head of his family. Yam rides a motorbike in Siem Reap. Every day he wakes up early in the morning to find customers so he can support his family. He can earn only $4 per day to give to his wife. Talking about his wife, she doesn’t stay at home; she has a job which involves counting money. With her patience and good characteristics, it is an easier job than others. Yam wishes to borrow an amount of $600 with the aim of repairing his old house.

loans.use: to repair his old house.

loans.name: Maria Chielo

texts.en:
Maria Chielo is 33 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is single with two children. 

Maria Chielo has a retail shop that sells canned goods, snacks & beverages. She has had this business for five years. She requested a loan of PHP 5,000 to buy canned goods, snacks & beverages. 

Maria Chielo is a new member of HSPFI.  In the future,Maria Chielo hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, snacks & beverages.

loans.name: Haydar

texts.en:
This borrower is from Iraq. He is 33 years old, married, and has one child. 

Haydar has had a car workshop since 2000 that sells spare parts. He has much experience in this field, and has a good reputation as he is well known in his area. 

He is requesting a $2000 loan to make a sliding door and a ceiling for his workshop, and to purchase additional inventory. He is aiming to make more profit to improve his family's quality of life.

loans.use: To make a sliding door and a ceiling for his workshop and to purchase additional inventory

loans.name: Dionesia

texts.en:
Dionesia, 53, is married with 11 children, aged 11 to 32. She has been a rice farmer for 20 years. She and her husband own and till land in Trinidad, Bohol. Dionesia does her best to support her family. She applied for a loan to purchase fertilizer and pay the laborers who helped till their farm.

Dionesia hopes to have a stable business. She also hopes for all of her children to finish college and have bright futures.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizer and pay for labor.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase sacks of charcoal and, for his retail shop, sacks of rice, sugar and beans.

loans.name: Cynthia

texts.en:
Cynthia, 41, lives in the Philippines and is married with one child. She has a food shop where she sells homemade sausage, a business she has had for five years. Cynthia has requested a loan of 5,000 PHP to buy raw ingredients needed for cooking homemade sausage.

Cynthia is a new member of HSPFI. In the future, she hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy raw ingredients needed for cooking homemade sausage.

loans.name: Melecia

texts.en:
Melecia, 47, lives in Ozamis City and is married with four children. She has a charcoal painting business from which she earns approximately 4,000 PHP a month. She has requested a loan of 10,000 PHP to purchase materials for her business.

Melecia has been a member of PMPC for one year.

loans.use: to purchase materials for her charcoal painting business.

location.town: Kinuman Norte, Ozamiz City, Misamis Occidental

loans.name: Fadila

texts.en:
This borrower is from Iraq. She is 38 years old, married, and has five children. 

Fadila has owned a farm for rearing calves and cows since 1991. She has a lot of experience in this field, a deep understanding of local consumers, and is well known in her area. 

She is requesting a $2100 loan to buy a Friesian cow. She is aiming to make more profit to improve her family's quality life.

loans.use: To buy a Friesian cow.

loans.name: Mansueta

texts.en:
Mansueta is 51 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with three children. 

Mansueta has a retail shop that sells dried fish of different kinds. She has had this business for five years. She requested a loan of PHP 5,000 to buy stocks of dried fish.

Mansueta is a new member of HSPFI.  In the future, Mansueta hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy stocks of dried fish.

loans.name: Baasanjargal

texts.en:
Mrs. Baasanjargal, 40 years old, is a nurse and lives with her husband and three children in Ulaanbaatar, the capital city  of Mongolia. She has been working as a nurse in a hospital since 2006. This borrower owns a small, private plot of land and wants to build a garage there. Therefore she needs some building materials amounting to MNT 2,000,000 to build the garage. 

The loan Baasanjargal is taking will be dedicated to purchasing construction materials to build her garage. After that, she has a plan to have a grocery store on her own land.

loans.use: To purchase construction materials to build a garage.

loans.name: Analie

texts.en:
Analie is 42 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with five children. 

Analie has a food shop that sells dishes like fried chicken & "escabeche". She has had this business for five years. She requested a loan of PHP 5,000 to buy raw ingredients for cooking dishes & for fruit salads.

Analie is a new member of HSPFI.  In the future, Analie hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy raw ingredients for preparing dishes & for fruit salads.

loans.name: Chum

texts.en: Mrs. Chum is 49 years old, living in Kompong Thom province of Cambodia. She and her husband are farmers .they have been growing vegetable and rice field since 1990. From planting, they could be earned $5 per day. So far they have eight children, one has already married and seven are singles. to help the family live in comfortable as other family in village, two children works as security guard in one company (Best company) and the other three children are working as local construction workers in Phnom Penh.Mrs.Chhum wanted to borrow $550 from Kiva loan to grow their rice field and to create a new business by buying pigs in order to raise for extra income. This loan is useful for their family because they can have enough money to do her job timely.

loans.use: to grow their rice field and raising pigs.

loans.name: Amirkhon

texts.ru: Амирхон проживает в городе Куляб. Ему 21 год. Он холост. Живет вместе с родителями. Амирхон окончил медицинский колледж. По специальности он фармацевт. Он уже 7 лет как занимается торговлей. В основном он занимается торговлей строительных материалов. Он берет кредит для покупки досок, цемента, дверей и окон. Амирхон хочет увеличить свой товар, чтобы привлечь новых клиентов и получить больше прибыли.
texts.en: Amirkhon lives in the town of Kulob. He is 21 years old and single. He lives together with his parents. He has graduated from an allied health college. He is a pharmacist by education. For about seven years he has been in retail. He mainly sells construction supplies. He is taking out a loan in order to buy wood planks, concrete, doors and windows. Amirkhon would like to expand his stock in order to attract new customers and increase his revenues.

loans.use: to buy wood planks, concrete, doors and windows

loans.name: Nabiha

texts.en:
Nabiha is a 42-year-old single woman, who started doing art work in 2007. It was a hobby that she finally improved and insisted on developing. At the beginning of her working life, Nabiha worked in selling clothes, but she had a dream to make come true, and she saved a small amount of money that helped in changing her career. 

Nabiha is a talented artist. In addition to her drawings, Nabiha also works at preparing baby & wedding souvenirs, and that's why she's requesting a loan from Al Majmoua, for the first time, in order to buy necessary materials to be ready for requested baby souvenirs. 

Nabiha likes her new career a lot and hopes to keep on developing it more and more. She hopes she stays capable of filling her customers needs and requests.

She hopes she can make a big exhibition for her drawings in the future and become well known in the region.

loans.use: To buy necessary materials to make requested baby souvenirs.

loans.name: Filomena

texts.en:
Filomena is 48 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with two children. 

Filomena has a retail shop that sells canned goods, snacks & beverages. She has had this business for five years. She requested a loan of PHP 5,000 to buy canned goods, beverages & snacks.

Filomena is a new member of HSPFI.  In the future, Filomena hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, beverages & snacks.

loans.name: Simon

texts.en:
Simon, 34, is married to Marselina, 28. From their marriage, they have been blessed with two children: Lady, 7, in second grade of elementary school and Yermi, 5, studying at kindergarten. 

Simon runs a kiosk business, which he started four years ago. He sells primary commodities such as sugar, coffee, bread, cooking oil, instant noodles, soap, detergent and assorted snacks and beverages. He operates his business from 7 a.m. to 7 p.m. His income depends on the number of customers during the day, with more customers meaning more income. Due to the unstable income generated from the kiosk business, Simon and his wife also farm onions to earn additional income.

Simon wants to add more stock, such as rice, kerosene, petrol and snacks, to his kiosk but he needs extra capital to do so. Therefore, he is requesting a loan of 5,000,000 IDR from TLM. He hopes his loan application will be approved.

loans.use: to purchase more stock, such as rice, kerosene, petrol and snacks.

loans.name: Genebe

texts.en:
Genebe, 35, lives in the Philippines and is married with three children. She sells snacks and rice cakes, a business she has had for four years. She has requested a loan of 5,000 PHP to buy snacks for resale.

Genebe is a new member of HSPFI.  In the future, she hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy snacks for resale.

loans.name: Tang

texts.en: As head of the family, Tang and her husband always worry about how to create more benefits for their family. Tang sells chicken-rice-soup in a market near her village. Her husband is a carpenter. Together, they earn $8 per day. They are responsible for their five children. With the aim of a more comfortable standard of living, Tang wishes to borrow $500 so she can purchase ingredients to support her current business.

loans.use: to purchase ingredients to support her current business.

loans.name: Charles

texts.en:
Charles, 32, is a hardworking and creative business man. He is married and blessed with three school-going children aged two and a half, seven and 14. For the past four years, he has been engaged in the transport business with a taxi to make ends meet. He supplements his income with earnings he makes from childcare, a general shop and vending water. Previously, he used to sell electronics and milk. In the next five years, he wants to have a big retail shop serving the region where he is based and to enlarge his childcare capacity.

Charles is requesting a loan of 40,000 Kenyan shillings to buy sugar, maize flour, soap, heaters, coils, bulbs, potatoes, kale and tomatoes. Thanks to Faulu Kenya, he has developed a culture of saving and has become a good time manager.

loans.use: to buy sugar, maize flour, soap, heaters, coils, bulbs, potatoes, kale and tomatoes.

loans.name: Ibtihal

texts.en:
This borrower is from Iraq. She is 44 years old, married and has three children. 

Ibtihal has been a tailor since 2005; she makes and repairs women's clothing. She has a deep understanding of local consumers, a lot of experience, and is  well known in her area. 

She is requesting a $2000 loan to buy two tailoring machines and to add more inventory like tissues and buttons. She is optimistic about her business development and hopes that the coming years will continue to bring her positive growth.

loans.use: To buy two tailoring machines and to add more inventory like tissues and buttons

loans.name: Hermie

texts.en:
Hermie is 43 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is separated with two children. 

Hermie has a retail shop that sells home-made sausage or "chorizzo". She has had this business for five years. She requested a loan of PHP 5,000 to buy raw ingredients needed for home-made sausages.

Hermie is a new member of HSPFI.  In the future, Hermie hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy raw ingredients needed for home-made sausage.

loans.name: Lucila Carlonita

texts.en:
Lucila Carlonita  is 39 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with two children. 

Lucila Carlonita  has a retail shop that sells canned goods, beverages & snacks. She has had this business for 5 years. She requested a loan of PHP 5,000 to buy canned goods, snacks & beverages.

Lucila Carlonita  is a new member of HSPFI.  In the future, Lucila Carlonita  hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, snacks & beverages.

loans.name: Hayat

texts.en:
This borrower is from Iraq. She is 43 years old, married, and has three children. 

Hayat has been a tailor since 2000; she makes and repairs women's clothing. She has a deep understanding of local consumers, a lot of experience, and is well known in her area. 

She is requesting a $2000 loan to buy three tailoring machines. She is aiming to gain more profits to improve her family's quality life.

loans.use: To buy three tailoring machines.

loans.name: Charlita

texts.en: Charlita is a 45-year-old woman who is married and lives in Calamba, Misamis Occidental, Philippines. She has two grown children. Photo frame-making activity is the family's primary source of income. After five years of creating noticeable photo frame designs, she has managed to reach a total monthly income of PHP 5,000. Charlita craves more production so she has requested a loan of PHP 7,000 from GDMPC to purchase eye-boosting materials for her photo frame-making activity. She has already been connected with GDMPC for one year. Charlita hopes to have a simple showroom in town to promote her products.

loans.use: To purchase eye-boosting materials for her photo frame-making activity.

loans.name: Ahmad

texts.en:
This borrower is from Iraq. He is 23 years old, single, and lives with two family members. 

Ahmad has owned a market since 2009, selling food and household items. He has a lot of experience in this field and a good reputation. His market is situated in a crowded area so there are a good number of customers passing by. 

He is requesting a $3000 loan to pay the annual rent and to purchase additional inventory. He is aiming to make more profit to improve his family's quality life.

loans.use: To pay the annual rent and to purchase additional inventory

loans.name: Aheistra

texts.en:
Aheistra is 23 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is single. 

Aheistra is selling electronic loads for several networks such as GLOBE & SMART. She has had this business for five years. She requested a loan of PHP 5,000 to buy additional electronic loads to sell.

Aheistra is a new member of HSPFI.  In the future, Aheistra hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy additional electronic loads to sell.

loans.name: Azam

texts.ru: Азам проживает в районе Яван. Ему 51 год. Он женат. У него пятеро детей. Его жена занимается растениеводством. Сам Азам занимается животноводством. Он разводит крупнорогатый скот в дальнейшем для продажи. Этим видом деятельности он занимается 10 лет. Кредит берет для закупа крупнорогатого скота, чтобы увеличить их количество.
texts.en: Azam lives in Yavan. He is 51 years old, married, and has five children. His wife is a farmer. Azam works in animal husbandry. He breeds cattle for sale.  He has been doing this work for ten years. He is taking out a loan to buy cattle to increase his herd.

loans.use: to buy cattle

loans.name: Maria Florence

texts.en:
Maria Florence is 48 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is single. 

Maria Florence has a retail shop that sells beauty & clothing products from AVON. She has had this business for 5 years. She requested a loan for PHP 5,000 to buy additional stocks from AVON & NATASHA.

Maria Florence is a new member of HSPFI.  In the future, Maria Florence hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy additional  stock from AVON & NATASHA.

loans.name: Rassmiyeh

texts.en:
This borrower is from Iraq. She is 46 years old, married, and has three children. 

Rassmiyeh had been a tailor since 2000; she makes and repairs women's clothing. She has a deep understanding of local consumers, a lot of experience, and she is well known in her area. 

She is requesting a $3000 loan to buy two tailoring machines and to add more inventory such as tissues and buttons. She is aiming to make more profit so she can improve her family's quality life.

loans.use: To buy two tailoring machines and to add more inventory like tissues and buttons

loans.name: Nhin

texts.en: From one day to the next, Nhin thinks about ways to create lots of money for her family. She is a farmer and also raises pigs. As for her husband, he is also a farmer. Both of them try hard to find the income to support the family as comfortably as others. Nhin has more farms to plant. To meet the family's need to have a good standard of living, Nhin wishes to borrow $1,000 to purchase a veranda column and planks for repairing her old house.

loans.use: To purchase a veranda column and planks for repairing her old house.

loans.name: Erlinda

texts.en:
Erlinda is 59 years old and is a married woman with six children. Most of her children are adults and already married.

Erlinda is a farmer working in the town of Trinidad, Bohol. She primarily grows rice crops to sell. Erlinda works hard to support her family. She applied for a loan to purchase fertilizers and pay for the labor of those who help till her farm. Erlinda said this loan will be very helpful for her business.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers and pay for labor.

loans.name: Danilo

texts.en:
Danilo, 51, is married to a vendor named Aida and they have five school-aged children. To sustain his family's needs, Danilo works hard and does his best to maintain his farming business. He grows rice and has been doing this for almost 30 years. The income generated from the business goes towards his family's basic needs and school fees.

Danilo is requesting a loan of 18,000 PHP to purchase farming supplies such as seeds, fertilizer and pesticide for his crop production.

In the future, Danilo hopes to improve his farming business in order to continuously send all his children to school to get degrees in order to assure better futures for them.

loans.use: to purchase farming supplies such as seeds, fertilizer and pesticide for his crop production.

loans.name: Firas

texts.en:
This borrower is from Iraq. He is 33 years old, married and has two children. 

Firas has owned a cafeteria since 2007; he prepares popular Iraqi food. He has a lot of experience in this field and a good reputation. His cafeteria is situated in a crowded area so there are a good number of customers passing by. 

He is requesting a $1500 loan to purchase new furniture, a refrigerator, and a split air conditioner. He is aiming to make more profit to improve his family's quality life.

loans.use: To purchase new furniture, a refrigerator, and a split air conditioner.

loans.name: Tomasa

texts.en:
Tomasa, 40, lives in the Philippines and is separated with two children. For five years, she has been selling beauty products from Avon and kitchen products from Tupperware. She has requested a loan of 5,000 PHP to buy stock from Avon and Tupperware.

Tomasa is a new member of HSPFI. In the future, she hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy stock from Avon and Tupperware.

loans.name: Helen

texts.en:
Helen is 35 years old and is a married woman who lives in Calamba, Misamis Occidental, Philippines. Living with her are her two school-aged children. She has operated a sari-sari (variety) store at home for two years to support their daily consumption. The monthly income of PHP 2,800 is insufficient to cover her day-to-day expenses. 

Helen wants to keep the store operating so she has requested a loan of PHP 7,000 from GDMPC to purchase more grocery items to sell. She has been a member of GDMPC since the year 2010. Helen hopes to extend the business's area into a profitable business venture and a non-stop operation.

loans.use: To purchase more grocery items to sell.

loans.name: Felistar

texts.en:
Felistar, 36, is a hardworking and ambitious business woman. She is single and has no children. Since 2004, she has been operating a salon to make a living. She makes extra income by engaging in farming activities. Previously, she sold groceries. In the next five years, she would like to have a big salon. Her dream is to own a beauty and therapy school.

Felistar is requesting a loan of 40,000 Kenyan shillings to buy a dairy cow. Thanks to Faulu Kenya, she has been able to increase her income.

loans.use: to buy a dairy cow.

loans.name: Merlinda

texts.en:
Merlinda is 50 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with one child. 

Merlinda has a retail shop that sells T-shirts & blouses. She has had this business for four years. She requested a loan of PHP 5,000 to buy T-shirts & blouses to sell.

Merlinda is a new member of HSPFI.  In the future, Merlinda hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy T-shirts & blouses to sell.

loans.name: Rheza

texts.en:
Rheza is a 35-year-old married woman living in Calamba, Misamis Occidental, Philippines. She has three school-aged children to care for. She owns and operates a sari-sari (variety) store at home to earn a living. From three years of running the business, she is glad to earn a monthly income of PHP 4,000. 

Owing to a lack of revolving funds, Rheza has applied for a loan of PHP 7,000 from GDMPC to purchase grocery items and to buy "tuba" (the villagers' favorite drink derived from coconut sap) to sell in her store. She has been a member of GDMPC for one year. Rheza hopes to manage the store properly and expand the business area to increase her cash inflow.

loans.use: To purchase grocery items and  to buy "tuba" (the villagers' favorite drink derived from coconut sap) to sell in her store.

loans.name: Beverly

texts.en:
Beverly is married. She is 45 years old and lives in Manukan. She sells different kinds of products to earn a living and has had this business for five years. Each month, she earns PHP 4,500 doing this type of work.

Beverly has requested a loan of 14,900 Php to purchase additional stock for her general store. She has been a member of PMPC for two years.

loans.use: to purchase additional stock for her general store.

loans.name: Ali

texts.en:
This borrower is from Iraq. He is 49 years old, married, and has six children. 

Ali has had a food market since 1995 that sells soft drinks, juice, cheese, dairy products, and cleaning tools. He has a deep understanding of local consumer needs. His market is situated in a crowded area so there are a good number of customers passing by. 

He is requesting a $3000 loan to pay the annual rent of his market, to make shelves, and to add more foodstuffs. He is aiming to increase his profits to improve his family's quality life.

loans.use: To pay the annual rent of his market, to make shelves, and to add more foodstuffs.

loans.name: Tessie

texts.en:
Tessie is 49 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is widowed with one child. 

Tessie has a retail shop that sells T-shirts & blouses. She has had this business for three years. She requested a loan of PHP 5,000 to buy T-shirts & blouses to sell.

Tessie is a new member of HSPFI.  In the future, Tessie hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy T-shirts & blouses to sell.

loans.name: Chea

texts.en: Chea, 57, is a widow who lives in Kompong Chhnang Province of Cambodia. She has one child. Although she is on her own, she can earn enough profit to support her family. Taking time from her farming business, she works as a fish seller so she can earn a suitable income. With the aim of having a good standard of living, Chea wishes to borrow $125 for the purpose of purchasing a small piece of land to expand her present farming business.

loans.use: to purchase a small piece of land to expand her present farming business.

loans.name: Houssam

texts.en:
This borrower is from Iraq. He is 32 years old, married, and has two children. 

Houssam has had a workshop since 2008 where he repairs diesel engines for new cars. He has a lot of experience in this field, a good reputation, and is well known in his area. 

He is requesting a loan to buy a generator for his workshop. He is aiming to gain more profits to improve his family's quality life.

loans.use: To buy a generator for his workshop.

loans.name: Imelda

texts.en:
Imelda is 45 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with four children. 

Imelda has a retail shop that sells vegetables like squash, cabbages & okra. She has had this business for five years. She requested a loan of PHP 5,000 to buy vegetables to sell.

Imelda is a new member of HSPFI.  In the future, Imelda hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy vegetables to sell.

loans.name: Samwel

texts.en:
Samwel is a farmer from Eldoret town in the Rift Valley, Kenya where he has been farming for 10 years. His mixed farm produces milk, maize and vegetables which he sells to the local market. Farming has been his main source of income. He faces the challenges of diseases which cause poor production and fluctuation in the market prices of farm produce.

Samwel has made a loan request for 35,000 Kenyan shillings in order to buy chickens and chicken feed. He says that by venturing into poultry farming, his income will increase and this will enable him to expand his farming activities. 

Samwel is aged 37 and is married with three school-aged children all of whom attend school.

loans.use: To buy chickens and chicken feed.

loans.name: Teresita

texts.en: Teresita is 45 years old, is married and lives in Calamba, Misamis Occidental, Philippines. She has four grown children. She owns and operates a sari-sari (variety) store for her livelihood. After four years of business operations, she now generates a total monthly income of PHP 2,800. Teresita has requested a loan of PHP 7,000 from GDMPC to purchase sacks of rice and rice bran to sell. She has been a member of GDMPC for one year. Teresita plans to sell more fattened swine and to widen the selling area to increase her usual earnings.

loans.use: To purchase sacks of rice and rice bran to sell.

loans.name: Yonatan

texts.en:
Yonatan is a 54-year-old man who retired from a local agency. He is married to Yanse, a 40-year-old housewife. They have six children ages 7 to 23 years old and five of them are still attending school.

After retiring from his job, Yonatan is running a freight car business to support his family as his pension is not sufficient to cover the needs of his family as well as the educational needs of his children. 

Besides running the freight car business, Yonatan also plans to run a poultry business to generate more income. He is requesting a loan amounting to IDR 10,000,000 from TLM. He plans to spend the loan on five boxes of chicks, feed, and to renovate the cage. He is hoping that his loan application will be approved.

loans.use: To purchase five boxes of chicks, feed, and to renovate the cage.

loans.name: Ma. Elena

texts.en:
Ma. Elena, 33, lives in the Philippines and is married with five children. She peddles snacks such as rice and cassava cakes, which she has been doing for three years. She has requested a loan of 5,000 PHP to buy raw ingredients needed for making snacks.

Ma. Elena is a new member of HSPFI. In the future, she hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy raw ingredients for making snacks.

loans.name: Koulthoum

texts.en:
Koulthoum, 54, is a married mother of one. Since 2007, she has owned a grocery store, which is a major source of income for her and her family. Koulthoum helps her husband in making their living and she is a hard worker who is loved by most of her customers. Her son and husband provide her with a lot of support and she improves her business as much as she can.

Koulthoum is requesting a loan from Kiva partner Al Majmoua to buy necessary goods for her shop in order to be well prepared for requests during the month of Holy Ramadan. She has been an Al Majmoua borrower for two consecutive cycles and has a good standing payback history.

Koulthoum hopes to keep on taking good care of her customers and improving her business.

loans.use: to increase the stock of goods in her shop.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy two washing machines for his shop.

loans.name: Proeung

texts.en: Since becoming a couple, Proeung and her husband live in happiness. Presently they work as a garment factory worker and a sewing factory worker in Phnom Penh. Both of them can earn a profit of $9.60 per day. They have only one child. To glorify a small family and to be as rich as others, Proeung wishes to borrow $125 with the aim of doing her identification check and taking care of her health.

loans.use: to do her identification check and to take care of her health.

loans.name: Bonifacia

texts.en:
Bonifacia is 50 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with two children. 

Bonifacia has a retail shop that sells canned goods, snacks & beverages. She has had this business for five years. She requested a loan of PHP 5,000 to buy canned goods, snacks & beverages.

Bonifacia is a new member of HSPFI.  In the future, Bonifacia hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, snacks & beverages.

loans.name: Hani

texts.en:
This borrower is from Iraq. He is 23 years old, single and lives with four family members; two of them work.

Hani has owned a workshop for aluminum window and door manufacturing since 2010. He has a good experience in this field and a good reputation and he is well known in his area.

He is requesting a $2400 loan to enlarge and renovate his workshop. He is aiming to earn more profit to improve his family’s quality of life.

loans.use: To enlarge and renovate his workshop.

loans.name: Thelma

texts.en:
Thelma is 49 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married. 

Thelma has a retail shop that sells snacks, detergents & noodles. She has had this business for five years. She requested a loan of PHP 5,000 to buy canned goods, beverages & snacks.

Thelma is a new member of HSPFI.  In the future, Thelma hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, beverages & snacks.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to pay for perfume

loans.name: Marilyn

texts.en:
Marilyn is 29 years old and is a married woman with three children aged 8, 5 and 3. Marilyn has been a rice farmer for four years now. She and her husband own and till a plot of land in Trinidad, Bohol. Marilyn works hard to support her family and save for her children's education.

Marilyn is requesting a loan of 4000 PHP to purchase farm inputs such as fertilizers and seeds. She hopes for their farm business to grow.

loans.use: to purchase farm inputs such as fertilizers and seeds.

loans.name: Michael

texts.en:
This is Michael, 35, resident of Tanza, Cavite City, Philippines. He manages his own household while operating the business. At this time, he is working hard to continually provide income for his everyday expenses.

Michael operates a "tricycle" transportation business. He owns one "tricycle" (a motorcycle with sidecar attached to it) that carries up to four to five passengers to their destination within the community. Michael is the one who drives his tricycle. His regular customers are his neighbors and the local community. He earns a minimum of Php 300 every day.

To help him continue operations of his business, he is requesting a Php 12,000 loan. He will be utilizing the loan for additional spare parts and the maintenance of his tricycle. He expects a boost in his business income as he expands his business.  

Michael hopes to be able to expand soon and to sustain his daily needs. He faithfully meets up with his co-fellowship members to share stories of his work every week and also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God he studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: To pay for spare parts and maintenance of his "tricycle".

loans.name: Elvia

texts.en:
Elvia  is 53 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with three children. 

Elvia  is peddling & selling cooked peanuts. She has had this business for 10 years. She requested a loan of PHP 5,000 to buy additional peanuts to sell.

Elvia  is a new member of HSPFI.  In the future, Elvia  hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy additional peanuts to sell.

loans.name: Oyun

texts.en:
Mrs. Oyun, 51 years old, is a businesswoman who lives with her husband, 52, and daughter, 14, in a "ger," a  traditional tent in Darkhan, the second largest city in Mongolia. She has been running a small grocery kiosk in her backyard during the last two years. She wants to have a new bigger grocery store and expand their business through increasing her range of goods with many other products from abroad. 

Therefore the loan Oyun is applying for will be used to buy building materials to build a new grocery store. She is very grateful to the Kiva team for supporting her.

loans.use: To buy building materials to build a new grocery store.

loans.name: David

texts.en:
David, aged 47, is married to Jane and they are blessed with five children. He does welding services and his business has been in operation for 10 years. The business earns him a monthly income of KES.8,000.

This is his fourth loan with KADET LTD and he has a good credit history. He will use the funds to buy a new welding machine.


David intends to use the anticipated profits to pay school fees for his children and hopes to own a piece of land in future.

loans.use: To buy a new welding machine.

loans.name: Mardy

texts.en:
Mardy is 36 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with one child. 

Mardy has a retail shop that sells snacks, canned goods & beverages. She has had this business for five years. She requested a loan of PHP 5,000 to buy canned goods, snacks & detergents.

Mardy is a new member of HSPFI.  In the future, Mardy hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, snacks & detergents.

loans.name: Linda

texts.en:
Linda is a 34-year-old single lady. Linda runs a nursery school in Changamwe, Mombasa and her business has been in operation for the last eight years. Her business has been doing well.


Linda has already been a KADET client and this marks her second time borrowing to finance her business. With this loan she plans to expand her business by purchasing textbooks and more desks. 


The anticipated profits will be used to repay the loan and to expand her business further. Her dream is to become a successful business lady.

loans.use: to purchase textbooks and more desks.

loans.name: Soam

texts.en: Both Soam and her husband work as farmers, but Soam doesn’t do the same work as her husband. Soam raises pigs at home but her husband works as a farmer. Both of them can earn $6 per day. They always think about their three children. For developing a family living in modern times, Soam would like to borrow $1,000 with the purpose of purchasing rice to sell.

loans.use: to purchase rice to sell.

loans.name: Alicia

texts.en: Alicia, a 50-year-old married mother of four, lives in the Philippines where she has operated a retail shop selling fish such as sardines and mackerel for the last five years. A new member of HSPFI, Alicia has requested a loan for PHP 5,000 to buy more fish to sell, and hopes to improve her business in the future.

loans.use: to buy fish to sell.

loans.name: John

texts.en: John, 35, who is married to Serah and the father of six children, has been a  crop farmer for the past 10 years, earning a monthly income of KES.3000.  Having repaid his first loan, John is now requesting his second one with KADET LTD to buy maize seeds and pay school fees for his son. He hopes to educate all of his children and become a large-scale farmer in the future.

loans.use: to buy seeds and farm inputs and pay school fees for his son.

loans.name: Levina

texts.en:
Levina is 37 years old, married and has three children. For three years she has had a food shop where she sells snacks like tempura and kikiam.

Levina is a new member of HSPFI. She has requested a loan for 5,000 PHP to buy ingredients for the tempura she sells. Levina hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for the tempura she sells.

loans.name: Sherlita

texts.en: Sherlita is 42 years old, is married and lives in Zamboanga del Sur, Philippines. She has four children. Weaving nipa hut (small bamboo houses) is her prime source of income. She has felt deep satisfaction knowing that she has been able to send all her children to school through this business. A total of PHP 5,000 is generated per month. Sherlita has applied for a loan of PHP 10,000 from GDMPC to purchase materials needed in her nipa making business activity. She joined GDMPC in 2011. Sherlita hopes for a more durable output and to keep delivering orders on time to attract or gain more customers.

loans.use: To purchase materials needed in her nipa hut making activity.

loans.name: Virginia

texts.en:
Virginia is 37 years old, married and has three children. For five years Virginia has had a retail shop where she sells canned goods, beverages and snacks.

Virginia is a new member of HSPFI. She has requested a loan for 5,000 PHP to buy canned goods, beverages and bread. In the future, Virginia hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, beverages and bread.

loans.name: Sila

texts.en:
Sila is aged 45 and married with four children aged between two and 13, three of whom attend school. He has been practising mixed farming for the last 10 years producing maize and milk which are sold locally. He is also employed and depends on his salary to cater for his family's livelihood. His major challenge in farming has been lack of reliable artificial insemination services in his region.

Sila has made a loan request of 60,000 Kenyan shillings in order to purchase a motorcycle for transporting his farm produce to the market. He says that this will enable him access to a wider market for his farm produce. He hopes that in the near future, his farm will have grown and he will be able to buy a tractor with his farming proceeds.

loans.use: To purchase a motorcycle.

loans.name: Anthony

texts.en:
Anthony is 25 years old and single. For the past three years he has had a food shop where he sells snacks like tempura and kikiam.

Anthony is a new member of HSPFI. He has requested a loan for 5,000 PHP to buy tempura and kikiam to sell. In the future, Anthony hopes to improve his business.

loans.use: to buy tempura and kikiam to sell.

loans.name: Plinh

texts.en: Plinh is the head of his family, so it is a big responsibility on him to find income to support his family. At present, he is a construction worker in Siem Reap Province. All the people there know that he is very talented and has good creative ideas. He can earn about $4 per day. If we talk about his wife, she isn't a lazy woman. She is a farmer and also a housekeeper. She also earns perhaps $1.50 per day. They would like to borrow $500 to purchase chickens to raise.

loans.use: to purchase chickens to raise.

loans.name: Baatartsogt

texts.en: Mr. Baatartsogt,  36, lives with his wife and two-year-old son in a ger, a traditional Mongolian tent in Ulaanbaatar, the capital of Mongolia. He has been running a taxi business for eight years and owns three cars for rent, earning MNT 20.000 in a day. Baatartsogt recently bought a small plot of land and now needs to build a fence for it. He is therefore requesting a loan to buy some blocks upon which to build the fence.

loans.use: to buy some blocks to build a fence on his own land.

loans.name: Fely

texts.en:
Fely is 35 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is single. 

Fely has a retail shop that sells vegetables, snacks & canned goods. She has had this business for four years. She requested a loan of PHP 5,000 to buy canned goods & beverages.

Fely is a new member of HSPFI.  In the future, Fely hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy canned goods & beverages

loans.name: Joseph

texts.en:
Joseph is 28 years old, married, and a father of one child. Joseph owns a retail shop in Kongowea, Mombasa. His business has been in operation for the last two years and it has been successful.

This marks his first loan from KADET to finance his business. With this loan, Joseph plans to add more stock of sugar, maize meal, rolls of tissue, wheat flour, margarine and cooking oil. 

The anticipated profits will be used to repay the loan and gradually expand his business. His dream is to improve his living standards.

loans.use: to buy more sugar, maize meal, tissue, wheat flour, margarine and cooking oil

loans.name: Ricky

texts.en:
Ricky is 23 years old and lives in the Philippines. He is married. 

Ricky has a shop that sells snacks, beverages & canned goods. He has had this business for two years. He requested a loan of PHP 5,000 to buy canned goods, snacks & beverages.

Ricky is a new member of HSPFI.  In the future, Ricky hopes to improve his business.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, snacks & beverages

loans.name: Ham

texts.en: Ham has been riding a motorbike in Siem Reap for a long time now. With his smile, it makes it easy for him to find more clients every day. He could earn about $3 per day. His wife is a fish seller in a market near her house. From day to day, his wife could also earn about $3 profit per day. They have responsibility for their six children. With the aim of improving his business, Ham would like to borrow some funds to support his family better than before. He would like to borrow about $500 to purchase a new motorbike.

loans.use: to purchase a new motorbike.

loans.name: Yousra

texts.en:
Yousra is a 52 year-old married woman and a mother of two children.  She has worked since 2000 as a photographer. Yousra is hardworking and is a good businesswoman who advertises attractive offers to keep her business updated.  Yousra opened her shop in 2004.  She has a good customer base to rely on and she works hard on improving her business and updating her machines and materials. Yousra is preparing herself for the Holy Ramadan celebrations, when most of the families come during Eid A. Fitr.  It is a three-day Muslim holiday that marks the end of Ramadan, the Islamic holy month of fasting.  People come to take pictures and enjoy the Eid.  Yousra needs to buy necessary materials and chemicals for her business.  She will make speciA. offers and that will increase her income.

For this reason, Yousra is requesting a loan from A. Majmoua-Kiva.   It is her tenth cycle as A. Majmoua borrower.  She has a magnificent history of good standing.  Yousra will also paint her house, and buy a bedroom for her children.  Yousra is a woman with a good reputation and remarkable customer service.  She hopes to improve more and keep her customers loyA. to her.

loans.use: To buy necessary materials for her business

loans.name: Merlina

texts.en: Merlinda is 43 years old and lives in Dapitan City. She is married, with 3 children. To earn a living, Merlinda has a business selling fresh fruits. She earns about PHP 5000 each month doing this type of work. Merlinda has requested a loan of 14,900 to purchase fresh fruits to sell.  Merlinda has been a member of PMPC for 3 years.

loans.use: to purchase fresh fruits to sell

loans.name: Buenaventurada

texts.en:
Buenaventurada is 28 years old and has run a fishing business for 10 years. Her husband is a fisherman.

Buenaventurada helps her husband make "panggal" (fish traps). She also sells his catch at the market. Buenaventurada is asking for a loan to buy fish nets and materials for making "panggal" (fish trap). This will help her husband catch more fish to sell.

In the future, Buenaventurada hopes to have a stable business and successful children.

loans.use: to buy fish nets and materials for making "panggal" (fish trap)

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to purchase more goats to resell

loans.name: Met

texts.en: Met and her husband cooperate to find a suitable job to earn more income for their family. Met is a fish and lotus seller in a market near her house. Her husband catches fish in ponds, lakes and the river. Together, they can earn perhaps $10.40 per day. To improve their income, Met wishes to borrow about $800 in order to purchase a place to sell fish and lotuses at another market.

loans.use: to purchase a place to sell fish and lotus at another market.

loans.name: Mayshell

texts.en:
Mayshell is 20 years old and married. She has no child yet but hopes to have one soon.

Mayshell is engaged in farming. She has been growing rice and vegetables for 2 years.  Mayshell does her best to improve her farming skills. She requested a loan to purchase seeds, fertilizers and other farm inputs. Mayshell hopes to have an abundant harvest.

loans.use: to purchase seeds, fertilizers and other farm inputs

loans.name: Trinidad

texts.en: Trinidad is a 59-year-old married woman. She lives in Aurora, Zamboanga del Sur, Philippines with her three adult children. She has owned and operated a sari-sari (variety) store at home for three years giving her a monthly income of PHP 5,000. Sustaining the business is important, so she applied for a loan of PHP 15,000 from GDMPC to purchase more grocery items and other basic commodities to sell. She joined GDMPC just this year (in 2011). Trinidad hopes for more sales and plans to expand the business.

loans.use: To purchase grocery items and other basic commodities to sell.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to pay for a freezer.

loans.name: Alejandra

texts.en:
Alejandra is a 45-year-old married woman with four children. The oldest child is 24, while the youngest is seven. Her husband is a construction worker.

Alejandra has raised and sold hogs for fifteen years. She plans to use her loan to purchase pigs, feed and vitamins.

Alejandra works hard to support her family and send her children to school. In the future, Alejandra would like to expand her hog-raising business.

loans.use: to purchase pigs, feed and vitamins.

loans.name: Kassim

texts.en:
Kassim is 41 years old, married, and has a three-month-old child. For the past six years he has run a spare parts shop in the Mombasa region from which he sells parts for motorcycles. He also has a boda boda (motorcycle taxi) business and sells charcoal. He describes himself as caring, understanding and down to earth.

This will be Kassim’s fourth loan with SMEP. He is a good client who repays his loans well. He intends to use this loan to expand his business by buying more spare parts to sell.

Kassim plans to use the anticipated profits to restock his shop and take care of his family’s expenses. In the future, Kassim hopes to be an importer of spare parts for motorcycles and cars.

loans.use: to expand his business by buying more spare parts to sell.

loans.name: Ek

texts.en:
Mr. Ek, age 49, is a farmer. His wife, age 46, is a grocery seller in the village. Mr. Ek is the head of a family of five children. He and his wife earn about $6 daily to support the family, which is not enough, so some of the children help provide additional monthly income.
