In order to offer his family greater prosperity in the future and to better support his family at present, Mr. Ek would like to request a loan in the amount of $1,100 in order to purchase land.

loans.use: to purchase land .

loans.name: Winny

texts.en:
Winny is a 27-year-old single mother with a six-year-old son. She sells charcoal to residents living near Shelly beach. Winny has been running this business for a couple of months and is determined to make it successful. On the side, Winny is also a florist making decorations for weddings. She intends to use her loan to build a stall for selling charcoal. 

Winny hopes to expand her charcoal business and open a decoration shop. She describes herself as obedient.

loans.use: to build a stall to sell charcoal.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to purchase eggs, flour, rice, etc.

loans.name: Fall

texts.fr: L'emprunteuse est une mère de famille qui a deux enfants. Elle est commerçante et tient une boutique de produits cosmétiques au marché central de sa localité  située au bord de l'océan atlantique. Son  activité lui permet de s'occuper des frais de scolarité , de la santé et d'améliorer l'alimentation de sa famille d'autant plus que son mari travaille à plus de 700 km au nord du pays. L'activité génère des revenus substantiels avec surtout l'accompagnement de l'IMCEC  qui lui a octroyé trois prêts. Afin d'augmenter son stock pour satisfaire la forte demande de la période, elle sollicite un quatrième prêt de 500 000FCFA.Avec cet argent, elle compte acheter 30 rouleaux de tissus, 05 sachets de boutons, 05 rouleaux d'élastiques, des garnitures et des fils.Elle espère tirer des bénéfices consistants de la vente de ces produits et mieux prendre en charge ses besoins personnels et ceux de ses deux enfants.Son ambition est de se lancer dans l'importation de produits cosmétiques notamment en Chine et au Dubaï.
texts.en: This borrower is the mother of two children.  She is a merchant and has a cosmetics shop at the central market in her town, situated on the Atlantic coast.  Her business allows her to take care of school and healthcare expenses, and to improve the quality of food for her family, since her husband works more than 700 km away in the north of the country.  Her work generates substantial revenue, especially with the partnership of l’IMCEC, which has granted her three loans.   With the goal of increasing her stock to meet the high demand of the season, she is requesting a fourth loan of 500,000 FCFA. With this money, she plans to buy 30 bolts of fabric, 5 sacks of buttons, 5 rolls of elastic bands, decorations, and threads.  She hopes to make consistent profits from the sales of her products and to better meet her personal needs and those of her two children.  Her ambition is to break into importing cosmetic products, mainly from China and Dubai.

loans.use: to buy 30 bolts of fabric, 5 sacks of buttons, 5 rolls of elastic, decorations and thread.

loans.name: Veronica

texts.en:
Veronica, age 50, earns a living by selling deliciously cooked meat dishes in her "carenderia." She has a passion for cooking and has been engaged in her business for the past five years. She earns PHP 7,000 monthly. Veronica and her husband have five grown children and live in Aurora, Zamboanga del Sur.

Veronica has applied for a loan of PHP 15,000.00 from GDMPC in order to buy materials to repair her display area and to purchase additional food processing items. She joined GDMPC in 2008. 

Veronica hopes to boost her income by owning and operating a food stall in the marketplace.

loans.use: to repair her display area and to purchase additional food processing items

loans.name: Abbas

texts.en: Abbas is a 43-year-old married man from Lebanon. He is living with his wife and three school-aged children. He has owned a communications and mobiles shop since 2000. He also sells electrical equipment from his shop. His wife works as a teacher in a local school in order to provide the family with extra financial support. This will be his third Kiva loan and we note that he has a very good repayment history. With his requested loan of $1500 from Kiva partner Ameen s.a.l, he will redecorate his shop and purchase added products and supplies. He is sure that the loan will help him increase his sales and therefore his profits. In the future, he is looking to further expand his business.

loans.use: to redecorate his shop and purchase added products and supplies

loans.name: Mohamed B.

texts.en:
Mohamed, age 37, established his liquor sales business in 2006. He began his endeavor because he had to drop out of school after the death of his father, who had been responsible for his school fees. Mohamed had to take to business to support his mother and his other brothers and sisters. Working six days a week and 10 hours a day, he earns about Le 1,200,000 every month from this business. 

Mohamed and his wife have three children, ages six, 10, and 12. He has two additional dependents who live with him because he decided to support them while they attend school. 

Mohamed would like to request a loan in the amount of Le 5,000,000. He has already received and successfully repaid three loans, and now requires a new loan in order to buy ten cartons of bumba gin (Le 150,000), 20 cartons of chocolate pega (Le 168,000), and 15 cartons of bitter cola pega (Le 168,000). He expects that this loan will enable him to increase his monthly profits by approximately Le 200,000. 

In the future, Mohamed plans to open another shop and hire a salesperson to help him sell his wares at the new shop. He thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to buy ten cartons of bumba gin, 20 cartons of chocolate pega, and 15 cartons of bitter cola pega

loans.name: Gladys

texts.en:
Gladys is 51 years old, married, and has five children aged 5 to 25. She operates a small retail business selling maize, beans, perfumes, and other cosmetics. Gladys has been running this business for five years and employs one person. She intends to use her loan to purchase more maize and beans for sale. 

In the future, she hopes to expand her business into a wholesale one. She also hopes to buy a plot of land to build rental houses. Gladys describes herself as visionary.

loans.use: to purchase more maize and beans to sell

loans.name: Zeinab

texts.en:
Zeinab is a 58-year-old married woman and mother of three children. She has been raising cattle since 1990, which is her only source of living.  Zeinab sells her cattle's milk and the yogurt she prepares to loyal customers. She has taken good care of them during these last 21 years.

Zeinab is requesting a loan from Al Majmoua for the first time because she needs to buy food for her cattle and new plastic milk jars. Zeinab is also going to help her daughter with her wedding preparations and hopes to stay capable of helping her children make their dreams come true. Zeinab hopes to increase the number of her cows to increase her income and hopes to keep her customers satisfied.

loans.use: To buy food for her cattle and new plastic milk jars

loans.name: Mohammad

texts.en:
Mohammad is from Al Hashmi- Amman. He is a 49-year-old married male with five children.

Mohammad is requesting a loan of 2,000 JD to improve his Dry Cleaning shop and to purchase new equipment for it.

Mohammad is looking to open a new branch of his shop and purchase a home for his family.

loans.use: to purchase new equipment for his dry cleaning shop

loans.name: Julius

texts.en:
Julius is 39 years old, married, and has three children aged two to seven. For ten years he has operated a boda boda (motorcycle transport business) in a busy but competitive area. He describes himself as a focused, visionary and devoted man.

Julius is a very good client who pays back his loans on time. He intends to use this loan to purchase another motorcycle.

Julius is very determined to do well. In the future, he hopes to venture into the matatu (mini-bus) and taxi business.

loans.use: to purchase another motorcycle.

loans.name: Tsuma

texts.en:
Tsuma has operated a medical clinic business for the past nine years. His customer base is comprised of neighbors and passers-by. His major challenge is a low number of customer turn-out. He dreams of expanding his medical clinic to incorporate outpatients in the future.

Tsuma and his wife have three children, all of whom have graduated from school. He lives at a rental house that has neither electricity nor piped water. His greatest monthly expense is medical bills.

With the Kshs 20,000 loan he is requesting, Tsuma wants to purchase medicines for his clinic. He decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost his business.

loans.use: to purchase medicines for his clinic

loans.name: Crecencia

texts.en: Crecencia, a 56-year-old married mother of four grown children, lives in Aurora, Zamboanga del Sur, Philippines where she has been buying and selling  crabs for over 11 years, earning a monthly income of PHP 10,000.00. Having joined GDMPC recently, Crecencia is requesting a loan of PHP 15,000.00 to add to her capital to purchase more crabs to satisfy market demand and make a good profit.

loans.use: to add to her capital to purchase more crab to sell.

loans.name: Caroline

texts.en:
Caroline is a 53-year-old widow with five children. For the past six years she has cooked and sold chapattis (a local food) by the roadside at a small kiosk. She often serves school children and residents in the area. Caroline also raises chickens and practices subsistence farming. She describes herself as humble and honest.

Caroline intends to use her SMEP loan to buy more ingredients so that she can cook more chapattis. In the future, she hopes to expand her business so that she can educate her children up to university level.

loans.use: to buy more chapatti ingredients.

loans.name: Yi

texts.en: Mrs.Yi and her husband have been married just a few years, and both work planting crops.  Yi is requesting a loan for $500 to purchase land upon which they hope to build a house in the future.

loans.use: to purchase land.

loans.name: Malick

texts.fr: L'emprunteur est un jeune célibataire ainé d'une famille de 05 enfants.Son père , âgé de 74 ans, ne travaille plus.Il tenait un atelier de réparation mécanique dont il a transmis la gestion à son fils.Ce dernier allie cette activité avec le commerce de pièces détachées automobile. Les revenus tirés de ces activités lui permettent de supporter les charges alimentaires, vestimentaires, de soins médicaux et de scolarité.Il est sociétaire de l'IMCEC et n'a jamais obtenu un prêt de l'IMF. Aujourd'hui, il sollicite un prêt de 100 000FCFA  pour l'achat de 50 disques, 20 baguettes, 20 boulons et 20 roulements. dont la vente lui sera d'une grande aide pour mieux faire face aux besoins de la famille. Son ambition est d'acheter un taxi et d'ouvrir un grand magasin de vente de pièces détachées.
texts.en:
This borrower is a young single man, and the oldest of five children. His father, aged 75 years, does not work anymore. He ran an auto repair shop and he is passing on the management of it to his son.   The son plans to combine this with a spare parts business.  
The money made from this work allows him to buy food, clothing, pay for healthcare and education.  He is a member of l’IMCEC and has never received a loan from the IMF.  Today, he is requesting a loan of 100,000 FCFA for the purchase of 50 brake discs, 20 rods, 20 bolts and 20 ball bearings, the sale of which will greatly help him meet the needs of his family.  His ambition is to buy a taxi and to open a large auto parts store.

loans.use: to buy 50 disks, 20 rods, 20 bolts et 20 sets of ball bearings.

loans.name: Sahar

texts.en:
From Madab, Jordan, Sahar is a 39-year-old married woman and a mother of three children. She started her embroidery business from her home. With her hard work and exceptionA. talent, Sahar could expand her business into sewing different kinds of embroidery.

Sahar’s ambition is to get a license for her project and improve her family’s living standards.

loans.use: to purchase embroidery materials.

loans.name: Gardie

texts.en:
Gardie is 34 years old and married with two children. Gardie is a farmer working in the Philippines who earns PHP 35,000 each cropping season every May and October.
 
Gardie is asking for a loan of PHP 30,000 to purchase hybrid seeds, fertilizers and insecticides to ensure more crop production. Gardie grows rice and has been doing it for six years. 

In the future, Gardie hopes to generate more income to support the needs of his family and move his family out of poverty.

loans.use: to purchase hybrid seeds, fertilizers and insecticides

loans.name: Juliana

texts.en:
Juliana is a focused 35-year-old business lady. She is married and blessed with three children. One of her children is in school. For the last three years, she has been operating a general shop to make a living.

She wants in the next five years to have made a step further by upgrading her retail shop to a wholesale one. She is requesting a loan of 20,000 Kenya shillings to buy rice, sugar, pads, sodas etc. She is grateful to Faulu Kenya for enabling her to start her own business.

loans.use: to buy rice, sugar, pads, sodas etc

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy more firewood

loans.name: Gilberta

texts.en:
Gilberta is a 41-year-old woman. She is married to Sabino, who is 45 years old. They have seven children:
•	Lordes, 22 years old, who plans to study at a university in Jakarta
•	Herita, 17 years old, who is studying at the 2nd grade of Senior High School
•	Ovabia, 13 years old, who is studying at the after being sick for four years 
•	Juanery, 7 years old, who is studying at the 2nd grade of Primary School. 
•	Anastasius, 6 years old, who is studying at the 1st grade of Primary School; and 
•	Vicencius, a 3year old boy. 

Gilberta is originally from East Timor. She and her family moved to West Timor in 1999. Her husband is working in a local agency. To cover her family needs, Gilberta has to run a home-based bakery business to generate more income for her beloved family as the income of her husband is less than their needs, which increases from time to time. Gilberta was engaged in this business for 12 years before they moved from East Timor.  

Gilberta works hard for her children’s future. She has decided to send Lordes to the University. She realized that she would need much money to support Lordes during her studies at the university. 

Gilberta is thinking of improving her business by purchasing more ingredients such as wheat flour, sugar, margarine, eggs, etc. She believes that when her business improves, she will be able to send money to Lordes. Gilberta is requesting a loan of IDR 3,000,000 from TLM. She is hoping that TLM is willing to assists her in improving her business.

loans.use: To purchase more ingredients such as wheat flour, sugar, margarine, eggs, etc.

loans.name: Carolyne

texts.en:
Carolyne is 34 years old, married, and has three children aged 9 to 15. She is a green grocer selling avocados in a commercial area. She has been doing this for seven years. Carolyne intends to use her loan to purchase more avocados in bulk and at a lower price since they are in season. 

Carolyne hopes to use the profits from her business to educate her children. She also hopes to expand her business by selling more fruit and dreams of starting a chain of green grocers. Carolyne describes herself as responsible, open minded, and outspoken.

loans.use: to purchase more avocados

loans.name: Merlyn

texts.en:
Merlyn is 53 years old and lives in Dapitan City. She is married with five children. 

To earn a living, Merlyn has a business selling fish. She earns about PHP 2,000 each month doing this type of work. Merlyn has requested a loan of PHP 5000 to purchase more fish to sell.

Merlyn has been a member of PMPC for three years.

loans.use: to purchase more fish to sell

loans.name: Samar

texts.en: Samar is a 20-year-old Lebanese single woman. She is living with her parents and three siblings. She is still quite young, but she has proven to be a successful entrepreneur with her amusement shop.  She has owned and run this business for the past two years. Today, she is requesting to borrow $1200 from Kiva partner Ameen s.a.l to purchase sweets, hubble-bubbles (water pipes) etc. She is intent on further expanding her business and adding a small corner where customers can visit her shop not only to play but also to chill out and have a good time. She is positive about her business prospects and hopes to be able to open a new branch of her shop in the coming years.

loans.use: to purchase sweets, hubble-bubble water pipes, etc.

loans.name: Prom

texts.en: Prom and his wife, the parents of two children, both fish for a living, earning about $6 per day. Prom is requesting a loan of $300 to purchase a new boat. He hopes to be able to send his children to university in the future.

loans.use: to purchase a new boat.

loans.name: John

texts.en:
John is a farmer from Eldoret in Rift Valley, Kenya, where he has been farming for 15 years. His mixed farm produces potatoes, maize, vegetables, and milk, which are all sold locally. Farming has been his main source of income. He is age 50 and married. He has eight children between the ages of 10 and 27 who all attend school.

John has made a loan request of 62,400 Kenyan shillings (KES) in order to purchase and insure a dairy cow. The extra income from this loan will enable him to venture into other businesses. His primary challenge has been fluctuation in the market prices of farm produce. He hopes that in the near future his milk production will have increased and he will be the leading supplier of milk to the local market.

loans.use: to purchase and insure a dairy cow

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase petrol for resale.

loans.name: Georges

texts.en:
Georges is a 39-year-old single man from Lebanon, living with his parents and two siblings. He has owned a bus for the past four years. During the school year, he transports students from their houses to school and vice versa. And during the summer, he serves customers who ask for private transportation such as mountain trips, picnics etc.

Georges works hard and he is the only income source of the family. Today, he is requesting to borrow $1200 from Kiva partner Ameen s.a.l to perform the needed maintenance on his bus to make it safer. In the future, he is planning to purchase a new bus.

loans.use: to perform the needed maintenance on his bus to make it safer.

loans.name: Ibra

texts.fr: Fièrement assis dans son atelier de couture entouré de ses machines et de morceaux de tissus multicolores éparpillés sur le sol, l'emprunteur est un père de famille qui vient de loin. En effet, après 10 ans d'apprentissage du métier, il s'installe à son compte avec seulement une machine à coudre prêtée par sa sœur. Ce n'est qu’après 03 ans de dure labeur qu'il parvient à acquérir sa propre machine achetée à 90 000F. Aujourd'hui, il dispose d'un magasin qui lui sert d'atelier et de salle d'exposition et il a 05 machines et 01 groupe électrogène pour pallier aux coupures d’électricité. Il est marié et père de trois enfants. Chaque mois, il dépenses en charges de location, d'alimentation, de santé et de scolarité.Depuis son adhésion à l'IMCEC, il a obtenu deux prêts .Il sollicite actuellement un troisième prêt de 500 000FCFA pour l'achat de 20 caisses  de tissus soy, 20 mètres de tissus basin riche et 2 rouleaux de renfort. Les bénéfices tirés de ce financement lui permettront de s'équiper d'avantage, de recruter du personnel mais aussi de bien se préparer à réaliser son ambition qui est d'implanter dans s localité une entreprise de couture.
texts.en: Proudly seated in his sewing workshop surrounded by his sewing machine and pieces of multi-colored cloth spread out on the floor, this borrower is a father who has come a long way.  In fact, after 10 years of apprenticeship in this profession, he set up his own business with just one sewing machine lent to him by his sister. It was only after three years of hard work that he acquired  his own machine for 90,000 F.  Today, he owns a store which serves at a workshop and a showroom, and he has 5 machines and one electric generator to get him through power outages. He is married and the father of three children.  Each month he pays for rent, food, healthcare and schooling.  Since he became involved with l’IMCEC, he has received two loans.  He is now requesting a third loan of 500,000 FCFA for the purchase of 20 cases of silk fabric, 20 meters of basin (cotton) riche fabric and two bolts of lining.  The profits made from this financing will allow him to better equip his shop and to recruit personnel, and also to help him reach his goal of establishing a tailoring business in his town.

loans.use: to buy 20 cases of silk fabric, 20 meters of Bazin Riche fabric,  and two bolts of lining.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to purchase clothes for trade

loans.name: Phann

texts.en: In Cambodia, there are many kind of jobs. Mrs. Phann has been running a business as a roast-beef seller near a market for many years. Whereas her husband, he operates a motorbike driver in Siem Reap Province of Cambodia. Furthermore, both of them can earn about $9 per day and so far they have six kids. To help the family live in comfortable situation, two of the six kids are working in the garment factory workers, and they could get extra salary per month.  Mrs. Phann wanted to create a new business to purchase a charcoal oven for making bread but she does not have enough money to buy it .therefore, she wishes to borrow from Kiva loan in the amount of $500.

loans.use: To purchase a charcoal oven for making bread.

loans.name: Emily

texts.en:
This is Emily, 61, a resident of Tanza, a part of Cavite City in the Philippines. She is married to Jose, a driver and is the mother of two children, both of whom are working. Her husband and she manage their own household while operating their businesses. At this time, she is working hard to continually provide income for their everyday expenses.

Emily operates a variety store adjacent to her house. In the Philippines, a variety store is basically a small convenience store, which retails groceries, toiletries and beverages piecemeal to the local neighborhood. It is the place to go to buy one sachet of shampoo, five PHP’s worth of cooking oil, or an egg. Emily profits by getting supplies at wholesale prices and selling them by the piece. She also runs a tricycle unit (motorcycle with sidecar) and sells mineral water to the community. Her regular customers are her neighbors and those in the local community. She earns a minimum of 700 PHP in sales every day.

Emily is requesting a 21,000 PHP loan which she will use to buy groceries, various products and mineral water to expand her inventory. A portion of the loan will also be used for the maintenance of her tricycle unit. She expects a boost in her income as she expands her business.

Emily hopes to be able to grow her businesses soon, just as she hopes to hand them over to the next generation. She faithfully attends meetings with her co-fellowship* members every week where she shares stories of her work and draws strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners and clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of fifteen to thirty community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to pay for grocery items and products for her business and for maintenance of her tricycle unit.

loans.name: Ali

texts.en:
Ali is a 38-year-old married man from Lebanon. He lives with his wife and two young children who are still attending school. He has made his living as a professional taxi driver. 

In 2009, he purchased a van and started to operate services for students in his town as well as neighboring villages. In addition, he serves private customers upon their request. 

Today, he is requesting to borrow $1200 from Kiva partner Ameen s.a.l to perform much needed maintenance on his van. He will repair the engine, change the tires and repaint his shuttle. He estimates that the loan will help him increase his profits by 15%.

loans.use: to perform much needed maintenance on his van.

loans.name: Isabel

texts.en:
This is Isabel, 27, a resident of Tanza, a part of Cavite City in the Philippines. She is married to Eduardo, her partner in business and is also the mother of two children. Together with her husband, they manage their own household while operating their businesses. At this time, she is working hard to continually provide income for their everyday expenses.

Isabel operates a variety store adjacent to her house. In the Philippines, a variety store is basically a small convenience store, which retails groceries, toiletries and beverages piecemeal to the local neighborhood. It is the place to go to buy one sachet of shampoo, five PHP’s worth of cooking oil, or an egg. Isabel profits by buying supplies at wholesale prices and selling them by the piece. She also runs a tricycle unit (motorcycle with sidecar) and sells ready-to-wear clothes to the community. Her regular customers are her neighbors and those in the local community. She earns a minimum of 1,000 PHP in sales every day.

Isabel is requesting a 14,000 PHP loan which she will use to buy groceries, various products and ready-to-wear clothes to expand her product inventory. A portion of the loan will also be used for the maintenance of her tricycle unit. She expects a boost in her income as she expands her business.

Isabel hopes to be able to grow her businesses soon, just as she hopes to hand them over to the next generation. She faithfully attends meetings with her co-fellowship* members every week where she shares stories of her work and draws strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners and clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of fifteen to thirty community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to pay for grocery items, RTW clothes and for the maintenance of her tricycle unit.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase bundles of vegetables, potatoes, tomatoes and onions.

loans.name: Jeanine

texts.en:
Jeanine, a 32-year-old married mother of a 3-year-old, sells eggs, cassava flour, and bananas in her boutique. She has operated her well-organized business for two years, and works from 8 a.m. until 9 p.m. everyday.

Jeanine has requested a loan from Kiva lenders via Vision Finance Company to purchase more eggs, bananas, and Irish potatoes to sell. She will reinvest the additional profits in her business and save for the future.

loans.use: to purchase more eggs, cassava flour, bananas, etc.

loans.name: Jaklen

texts.en:
From Madaba, Jordan, Jaklen is 33 years old, a married woman and the mother of three children. She sells clothes and blankets and is requesting a loan of 400 JOD to purchase more clothes and blankets for her business.

Jaklen is looking to shift her business away from home and improve her family’s living standards.

loans.use: to purchase more clothes and blankets for her business.

loans.name: John

texts.en: John is 29 years old, married, and has two children aged 4 and 8. He makes and sells school bags and car cushions for customers near a main road. He  has been doing this for 11 years and has three employees. He intends to use this loan to buy more material for his business.  John hopes to use the profits from his business to expand and open another business. He describes himself as committed and ambitious.

loans.use: to buy materials to make bags and car cushions

loans.name: Jonathan

texts.en:
Jonathan has a mixed farm in his eastern Kenyan hometown that produces maize, beans and millet. In the farming business for 30 years now and employing two farmhands, he earns additional income from his wood workshop and the carpentry services that he provides to the local market. He is 51 years old, married, and has two children aged 12 and 21.

With this loan of 42,000 Kenyan shillings, Jonathan intends to purchase and insure a dairy cow. He says that this loan will enable him to acquire a quality dairy cow that will produce enough milk for domestic consumption and sale.

His biggest challenges have been an inadequate supply of water and diseases which affect his production. Jonathan plans to expand his dairy farm in the future by acquiring at least five dairy cows and constructing a better zero-grazing unit.

loans.use: to purchase and insure a dairy cow.

loans.name: Janyl's Group

texts.en:
Janyl, age 30, is a member of this group.  She is a resident of Tokmok, a small town near to Bishkek (capital of Kyrgyzstan).  In order to earn money to meet the daily needs, she cultivates strawberries and then sells it on the market.  In this way she earns 10,000 soms per month.  This profit made it possible to purchase a vehicle and improve her living conditions.  She applied for the loan because she needs money to hire labor for collecting the harvest.  In the future Janyl dreams to purchase her own apartment.

--- Where Did This Loan Come From? ---

This loan is brought to you by Mol Bulak Finance (MBF), a young, ambitious and socially-focused Microfinance Institution in Kyrgyzstan. 
MBF is strongly committed to the principles of sustainable development and upholds the triple bottom line – People (building human capital and taking care of its customers as well as society), Planet (keeping environmentally friendly) and Profit (earning revenue to expand autonomously). MBF is the only Microfinance Institute in Kyrgyzstan that delivers its services to customers 365 days a year. To learn more about MBF and view a Video presentation about the organization, please visit: http://www.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=135 
If you would like to support and learn more about Kyrgyzstan and microfinance in Central Asia, please join our Lending Team - Supporters of Kyrgyzstan – Mol Bulak Finance at http://kiva.org/team/kyrgyzstan. Members will get special updates and news from Kiva Fellows in Kyrgyzstan and from the MBF staff.

loans.use: to hire labor for collecting the harvest

loans.name: Nazeh

texts.en: Nazeh, from Madab, Jordan, is 56 years old, married, and the father of three children. He has a shop selling vehicle accessories. He started his business years ago offering vehicle maintainace, then expanded it to selling vehicle accessories too. It is Nazeh's aspiration to expand his project to include mechanicA. work and he is looking to involve his sons to increase the family's income.

loans.use: to purchase vehicle accessories

loans.name: Roueida

texts.en:
Roueida is a married woman, mother of three children, who has worked selling shoes and bags since she was 14. She is working hard on improving her business and developing the quality of products she sells. Roueida is a hard-working woman who is well known in the region. Her customers are neighbors and relatives who encourage her to improve herself more and more.

Roueida is requesting a loan from Al Majmoua for the first time in order to increase her shop's inventory of new summer goods. She is getting ready for Eid El-Fitr — a three-day Muslim holiday that marks the end of Ramadan, the Islamic holy month of fasting, when most people work hard to provide their children new shoes and clothes to celebrate these holy days. In addition to shoes, Roueida also sells bags that attract customers' attention. She plans to make a big glass door for the shop that will show her products better.

loans.use: To increase her shop's inveotory of new summer collections

loans.name: Nada

texts.en:
Nada from Madaba, Jordan, is 32 years old and married with three children. She has a grocery store which was limitied to selling candies and juice but with hard work she was able to expand into more products. Nada is requesting a loan of 400 JD to purchase new products for her store and to add a frigerator for the frozen food and to pay back her debt in order to finance her children's studies.

Note: This client does not wish to publish her picture online for culturA. reasons. The man in the photo is her husband.

loans.use: to purchase products

loans.name: Biiz Kwetungura Group

texts.en: Justus, with hand raised, is 27. The last four years have been mixed for his retail business, but this good-natured and assiduous father of four has shown his enterprising and unrelenting work ethic during this time. He began his business with savings from his farming business. Weekly Justus says his gross earnings total Ugandan shillings 140,000. He sells a variety of general merchandise such as maize flour, soap, beans, plastics, and bread. These commodities sell well because they are essential. His four years' experience in this trade has taught him a lot as regards the efficient running of a business, crisis management, and the proper management of finances. This is the first time Justus's group is accessing a loan from Pearl micro finance. Most, if not all, the group members are in business which means repaying this loan will not pause a problem. Justus is requesting this loan to purchase more retail commodities such as maize flour, rice, cooking oil, beans, sugar, and bread to sell in his store.

loans.use: to purchase more retail commodities such as maize flour, rice, cooking oil, beans, sugar, and bread to sell

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy a sewing machine.

loans.name: Em

texts.en:
Em is a farmer with $3 per day for her income. She is a single mother with 4 children, none of them are studying. Two of her children are working as workers, earning $3 per day each. The other children are helping her farming business. 

Each month, Em spends $30 on food, $10 on rental housing fees, $10 on electricity, and $10 for transportation. She would like to request a loan of $500 to buy fertilizer and seeds for farming. She hopes to have enough money to repair her house for her children to live in better conditions.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and seeds for farming.

loans.name: Ahmad

texts.en:
Ahmad from Madaba, Jordan is 25 years and has a grocery store.

Ahmad is just starting his project and is requesting a loan of 1500 JD to purchase more products for the store.

An aspiration of Ahmad is to improve his project and expand it to include frozen food. He is looking to increase his income and sales volume so that he can get married.

loans.use: to purchase more products for sale in his store

loans.name: Hay

texts.en: Hay is a farmer. Her husband is a pig seller. Their income is $6 per day. There is one child staying with this family, he is a worker earning $5 per day. Every month, Hay spends $30 on food, $10 on electricity, $10 on house rent, $10 on transportation and $10 on other expenses. She would like to request a loan of $1000 to buy a motorbike for her son to travel to work. In the future, she expects to buy some more pigs for her husband to feed and sell. She hopes her husband's career will continue running well and will extend to be a farm to make more income.

loans.use: to buy a motorbike for her son traveling to work.

loans.name: Anastase

texts.en:
Anastase is a 37 year old Rwandan entrepreneur. He is married with one young child that is 10 months old. His wife works as a teacher.

For the past 3 years, he has run his own business selling clothes and shoes. He wishes to expand his business and also sell fabric. He will use this loan to purchase the fabric and hopes to generate enough profits so he can begin to build a house for his family.

loans.use: to buy more fabrics and shoes for sale

loans.name: Agus

texts.en: Agus, 40 years old, is married and has 2 children. He has run an Internet cafe business since 2009 and the business is going well, enabling him to send his children to school. Agus is asking for 5,000,000 IDR to replace the monitors in his Internet cafe with new ones. He now rents a room for his Internet cafe and hopes he can rent a better place and expand his business.

loans.use: to buy new computer monitors

loans.name: Delphine

texts.en:
Delphine is a 32-year-old Rwandan entrepreneur with 5 children between the ages of 3 and 14, the 3 eldest in school. Her husband is a businessman.

For the past 5 years, Delphine has run a business selling clothes. The profits from her business have helped support her family by providing funds for food, medical insurance, and school fees.  

Delphine will use this loan to purchase more clothes that she will sell for a profit. She plans to use the profit to some day purchase a house.

loans.use: to buy clothes for resale.

loans.name: Zeinab

texts.en:
Zeinab is a 34-year-old married woman who has worked as a tailor for 11 years; she enjoys her business. Zeinab is a hardworking woman, helping her husband earn their livelihoods. In addition to tailoring, Zeinab also has a small area in her shop where she sells household appliances. Most of the clients who come for tailoring needs are attracted by the appliances and vice versa.

Zeinab is skilled at what she does and works hard on improving her business as much as she can. That is why she is requesting a loan from Al Majmoua, Kiva's partner, in order to buy a specialized tailoring machine and to increase her home appliances capital.

Zeinab's business increases a lot during the holy Eid Al Fitr celebrations, a three day Muslim holiday that marks the end of Ramadan, since most people mend old clothes or request new tailored dresses and many other items. An updated machine would help a lot during this season and the coming days. Zeinab hopes to expand her business by opening two big separate shops in the future.

loans.use: To buy a specialized tailoring machine

loans.name: Kefah

texts.en:
Kefah is a 44-year-old widow and mother of 5 children, from Madab, Jordan. Kefah started her business by selling clothes from home, then after economic conditions get worse and her children entered university, she turned the project into a grocery store away from home.

Kefah is requesting a loan of 1,000 JOD to expand her business by increasing the sales volume. Kefah hopes to add a variety of products to her store so that she can meet the demands of the neighborhood.

loans.use: to add a variety of products to her store

loans.name: Sawsan

texts.en:
Sawsan is a 30-year-old Lebanese married woman living with her husband and four school-aged children. In 2000, she started running her business; she owns a female beauty salon. She provides her customers with the top hairdressing services. She is very talented and knows how to satisfy women's demand. Her income is important to help with her household expenses and to pay her children’s school fees. 

Today, she is requesting to borrow $800 from Kiva partner Ameen s.a.l. to purchase new hairdressing equipment and supplies. In the future, she hopes to further expand her business by adding new beauty services in her salon.

loans.use: to purchase new hairdressing equipment and supplies.

loans.name: Zeinab

texts.en:
Zeinab is a 21-year-old married woman and the mother of two children. Zeinab started her own business selling clothes in order to help her husband raise their children and cover most of their expenses. Zeinab is a woman with a good reputation; she is liked and supported by most of her customers.

Zeinab is requesting a loan from Al Majmoua, Kiva's partner, in order to prepare herself for the Eid Al Fitr holy celebration, often abbreviated to Eid, a three day Muslim holiday that marks the end of Ramadan, the Islamic holy month of fasting. Many people work hard to buy new clothes and shoes so their children can celebrate Eid in new clothes.

Zeinab also sells toys to increase her income and to attract children to various toys and gadgets. She hopes to improve her business and to provide her children with the best and healthy living.

loans.use: To increase her clothing and shoes inventory

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to purchase more highly favored foods such as rice, beans, maize, sorghum, millet, etc. to resell

loans.name: Eunice

texts.en:
Eunice is a 37-year-old dairy farmer.  She is married and blessed with three children who are in school.  Eunice also own a retail shop which she has been operating for over five years.  Since she joined Kiva partner Faulu Kenya, she has managed to improve her business.

Eunice hopes to become financially stable in the future.  She has requested a loan of 50,000 Kenyan shillings to buy maize flour and sugar.

loans.use: to buy sugar and maize flour.

loans.name: Garnik

texts.ru:
Гарник родился в 1951 г. в селе Агарак, окончил сельскую среднюю школу и Капанский Горный техникум, где получил специальность геодезиста. Женат имеет сына и три дочери; все дети имеют свои семьи и живут отдельно от родителей. Жена  не работает. Гарник работает на Зангезурском Медно-Молибденовом комбинате оператором, жена занимается домашним хозяйством. 
Начиная с 1995 г., параллельно со своей работой на комбинате, Гарник  занимается сельским хозяйством в селе Шхаршик (Shgharshik village): разводит пчел, а также занимается куплей-продажей и обработкой шкур крупного рогатого скота.  Полученный мед Гарник продает на Капанском городском рынке, а обработанные шкуры продает своим постоянным клиентам  в Ереване.
Сумма кредита в 1,000,000 драм необходима Гарнику для приобретения большой партии шкур, а также для покупки новых ульев, рамок, парафина и т.д.
Данный кредит является третьим по счету и Гарник всегда выплачивал свои кредит без опозданий.
texts.en:
Garnik was born in 1951 in the village Agarak. He graduated from a rural high school and Kapan Mining College where he studied land surveying. He is married with one son and three daughters. All of the children have their own families and live separately from their parents. His wife does not work. Garnik works at the Zangezur Copper-Molybdenum Plant as an operator.  His wife does housework. 

Since 1995, along with his work at the plant, Garnik has worked in agriculture in Shgharshik village.  He raises bees as well as buys, tans, and sells cattle hides. Garnik sells the honey at Kapan city market and sells the processed hides to his regular customers in Yerevan. 

Garnik needs a loan of 1,000,000 AMD to purchase a large consignment of hides, as well as to buy new hives, frames, wax, etc. 

This loan is his third and Garnik has always paid his loans on time.

loans.use: To buy batch of cow's skin and also to buy some new beehives, frames and wax for his beekeeping

loans.name: Priscillah

texts.en:
Priscillah is 32 years-old and married with two children in school.  To earn a living, she sells hair clips, picture frames, hair braids and sun glasses.  She has been in the business for two years.  She is a hardworking lady who hopes to grow her business.

Priscillah has benefited from Kiva partner Faulu Kenya because she has been trained on business management skills.  This has helped her to run her business.  She needs a loan of 20,000 Kenyan shillings in order to buy a sewing machine for tailoring.

loans.use: to buy a sewing machine.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy a motorbike.

loans.name: Simon

texts.en:
Simon is married and blessed with two children aged 11 and 4 who are school-going. He has been operating a retail  shop for the last five years to make ends meet and he supplements this with the earnings he makes from engaging in transport services. Previously, he used to operate a timber yard. He wants in the next five years to own a wholesale shop.

He is requesting a loan of 20,000 Kenya shillings to buy cereals, stationery, and plastic bags. He is grateful to Faulu Kenya for empowering him financially.

loans.use: to buy cereals, stationery, and  plastic bags.

loans.name: Fairouz

texts.en:
Fairouz is a 38-year-old widow, mother to three lovely children; she has devoted her life to  taking care of them and raising them the best way she can. Fairouz has struggled and is still struggling to provide the best living for her children and to fill the empty place her husband left in her family. She's the mother and the father at the same time; she's the friend and the relative that her children might need. 

She has to be ready for their needs at anytime, and she wants to provide them with the best education ever, that's why she requested a loan from Al Majmoua, a Kiva partner, in order to pay her children's school fees. Fairouz has been an Al Majmoua borrower for five consecutive loans; they all had a positive impact on her social and financial situation. 

She believes that it's her children who give her support and strength for living and improving their social and financial situation. She hopes to stay healthy to take good care of her precious kids.

loans.use: To pay  her children's school expenses.

loans.name: Joyce

texts.en:
Joyce is a 50-year-old business lady. She is married and blessed with three children of whom one is in school. She has been making a living for the last two years by running a food stall. Previously she used to sell "githeri" (maize and bean stew). She  wants in the next five years to be a major potato supplier. Her dream is to own a 4-storey building and a vehicle.

She is requesting 5000 Kenya shillings to buy potatoes, cabbages and fruit. Thanks to Faulu Kenya she is able to keep her business afloat.

loans.use: to buy potatoes, cabbages and fruit.

loans.name: Peter

texts.en:
Peter is a hard-working 38-year-old businessman. He is married and blessed with a 4-year-old child. For the last three years he has been selling spare parts in order to be able to provide for his family. He has been making an extra shilling by engaging in the transport business. 

In the next 5 years Peter wants to be able to build flats and his dream is to be a major player in the transport industry. He is requesting a loan of 30,000 Kenya shillings to buy brake fluid. Thanks to Faulu Kenya he has learnt how to attract and maintain his clientele.

loans.use: to buy brake fluid.

loans.name: Burulush

texts.ru:
Бурулуш родилась в селе Покровка (Жетиогузский район, Ыссыкульская область, Кыргызская Республика). Замужем и проживает с мужем. Мать троих детей (два сына и дочь). Старшие сын и дочь, семейные и проживают отдельно, младший сын проживает и учится в Бишкеке (столица Кыргызстана).
Бурулуш родилась в простой семье егеря. По окончании школы, в 1975 году, Бурулуш поступила в сельхозинститут на экономический факультет в город Бишкек. В 1980 году, не окончив институт, Бурулуш выходит замуж. Год спустя, в 1981 году, Бурулуш родила сына, а в 1982 году дочь. Бурулуш перевелась на заочную форму обучения и не бросила институт. Во время сессий, по уходу за детьми, ей помогали родители мужа, с которыми они проживали в селе Ак-Суу (Московский район, Чуйская область). Так как муж Бурулуш был младшим сыном в семье, то они были вынуждены жить в селе с родителями - cодержали небольшое хозяйство и занимались полеводством. В 1987 году родился младший сын. В 1994 году, после смерти родителей, они с мужем решают переехать в село Панфиловское (Панфиловский район, Чуйская область), где устроились в местном колхозе на работу и купили небольшой дом и на доходы покупали скот. В 2004 году Бурулуш устроилась в местный сельский совет, в качестве бухгалтера. Со временем получили землю, на которой стали выращивать ячмень и клевер для скота. В 2008 году она устроилась в управление аграрного развития Панфиловского района в качестве ведущего специалиста. Сейчас в хозяйстве Бурулуш имеется одна дойная корова, одна телочка,  14 голов МРС (мелкого рогатого скота) и автомашина Москвич 412. За последние годы у Бурулуш было много расходов, связанных с женитьбой старших детей и поступлением младшего сына в университет.  Поэтому, для дальнейшего развития своего бизнеса, Бурулуш обратилась в компанию Бай Тушум и Партнеры за кредитом в сумме 50,000 сом (KGS) на приобретение телят.
В планах у Бурулуш увеличение поголовья скота, а в будущем она мечтает купить хорошую семейную машину.
texts.en:
Burulush A. was born in the village of Pokrovka (Zheioguz Region, Yssykul District, Kyrgyzstan). Married and living with her husband. She is the mother of three children (two sons and one daughter). The elder son and daughter have their own families and live separately; the youngest son lives and studies in Bishkek, the capital of Kyrgyzstan.

Burulush was born in a family of modest means: her father was a forester.  After graduating from high school in 1975, she was admitted to the program in Economics at the agricultural college of Bishkek. In 1980, before graduating from college, Burulush got married. A year later, in 1981, she gave birth to a son, and in 1982 to a daughter. Burulush switched to taking classes in the distance education format and did not abandon her studies. During the exam periods, her husband’s parents, with whom they used to live in the Akh-Suu village (Moscow Region, Chujsk District) would help her take care of the children. Since Burulush’ husband was the youngest son in his family, Burulush and her husband found themselves compelled to live in the village together with the husband’s parents, where  they  used to keep some livestock and grow produce.

In 1994, after her in-laws passed away, Burulush and her husband decided to move  to the village of Panfilovskoe (Panfilov Region, Chujsk District), where they found employment in a local collective farm, bought a small house and started buying livestock with their earnings. In 2004, Burulush started working  at the local village council as a bookkeeper. Eventually they obtained a land plot and started growing barley and clover for animal feed. In 2008,  Burulush got a job as a senior specialist at the Agricultural Development Administration of the Panfilov Region. At present, Burulush has one dairy cow, one heifer, 14 heads of small livestock and one Moskvich-412  automobile. In the past few years, Burulush faced a lot of expenses because of the older children’s marriages and the younger one’s admission to the university. Therefore, in order to develop her business further, Burulush  turned to Bai Tushum & Partners  for a loan of 50,000 KGS intended for purchasing calves.

Burulush plans to obtain more cattle, and in the future she dreams of buying a good family car.

loans.use: to purchase cattle

loans.name: Robert

texts.en:
Robert is 45 years old. He is a focused and hard-working businessman. He is married and blessed with three children who are school-going. He has been operating a grocery shop selling on wholesale terms for the last six years to make ends meet. He wants in the next five years to be a distributor of fruits and vegetables in his region. 

He is requesting a loan of 20,000 Kenya shillings to buy cabbages, tomatoes, potatoes, carrots and kale. He is grateful to Faulu Kenya for empowering him financially.

loans.use: to buy cabbages, tomatoes, potatoes, carrots and kale.

loans.name: Buhumuriro Women's Group

texts.en:
28-year-old Judith is a lady with a happy-go-lucky and likeable disposition. The mother of two has other invaluable selling points with her enterprise, ambition and a sense of hard work. She has, by and large, made a lot of headway in her retail business the last three years with her ability to think outside the box and her unwavering desire to succeed. This has significantly been backed by her diligence. At her shop, she sells a myriad of commodities such as sugar, salt, maize flour, cooking oil, sandals, plastics, beans, rice, etc. She operates from Kihihi in Western Uganda.
She says she took root in this business trivial round with capital from her food sales business, which she still operates though she has someone who she delegated duties to. This is the first time Judith's group is taking a loan from Pearl Micro Finance. She says her group is determined not to be a credit risk. Weekly, she says, her gross sales revenue totals up to Ugandan shillings 120,000. Judith says this Kiva loan will lend her countenance in the purchase of more retail commodities to resell. Top on her shopping list are high-favor commodities like sugar, maize flour, rice, bread, cooking oil, tomatoes, baking powder, etc.

loans.use: to purchase more sugar, maize flour, rice, bread, tomatoes, etc to resell

loans.name: Reuben

texts.en:
Reuben is 26 years old and married and with one child.  He does carpentry to earn a living for his family.  He has been engaged in the business for two years and has employed one person to assist him in his tasks.
  
In five years, Reuben hopes to expand his business and grow his clientele.  He has requested 20,000 Kenyan shillings to buy hardwood, nails and wood glue.

loans.use: To buy hardwood, nails and wood glue.

loans.name: Zeinab

texts.en: Zeinab is a 46-year-old married woman and mother of two children. She opened a grocery store in 2009 to improve her family's living. Zeinab is a hardworking woman. She used to work in a cake factory but because her family's expenses are increasing, she insisted on starting her own business. Zeinab is a woman with a good reputation.  She hopes to increase her income through increasing her business through the requested loan from Al Majmoua-Kiva partner in order to prepare herself for the Holy Ramadan month, with new special new products such as dates, special syrups and sweets. Zeinab hopes to improve her business with better decorations and more products.

loans.use: To increase her store's inventory before Holy Ramadan

loans.name: Dativa

texts.en:
Dativa is a 41-year-old Rwandan entrepreneur with one child who is 18 years old and in school.  She is a widow and for the past nine years has been running her own business selling foodstuffs such as peanuts and beans.

She requires a loan to purchase foodstuffs that she will sell for a profit. She hopes to use the profits to purchase a house in the future.

loans.use: to buy foodstuffs to sell

loans.name: Ruth

texts.en:
Ruth is a social and hardworking 43-year-old business lady. She is married and blessed with three children who are going to school. She has been operating a general shop for the last 13 years to make ends meet. She wants in the next five years to have transformed her business into a wholesale one.
 
She is requesting a loan of 20,000 Kenyan shillings to buy electrical materials like bulbs and sockets. Thanks to Faulu Kenya, she has learned how to maintain customer relationships and to keep records.

loans.use: to buy bulbs and sockets

loans.name: David

texts.en:
David is 36 years old. He is married and blessed with three school-going children who are 12, 8 and 4 years old. He has been operating a butcher shop for the last 16 years to make a living and a life more comfortable for his family.

He wants in the next five years to have realized his dream of being a meat distributor.

He is requesting a loan of 40,000 Kenyan shillings to buy a deep freezer and meat. Thanks to Faulu Kenya, he has been able to learn the culture of saving and thus become credit worthy.

loans.use: to buy a deep freezer and meat

loans.name: Samuel

texts.en:
Samuel is 34 years old, married and has four children in school.  He runs a retail shop so as to earn a living for his family. He has been operating his business for four years. He is also employed. Since he joined Faulu Kenya, he has expanded his business and improved his family’s standard of living.

Samuel hopes to grow his business into wholesale in the future. He has requested 30,000 Kenyan shillings to buy rice, baking flour, sugar, maize flour and cooking fat.

loans.use: to buy rice, baking flour, sugar, maize flour and cooking fat.

loans.name: Sabenty Group

texts.en:
In the photo are members of the “Sabenty” group. They are small scale businesspeople based in Makeni, a city in northern Sierra Leone. They have come to SMT/Kiva lenders to seek a loan of SLL 800,000.00 for each in the group. With this loan, they will be able to expand their businesses, make more profits and consequently improve on their standard of living. 

The leader of this group is Mosses. Mosses is age 51 and was born in Makeni city, where he is currently living with his wife and five children. His wife is a businesswoman and  his children are attending primary and secondary schools. For four years, Mosses has been selling plastics shoes and sandals. He has requested this loan in order to buy a large quantity of shoes to add to his business.

loans.use: to buy a large quantity of shoes to add to his business.

loans.name: Jashan

texts.en:
Jashan is married and has three children, ages 7 to 28.  He sells fiber chemicals, does wiring, and welds. Jashan has been running this business for 15 years. He intends to use this loan to buy grinders to make his work more efficient. 

Jashan intends to use the profits from his business to pay for his children’s education. He hopes to own a private garage one day. Jashan describes himself as humble.

loans.use: to buy grinders to make his work more efficient.

loans.name: Benard

texts.en:
Benard is 45 years old, married and has five children. He repairs shoes to earn a living. He has been in the business for eight years and has employed one person. He also runs a grocery shop for extra income.  

Through Faulu Kenya, Benard has learned how to save his money and manage his business. He hopes to become a vegetable supplier in the future. He has requested 20,000 Kenya shillings to buy leather for repairing shoes.

loans.use: to buy leather for repairing shoes.

loans.name: Go Befo Group

texts.en:
M’balu is the leader of this group of entrepreneurs. M’balu was born in Makeni city about 27 years ago. She is married to a police officer and the couple has one child who is not of school going age. 

For five years, M’balu has been selling cosmetics, vests, undergarments and slippers. With the help of this loan, she will be able to expand her business, make more sales and consequently improve on her living condition. She will use her loan to buy cosmetics, undergarments, vests and slippers in large quantities to add to her business.

loans.use: to buy cosmetics, undergarments, vests and slippers in large quantities to add to her business.

loans.name: Zainab

texts.en:
This is 33 year-old Zainab. She is married and has 2 children, aged 9 and 12 years. She has 1 additional dependent who lives with her because Zainab is her caretaker.  

In 2001, Zainab established her cooking utensils business. She grew up as a petty trader, assisting her mother. Since she was not sent to school, Zainab had wanted to start a business on her own. Therefore, she established the Osusu scheme, of which she was the leader. She was able to access funds and start her plastics business. Now, she is adding cooking utensils as a new product for better profits. Zainab got some additional stock from her husband in order to increase her business.  

Working 6 days a week and 10 hours a day, she earns about SLL1,100,000 every month from this business. Zainab would like a loan in the amount of SLL5,000,000. She has already received and successfully repaid 1 loan. She now requires a new loan in order to buy cooking utensils (set pans -15 cartons @ SLL160,000, ceramic buckets - 5 doz @SLL100,000 and assorted suit pan designs, 2 cartons - SLL60,000,  and large coolman 10 @ SLL200,000). She hopes that this loan will enable her to increase her monthly profits by approximately SLL350,000. 

In the future, Zainab plans to expand her business by opening a shop and by buying a commercial vehicle/motor cycle to increase her profits. Her challenges are rainy seasons that causes slow sales and the high cost of goods. She serves a high percentage of Makeni community. She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: To pay for  cooking utensils - set pans - 15 cartons @ Le160,000, ceramic buckets - 5 doz @ Le100,000 and assorted suit pans designs 2 cartons - Le60,000, large coolman 10 at Le200,000.

loans.name: Baker's Group

texts.en:
Salone Microfinance Trust (SMT), a partner of Kiva.org in Makeni, northern Sierra Leone is very pleased to present to you members of the “Baker’s” group. These are small scale entrepreneurs who have come to SMT/Kiva lenders to seek a loan of SLL 1,000,000.00 for each borrower, in order to invest in their businesses. 

David is the leader of this group. David is 48 years old and married with five children – two in primary school and three in secondary schools. For 20 years, David has been a businessman/baker. With the help of this loan, David is going to buy bags of flour, yeast, sugar, etc., in order to bake a larger quantity of breads for sale.

loans.use: to buy bags of flour, yeast, sugar, etc., in order to bake a larger quantity of breads for sale.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy scrap metals, maize flour, baking flour, rice and beans.

loans.name: Sarah

texts.en:
Sarah lives in Uganda. She is married and has three children, all of whom are in school. She also takes care of additional family members (a sister). Sarah has a business where she sells popcorn. She has been in this business for two years, and she works seven days every week. Sarah sells her products door-to-door, by means of retail. 

Sarah has requested a loan of 300,000 Ugandan Shillings from MCDT SACCO, which she will use to buy more bags of dried maize and cooking oil. The main business challenges for Sarah include transportation and the rainy season. Her goals and aspirations for her business are to own more than one popcorn machine. 

Sarah lives in a home that she owns; she has access to electricity and doesn't have access to piped water. Her major monthly expenses include rent, school fees and medication.

loans.use: to buy more bags of dried maize and cooking oil.

loans.name: Hadjah

texts.en:
Hadjah  lives in  Uganda. She is married and has four children, all of whom are in school. She also takes care of additional family members (a sister and a brother). 

Hadjah has a business of selling charcoal. She has been in this business for ten years, and she works seven days every week. Hadjah sells her products from home, by means of wholesale. Hadjah has requested a loan of 600,000 Ugandan Shillings from MCDT SACCO, which she will use to buy more bags of charcoal. 

The main business challenges for Hadjah include transportation and the rainy season. Her goals and aspirations for her business are to own a delivery  van and also to buy a plot of land. Hadjah lives in a home that she rents; she has access to electricity and has access to piped water.  Her major monthly expenses include rent, school fees and medication.

loans.use: to buy more bags of charcoal.

loans.name: Gulnar

texts.en:
Gulnar is 53 years old and widowed. She lives in Bakay-Ata village in the north of Kyrgyzstan and has seven grown children. Gulnar worked as a cashier at the local state farm, and is described as a benevolent, responsible and very hardworking woman.

In 1995, Gulnar began to develop her business of breeding livestock and bought cattle using her initial capital of 10,000 KGS. Also, Gulnar began to cultivate land with potatoes, beans and perennial herbs. The children help her in these activities and take part in the family business. 

Gulnar intends to use this loan of 20,000 KGS to purchase ten sacks of mineral fertilizer. With the revenues, she plans further development of her business and in future, purchase a house for her son.  

Bai-Tushum and Partners use Kiva funding to target the especially vulnerable population. Bai-Tushum and Partners is one of the leading Microfinance Institutions in Kyrgyzstan. As a reliable financial partner, Bai-Tushum contributes to the economic development of the Kyrgyz Republic through the delivery of microfinance services in rural and urban areas that lead to increased employment and meet the interests of its clients and investors.

loans.use: to purchase mineral fertilizer.

loans.name: Samuel Buenaventura

texts.es:
El joven estudiante de 20 años de edad está cursando la carrera de Ciencias Jurídicas en el primer año. Cuenta con la ayuda de sus padres. Su madre es mecánica dental y su padre tiene una olería, donde se dedica a la fabricación de ladrillos.
Samuel ayuda a su  padre en la administración de la pequeña micro industria familiar. Con mucho esfuerzo está logrando cubrir los gastos de su Universidad, como ser la matricula, materiales didácticos y otros. Comenta que uno de sus mayores sueños es poder convertirse en un gran abogado y de esa forma no solo conseguir más ingresos para él y su familia, sino también ayudar a los demás. Samuel, a pesar del poco tiempo que tiene igual ayuda en la pequeña micro industria familiar.
El solicita el crédito para el pago de las cuotas de la universidad, y de esa forma poder aligerar un poco los gastos en la casa. Agradece a la Fundación por la oportunidad que esta le da.
texts.en: This young 20 year-old student is working toward a degree in law; He is in his first year of studies, and his parents are helping him.  His mother is a dental technician and his father has a business where he makes clay bricks.  Samuel helps his father to manage the small family business, and with a lot of effort he is managing to cover his educational expenses such as tuition, educational supplies, and other items.  He comments that his main dream is to be able to become a great lawyer, not only to earn more money but also to help others.  In spite of having very little free time, Samuel helps out in his family's small business.  Samuel requests a loan so that he can pay his university fees and also help out a bit with the household expenses.  He thanks the Fundación for the opportunity that they are giving him.

loans.use: Pago de las cuotas de la universidad

loans.name: Mercy

texts.en:
Mercy is aged 36 and married. She has 2 children, aged 18 months and 11 years. She has been practicing mixed farming for the last 5 years, producing cabbages, potatoes and tomatoes, which she sells locally. She earns additional income from her business of selling vegetables at a local market. She faces the challenge of high prices of farm inputs, which affects her production.

With this loan of 60,000 Kenyan shillings, she intends to cultivate cabbages, potatoes and tomatoes. The extra income from this loan will enable her pay the school fees for her children. In the future, she intends to buy a piece of land and construct her own rental houses. 

Mercy comments that Juhudi Kilimo is a good company because they care for small-scale farmers.

loans.use: to cultivate cabbages, potatoes and tomatoes.

loans.name: Sarah

texts.en: Sarah lives in Uganda. She is married and has five children, all of whom are in school. Sarah has a retail shop. She has been in this business for over 10 years and she works seven days out of every week. Sarah sells her products in a shop at retail.  Sarah has requested a loan of 2,000,000 Ugandan Shillings from MCDT SACCO to buy bags of charcoal, cartons of salt, jerycans of cooking oil and boxes of soap. She generates additional income through tailoring. The main business challenges for Sarah include transportation, defaulters and the ever-increasing price of commodities in Uganda.  Her goals and aspirations for her business are to own a wholesale shop and a delivery van to ease in transportation. Sarah lives in a home that she owns. She has access to electricity and to piped water. Her major monthly expenses include school fees, medication and feeding the family.

loans.use: To buy more charcoal, salt, soap and cooking oil

loans.name: Sop Serigne Cheikh Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe de solidarité Sop Serigne Cheikh est créé depuis le 27 décembre 2010, il est composé de seize femmes qui sont du même village et qui ont comme activités principales le petit commerce et l'élevage.


Madame Ndéye Codou la responsable est âgée de 29 ans, mariée mère de quatre enfants elle est éleveuse mais mène aussi une activité de petit commerce; elle est debout à droite à l'extrême sur la photo habillée en jaune.

Elle posséde beaucoup de chèvres et moutons qu'elle vend dans les marchés hebdomadaires où elle achéte les fruits et légumes pour les revendre dans son village.


Son prêt lui servira à diversifier son commerce en achetant d'autres produits à vendre pour se faire plus de revenus.


Elle participe à la prise en charge de sa famille par la nourriture et l'habillement.
texts.en:
The solidarity group Sop Serigne Cheikh was created on 27 December 2010 and comprises 16 women who are from the same town and are mainly active in running small retail businesses and animal rearing.

Ms. Ndéye Codou, the group leader, is a 29-year-old married mother of four. She raises animals but also runs a small retail business; she is dressed in yellow and standing all the way on the right in the photo.

She owns many goats and sheep that she sells at the weekly market days, where she buys fruits and vegetables to re-sell at her town.

Her loan will serve to diversify her business by buying other products to sell in order to earn more income.

She participates in providing for her family by taking care of food and clothing needs.

loans.use: To diversify her business.

loans.name: Melissa Marie Fabiola

texts.es:
Melissa tiene 26 años de edad, está cursando la carrera de Licenciatura en Psicología. Se encuentra cursando actualmente el segundo año de la carrera. Comenta que quienes la ayudan en el gasto de sus estudios son sus padres.
Su madre es ama de casa y su padre es docente. Melissa, con mucho esfuerzo está logrando cubrir los gastos de su Universidad, como ser la matricula, materiales didácticos y otros. Su sueño es terminar su carrera y convertirse en una buena profesional, también sueña con poder asistir a charlas y seminarios internacionales donde podrá ampliar el conocimiento obtenido en la universidad. 
Ella solicita el crédito para cubrir los gastos de su universidad, como ser cuotas y demás. Ella agradece la oportunidad que le da la Fundación ya que sabe que le será de gran ayuda.
texts.en:
Melissa is 26 years old and is working toward her Bachelor’s degree in Psychology.  She is currently in the second year of the course work.  She comments that her parents are the ones helping her with school expenses.

Her mother is a housewife and her father’s a Teacher.  Through much effort, Melissa is paying such costs in her major as registration fees, school supplies and others.  Her dream is to complete the career and become a good professional.  She also dreams with being able to attend international seminars where she will be able to expand on what she’s learned at university.

She is asking for the loan to cover costs, like tuition payments and others, at the university.  She is grateful for the opportunity the Fundación is giving her.

loans.use: Pago de las cuotas de la Universidad

loans.name: Sopey Naby Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe de solidarité Sopey Nabi est créé le 9 juillet 2011 jour de l'inauguration du Banc Villageois il est composé de 22 femmes issues du même quartier, elles sont parentes, amies, voisines et ont comme activité dominante le commerce.


Madame Khady la responsable âgée de 64 ans est mère de 7 enfants et grand-mère de 6 petits enfants, elle capitalise plus de 10 ans d'expérience dans la vente de pain. Elle est debout à droite sur la photo emmitouflée d'un châle blanc et a levé la main droite.


Elle se ravitaille à la boulangerie du quartier pour le pain et dans les boutiques pour ( le beurre, chocolat, fromage, thon...); et revend dans son kiosque.

Elle envisage avec son prêt acheter des produits alimentaires et augmenter la quantité de pain pour mieux satisfaire la clientèle afin de se faire plus de revenus.


Khady a la prise en charge des factures d'eau et elle souhaite aussi augmenter son épargne.
texts.en:
The solidarity group Sopey Nabi was created on 9 JuL. 2011, the day the local Village Loan Fund was established. It comprises 22 women who come from the same area; they are relations, friends, and neighbours, and their main activity is retail.

Ms. Khady, the group leader, is a 64-year-old mother of seven and grandmother of six. She has gained more than 10 years of experience in selling bread. She is standing on the right in the photo, wrapped in a white shawl with her right hand raised.

She replenishes her suppL. of bread at the local bakery and gets her other goods (butter, chocolate, cheese, tuna...) at the stores, and re-sells them at her kiosk. 

With her loan, she intends to buy food items and to increase her stock of bread in order to better satisfy her clientele and earn more income.

Khady takes care of the water bills at home, and she also hopes to increase her savings.

loans.use: To buy bread and food items destined for resale.

loans.name: Alex

texts.en:
Alex is 24 years old, single and hardworking.  For three years, he has been selling wallets, belts, caps and bracelets.  He operates his business without a permanent business premise. He joined Faulu Kenya so that he would save his money and access business loans easily because the members of the group guarantee each other's loan.

Alex hopes to own a wholesale business in the future.  He has requested 10,000 Kenyan shillings to buy wallets, belts and caps.

loans.use: To buy wallets, belts and caps to sell.

loans.name: Electine

texts.en:
Electine is 28 years old and married with two children aged six years old and two years old. She operates a general store where she sells various items to the locals at Kakamega. She has been in this business for two years now. She says the business is profitable and the only major challenge she has is low purchasing power by her customers.

Electine plans to use this loan to purchase flour, sugar, cooking oil, rice, detergents and beverages to grow her business and meet the demands of her customers. She hopes to build rental houses in the future. She describes herself as a visionary lady.

loans.use: to purchase flour, sugar, cooking oil, rice, detergents  and beverages

loans.name: Racheal

texts.en:
Rachel is a 25-year-old Rwandan entrepreneur. She is single and for the past two years has owned a restaurant.  This successful business has helped her support herself and her extended family, especially her mother.  

She will use this loan to purchase more foodstuffs that will supply her restaurant. She plans to continue to run her restaurant and earn enough profits that will allow her to accumulate savings.

loans.use: to buy more foodstufffs to supply her restaurant

loans.name: Oliver

texts.en: Oliver lives in Uganda. She is married and has eight children, seven of whom are in school. Oliver has a fruits and vegetables stall.  She has been in this business for over 10 years and she works six days out of every week.  Oliver sells her products from home by means of wholesale. Oliver has requested a loan of 700,000 Ugandan Shillings from MCDT SACCO to buy more boxes of mangoes, oranges, tomatoes and cabbages.  The main business challenges for Oliver include defaulters and the ever-increasing prices of fruits and vegetables.  Her goals and aspirations for her business are to start going to farmers for fruits and vegetables and to own a delivery van .Oliver lives in a home that she owns. She has access to electricity but doesn't have access to piped water. Her major monthly expenses include school fees and medication.

loans.use: To buy more boxes of  mangoes, oranges, tomatoes and cabbages

loans.name: Gibrilla

texts.en:
Gibrilla is 27 years old and married to an experienced trader. The couple has two children, ages eight and 10. Gibrilla began his retail business in 2001. He had dropped out of school and worked with his father, learning the retail business. When he became an adult, he continued trading, selling cosmetics and items such as candy, biscuits, cigarettes and other items. Gibrilla works six days a week, 10 hours a day to earn 950,000 SLL each month. He gets his supplies from Freetown and he travels there by public transport weekly.

Gibrilla is requesting a 4,000,000 SLL loan to buy supplies such as cigarettes, sweets, and biscuits. He hopes that his loan will increase his monthly profit by approximately 220,000 SLL. In the future, Gibrilla plans to educate his children, build a house and start saving to open a larger shop. He thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to buy cigarettes, sweets, and biscuits to sell

loans.name: Grace

texts.en: Grace lives in Uganda. She is married and has three children, all of whom are in school. Grace has a restaurant. She has been in this business for seven years and she works six days out of every week. Grace sells her products from home, by means of retail. Grace has requested a loan of 1,000,000 Ugandan Shillings from MCDT SACCO to buy more bunches of bananas, beef, a bag of rice, sweet and Irish potatoes and a bag of charcoal.  The main business challenges for Grace include thieves and the ever-increasing price of foodstuffs.  Her goals and aspirations for her business are to own a fully stocked restaurant. Grace lives in a home that she rents. She has access to electricity but doesn't have access to piped water. Her major monthly expenses include rent, school fees and medication.

loans.use: To buy more bananas, rice, sweet potatoes and Irish potatoes

loans.name: Veredianne

texts.en:
Veredianne is a 49-year-old Rwandan entrepreneur with 6 children between the ages of 9 and 26 years old. Three of the children have completed primary school and the youngest three are still in school. Veredianne's husband sells foodstuffs.

For the past 11 years, Veredianne has also run a business selling foodstuffs. Her business has helped meet her family's needs. Veredianne will use this loan to purchase more foodstuffs that she will sell. With the future profits from her business, she hopes to renovate her house.

loans.use: to buy foodstuffs to sell

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to pay for assorted cooking utensils: rubber bowls, 3 cartons of flasks and 10 set of food dishes

loans.name: Josephat

texts.en:
Josephat is 42 years old and married, with three children aged between 5 and 15 years old. He has operated a retail shop at a local market in Kakamega for three years. He says the business is profitable and the only major challenge he has is financial constraints.

Josephat plans to use this loan to purchase food items, beverages and detergents to grow his business and meet the demands of his customers. In the future, he hopes to grow his business to wholesale. Josephat also has hopes to purchase a van to use in the business. He describes himself as a visionary man.

loans.use: to buy food items, beverages and detergents

loans.name: Alejandro Daniel
