texts.es: El joven Alejandro, es una persona que trabaja en una maquiladora de nuestra localidad, tiene una ferretería en la vivienda de su mama, y el por las tardes y fines de semana la atiende, su distinguida esposa también trabaja en una maquiladora, para tener una mejor calidad de vida, ellos acaban de tener una bebe por lo que  están muy  contentos de que les diéramos la confianza y la oportunidad de poder servirle  agradece  el  apoyo  brindado por la  institución por  que de esta  manera  podrá  hacer  su sueño realidad  el cual  es hacer  crecer  su  negocio realizando   la  compra  de  mercancía.
texts.en: Alejandro is a young man who works in a cross-border assembly plant in our town.  He also has a hardware store in his mom's home and he works there in the afternoons and on weekends.  His wife also works in a cross-border assembly plant in order to provide them with a better quality of life.  They have just had a baby and so they are very happy that we have placed our trust in them and given them this opportunity.  They are grateful for the support our institution has given them to help them achieve their goal of growing their business by purchasing merchandise.

loans.use: to buy merchandise for his hardware store

loans.name: Rose

texts.en:
Rose  lives in  Uganda.  She is married and has four children, all of whom are in school.  Rose has a business selling charcoal. She has been in this business for over 10 years, and she works six days out of every week.

Rose sells her products from home, wholesale or retail. She has requested a loan of 400,000 Ugandan Shillings from MCDT SACCO, which she will use to buy more bags of charcoal. The main business challenges for Rose include transportation and the rainy season. Her aspiration for her business is to own a delivery van. 

Rose lives in a home that she owns; she has access to electricity but doesn't have access to piped water.  Her major monthly expenses include school fees and medication expenses.

loans.use: To buy more bags of charcoal.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy welding equipment

loans.name: Livingstone

texts.en:
Livingstone is 32 years old, married, and they have two children aged six and two years old. He operates a shoe sales business at a local market in Kakamega. He has been in this business for three years now. He says the business is profitable and the only major challenge he has are financial constraints.

Livingstone plans to use this loan to purchase shoes to expand his business. In the future, he hopes to grow his business to the wholesale level. He also has hopes of buying a plot of land on which he will put up rental houses. He describes himself as a visionary man.

loans.use: to purchase shoes to expand his business.

loans.name: Mary

texts.en:
Mary is 41 years old, married and has three children.  To earn a living, she operates a boutique.  She has been in the business for five years.  Since she joined Faulu Kenya, she has been able to cater for her household expenses and pay school fees for her children.  This is because her business grew with her previous loans from Faulu Kenya.

She hopes to open other outlets of her business in the future.  She has requested 20,000 Kenyan shillings to buy shirts and blouses.

loans.use: To buy shirts and blouses.

loans.name: Joaquín Bernardo

texts.es:
Desde hace 13 años, Joaquín es artesano, trabaja todos los días de la semana con la ilusión de ver crecer su negocio y día a día ir mejorando su técnica y por ende la calidad de los productos que fabrica, esta labor que aprendió empíricamente y que actualmente sueña con poder generar muchos empleos y ayudarle a la gente de su comunidad a salir adelante gracias a su microempresa, pero para esto es conciente que necesita producir mas artesanías, conseguir mas cliente y tener mas capacidad en su taller para ir creciendo poco a poco.

Es por esta razón que hoy en día Joaquín solicita un crédito que le permita comprar en grandes cantidades materia prima como lo es Yeso, cemento, moldes, hierro, resina, entre otros; ya que así podrá ampliar su producción y proporcionalmente las utilidades, lo que le ayudará a mejorar poco a poco su calidad de vida.
texts.en: Joaquín has made handcrafts since he was 13, and works hard every day to improve his technique and grow his business; he dreams one day to employ others and help his community through his micro-business.  He knows he has to work hard, attract clientele and increase the productiivity of his workshop.  For this reason, Joaquín now seeks a credit to buy craft materials such as molds, metal, resin, cement and other products; he is confident that this will increase his production of crafts and help him achieve a better quality of life.

loans.use: to buy craft materials

loans.name: Juan Angel

texts.es:
Juan, tiene 30 años de edad, es soltero, vive únicamente con su madre, él es agricultor, cultiva maíz, de la producción abastece su hogar y comercializa una parte para obtener efectivo, tiene 10 años de estar realizando estas labores y fue su madre quien inicio la enseñanza del cultivo de maíz.
Él está solicitando un préstamo un préstamo para la compra de tres sacos de fertilizantes, estos son para aplicarlos al cultivo, con la intención de obtener una mejor producción para mejorar la alimentación y los ingresos del hogar. 
Su objetivo a largo plazo es mejorar su vivienda, ya que actualmente es de adobe y quiere reconstruirla con ladrillo de cemento, también la introducción de energía eléctrica, contribuyendo así a una mejor condición de vida con su madre.
texts.en:
Juan is 30 years old, single, and lives with his mother.  He is a farmer who raises corn which he uses to feed his household and also sells part of his harvest.  He’s been doing this for 10 years, an activity he learned from his mother.

He is asking for this loan in order to buy three sacks of fertilizer to spread on his crop, so that he can improve his production and have more from which to feed his household and provide an income.

His long term goal is to make improvements to his home.  It’s currently made of adobe and he wants to reconstruct it out of cement bricks and add electricity.  This will contribute to a better quality of life for his mother.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy merchandise for his grocery store.

loans.name: Maria Vilma

texts.es:
María, vive con su esposo y sus cuatro hijos de 16, 13, 8 y 4 años de edad, todos son dependientes, ella se dedica a atender un chalet desde hace dos años en la escuela de la comunidad, ofreciendo a los estudiantes y maestros boquitas, galletas, dulces, jugos, gaseosas, su horario de venta es de 7:00am a 5:00pm.
Actualmente solicita un préstamo para comprar mercadería, con la intención de fortalecer los productos que ofrecen por ejemplo: galletas, jugos, gaseosa, boquitas y más. Esta inversión le permitirá tener mayor variedad de productos, su único problema es que este negocio funciona mientras haya clases, al momento de salir de vacaciones ella debe procurar otro negocio.
Su visión a futuro es mejorar a través del negocio la condición económica de su familia, también enseñarles a sus hijos el negocio, para que aprendan a vender y puedan en un momento dado suplantarla.
texts.en:
Maria lives with her husband and their 4 dependent children aged 16, 13, 8 and 4.  She has had a stand for 2 years at a school in her community where she offers the students and teachers snacks, cookies, sweets, juices, and soft drinks.  Her stand is open from 7am until 5pm.

Now Maria requests a loan to buy merchandise with the idea of having more products to sell, for example: cookies, juices, soft drinks, snacks and other items.  This investment will allow her to have a greater variety of products.  The only problem with this business is that it only works when classes are in session.  During the school vacations she has to look for other business. 

Her vision of the future is to improve the economic condition of her family through this business.  In addition, she will teach her children the business, so that they can learn to sell and at some point take her place.

loans.use: to buy cookies, juices, soft drinks, snacks and other items.

loans.name: Maribel

texts.es: La Sra. Maribel es  una persona  trabajadora   y  muy  responsable  que se preocupa  para  sacar  adelante  a   su  familia  día  con  día,  en este  momento  ella  esta solicitando su crédito para comprar  mas mercancía ya que  ella se dedica a vender ropa semi-nueva y D.  este  manera  obtiene  ingresos  para   sacar  adelante  a    sus   cuatro  hijos,  agradece  el  apoyo  brindado  por  la  institución para  la realización D.  su  proyecto.
texts.en:
Maribel is a hard-working and very responsible person who is determined, day after day, to advance her family. At present, she is soliciting a loan to buy more merchandise. 

Maribel sells semi-new clothing and in this way, obtains income to improve conditions for her four children. She is grateful for the help offered by this institution for the realization of her project.

loans.use: to buy semi-new clothing to sell.

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to purchase more bags of coffee, beans and maize to resell.

loans.name: Sergio Margarito

texts.es: El Sr. Sergio es una persona muy sencilla y amable el esta casado con la Sra. Sonia y  juntos  forman  una   familia muy unida, en este  momento ellos requieren de nuestra ayuda   por que  desean ampliar su cocina ya que es  muy  pequeña  y a  ellos  les  encanta  convivir  al  realizar  la  comida  juntos,  el Sr.  Sergio quiere lo mejor para su familia es por eso que se preocupan por el bienestar de su familia dándoles lo mejor de ellos, agradece el apoyo  brindado por la institucion para la realizacion de  su proyecto.
texts.en: Sergio is a friendly simple person.  He is married to Sonia and together they form a united family.  At the moment they need our help because they want to expand their kitchen because it’s really small and they really enjoy cooking together.  Sergio wants the best for his family, worries about their well-being, and wants to provide the best for them.  He is grateful to the institution for the support given him toward completing this project.

loans.use: to expand his kitchen

loans.name: Afuwa

texts.en:
Afuwa lives in  Uganda.  She is married and has five children, all of whom are in school.  Afuwa has a business selling charcoal.  She has been in this business for over 10 years, and she works seven days out of every week.  

Afuwa sells her products from home, retail. She has requested a loan of 400,000 Ugandan Shillings from MCDT SACCO, which she will use to buy more bags of charcoal . The main business challenges for Afuwa include transportation and the rainy season. Her goals and aspirations for her business are to sell on wholesale only and also to own a delivery van. 

Afuwa lives in a home that she owns; she has access to electricity but doesn't have access to piped water.  Her major monthly expenses include school fees and medication expenses.

loans.use: To buy more bags of charcoal.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy a bale of waxed cotton cloth and gara lapper making materials

loans.name: Osman

texts.en:
This is 34-year-old Osman.  He is married and has 2 children ages 8 and 14 years. In 2000, Osman established his plastic foot wear business. He began his business because he never went to school, but his father was a trader who was peddling with him.  He took over the business when he lost both parents.

Working 6 days a week and 10 hours a day, he earns about 800,000 SLL every month from this business. He would like a loan in the amount of 4,500,000 SLL. Osman has already received and successfully repaid one loan and now requires a new loan in order to buy 20 packets of children's plastic shoes for 150,000 SLL, 25 packets of adult's plastic shoes for 160,000 SLL, 10 packets of infant shoes for 100,000 SLL and 10 dozen plastic buckets and bowls for 100,000 SLL.

He hopes that this loan will enable him to increase his monthly profits by approximately 200,000 SLL. In the future, Osman plans to open a shop for his wife, buy a motorcycle for commercial use for more profit and build a house on his present land.  His challenges are inflation in prices and the rainy season now. He thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to pay for plastic slippers for adults and children, plastic buckets and bowls.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy organic fertilizer

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase high grade manure

loans.name: Luis Alberto

texts.es:
Luis es un hombre de 28 años, vive en el cantón Santo Domingo de la provincia de Santo Domingo de los Tsachilas, desde muy joven aprendió a reparar aparatos eléctricos y hoy en día se dedica a dar servicio de reparación de electrodomésticos; tiene un taller al cual acuden sus clientes pero en ocasiones el se moviliza para dar sus servicios a domicilio. 
Vive con su esposa Susana y su hijo de 8 años. Susana se dedica a vender cosméticos pero en sus tiempos libres ayuda a su esposo en su jornada de trabajo que en ocasiones se extiende a quince horas diarias. A Luis su trabajo lo apasiona, desde que el estudiaba en el colegio tuvo interés por los aparatos eléctricos al punto que por iniciativa propia aprendió su oficio.

Hace unos años tuvo un accidente en su motocicleta que le cambió su vida ya que al atravesar por esta difícil situación aprendió a valorar más a su familia y hoy en día su anhelo es compartir más tiempo con ellos. Por esto Luis acudió a Fundación Alternativa, en busca de un crédito el cual le permita comprar insumos para mejorar su negocio y modernizarlo de tal manera que le tome menos tiempo sus reparaciones y así compartir más con su familia.

Luis sueña con dar una mejor calidad de vida a su familia y en especial anhela dar una buena educación a su hijo.
texts.en:
Luis, age 28, lives in the Santo Domingo canton in the Santo Domingo de los Tsachilas province.  When he was very young he learned how to repair electrical appliances.  Now he devotes himself to repairing home appliances.  He has a workshop where his customers come, but he occasionally goes to their home to provide service.

He lives with his wife, Susana, and their eight year old son.  Susana sells cosmetics, but during her free time she helps her husband with his workday, which is sometimes 15 hours a day.  Luis’ passion is his work.  Ever since he studied in school he has had an interest in electrical appliances. His interest got to the point that he used his own initiative and learned the trade.

Some years ago he had a motorcycle accident that changed his life.  Going through this difficult situation, he learned to value his family more.  He now wishes to spend more time with them.

That is why Luis came to the Fundación Alternativa to look for a loan.  He wants the loan to buy supplies in order to improve his business. He wants to modernize it so that repairs take less time.  That way he can share more time with his family.

Luis dreams of giving his family a better quality of life.  He especially wishes to give his son a good education.

loans.use: to buy replacement parts and supplies for his electrical appliance workshop.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: buy clay, nacazcol and firewood to make comales and clay pots

loans.name: Jessica

texts.es: Jessica es una mujer muy joven, es madre de dos niños y vive en casa de sus suegros junto a su esposo, la casa en donde vive es de los padres de su pareja. Para Jessica el trabajo empieza muy temprano cuando se tiene que levantar para ir al mercado en busca de los ingredientes necesarios para poder realizar la venta por la noche. Ella vende en la vereda de la casa de su suegros, realiza este trabajo sola y ya va casi 2 años en este negocio el cual le esta dando buenos ingresos como para poder apoyar en su hogar. Además no pierde en ningún momento, pues si no vende mucho durante el día, los ingredientes que quedan lo utiliza para la preparación del alimento para su familia. Lo que mas le gusta de su trabajo es que tiene tiempo por las tardes para poder estar a lado de sus hijos que aún son muy pequeños y necesitan que su madre este cerca de ellos, lo que no le gusta es tener que quedarse a veces hasta altas horas de la noche en espera de los comensales. Espera poder seguir trabajando e implementando su negocio. Es el segundo crédito con MFP, le agrada trabajar en este grupo ya que se lleva bien con todos y siempre están al tanto de lo que sucede con los demás para ayudarse entre si. Con el préstamo de 1000 soles solicitados ella implementará su local, comprando materiales para instalar el techo, ya que cuando llueve tiene que perder su inversión del día pero con eso se solucionará gran parte del problema.
texts.en:
Jessica is a very young woman and mother of two children. She lives with her husband in his parents' house. Jessica starts work very early in the morning. Each day she goes to the market to purchase the ingredients necessary to sell her product in the evening. She sells food on the sidewalk in front of her in-laws' house. She has been doing this for two years and she earns a good income to help support her household. She doesn't let anything go to waste and if she does not sell very much during the day, she uses the leftover ingredients to prepare dinner for her family. 

What she likes most about her job is that she has free time in the afternoons to spend with her children, who are still very young and need to be close to their mother. What she doesn't like about her job is that, sometimes, she has to work very late nights waiting for customers. She hopes to be able to continue working and improving her business. 

This is her second loan with MFP. She enjoys working with this group because she gets along well with everyone and because they are always there to help each other out. With the loan of 1000 soles she is requesting, Jessica will buy the materials to install her stand and the roof because when it rains, she loses revenue. The loan will help her solve this problem.

loans.use: purchase materials to build a roof for her food stand.

loans.name: Tomas

texts.es:
Tomas, tiene 56 años de edad, es carpintero y vive en compañía de su esposa y dos hijos, él posee 20 años de experiencia en la carpintería, trabaja a tiempo completo todos los días de la semana, de este trabajo ha logrado mantener a su familia, cubriendo todas las necesidades.
Él está solicitando un préstamo para la compra de madera de aceituno y pino, para la fabricación de muebles, esta inversión le dará la posibilidad de aumentar el inventario de materiales y poder dar salida a los pedidos de muebles.
La aspiración es Tomas es que su hijo él menor que es el único que estudia, pueda tener la oportunidad de finalizar sus estudios, abriéndose el camino para la superación.
texts.en:
Tomas is 56 years old, a carpenter, and lives with his wife and 2 children. He has 20 years of experience in carpentry and works full time every day of the week. From this work, he has managed to maintain his family, covering all their necessities.

Tomas is soliciting a loan to buy olive and pine wood for making furniture. This investment will give him the possibility of augmenting his materials inventory, enabling him to fulfill all of his furniture orders.

Tomas' aspiration is that his younger son, the only one still studying, can have the opportunity to complete his studies, opening his road to success.

loans.use: to buy olive and pine wood for making furniture.

loans.name: Las Cumplidas Group

texts.es:
LA SRA JESENIA DE 25 AÑOS DE EDAD CASADA CON UN HIJO ,ES SOCIA DEL GRUPO  LAS CUMPLIDAS.LA SRA JESENIA  SE DEDICA EN LA ACTUALIDAD  A LA  VENTA DE ABARROTES  EN  LA LOCALIDAD DE BARRIO PINCHA-PROVINCIA DE CHUPACA .JESENIA POCO A POCO ESTA MEJORANDO SU NEGOCIO,JESENIA SOLICITO EL PRESTAMO PARA PODER INCREMENTAR  LOS ABARROTES DE SU NEGOCIO Y ASI SURTIR MAS SU MERCADERIA DE SU NEGOCIO.LA SRA JESENIA  QUISIERA PARA EL FUTURO ABRIR VARIAS SUCURSALES EN LA CIUDAD DE HUANCAYO. LA SRA JESENIA SE ENCUENTRA UBICADA  A LADO DERECHO
VISTE POLO COLOR BLANCO, CHOMPA COLOR FUCSIA QUE LLEVA EN BRAZOS A SU BEBE.  LAS FOTOS SUPERIORES SON DE ANA MARIA Y AIDA AMPARO.
texts.en:
Jesenia, 25, is married and has a son.  She’s a member of the “Las Cumplidas” group.  She currently sells groceries in the Pincha neighborhood in Chupaca Province.  Jesenia is gradually improving the business.  

She requested the loan to increase the amount of groceries in her store and better stock it.  Jesenia would like to open several branches in Huancayo in the future. 

Jesenia is on the right of the lady wearing the fuchsia sweater and carrying her baby.  Jesenia is wearing a brown polo shirt and gray jeans. The photos up top are of Ana Maria and Aida Amparo.

loans.use: to buy groceries.

loans.name: Mery Luz

texts.es:
La Sra. Mery es madre soltera, tiene una hija de 8 años de edad la cual asiste al colegio, la Sra. Mery trabajaba en la ferretería de su hermana y tenía que dejar a su pequeña hija sola, hasta q un día decidió abrir su propio negocio para estar más tiempo al cuidado de su hija, por ello apertura su propia tienda de abarrotes y golosinas, ya en este negocio lleva 9 meses. Su principal desafío para Mery es poder mantener a su pequeña hija sin la ayuda de nadie; sus sueños de Mery es terminar de construir su casa y agrandar su negocio.
El crédito lo va a invertir en la compra de abarrotes (leche, azúcar, arroz, aceite, fideos) para así poder aumentar sus ventas. La Sra. Mery está muy agradecida por el servicio prestado, ya que se le pudo dar el apoyo para su propio negocio y por ayudarle a estar más cerca de su pequeña hija.
texts.en:
Mery is a single mother; she has an 8-year-old daughter going to school.  Mery used to work in her sister’s hardware store and had to leave her little girl alone until she was able to open her own business to be able to spend more time taking care of her daughter.  Finally one day she decided to open her own business and stay closer to her daughter.  She opened her own grocery and snack store and has been in business nine months.  Mery’s main challenge is supporting her little daughter without any help from anybody. Mery’s dream is to finish building her house and to enlarge the store.

She will use the loan to buy groceries (milk, sugar, rice, oil, noodles) to increase sales.  Mery is very grateful for the services tendered because she was able to get support for a business of her own and for helping her be able to stay closer to her little girl.

loans.use: to buy groceries.

loans.name: Sofía

texts.es:
La señora Sofía tiene ya más de treinta años dedicándose a la venta de accesorios para el hogar. 
Esta solicitando un préstamo para invertir en comprar más variedad de productos para vender que son accesorios de cocina de vidrio y artesanales, ya que no cuenta con el dinero necesario para la inversión y no quiere descapitalizar el negocio. 
Planea pagar el crédito con las ganancias que obtendrá de las ventas del negocio y que su esposo el señor Pedro se encargara de los gastos familiares y escolares de sus dos hijos que tiene con el sueldo que recibe de su trabajo. 
Desea mejorar el ingreso de su negocio y de su familia.
texts.en:
For more than thirty years already, Sofía has worked selling accessories for the home. 

She is requesting a loan to invest in buying a greater variety of products to sell, specifically glass kitchenware and handicrafts for the kitchen, since she does not have the necessary funds for the investment, and she does not want to drain the capital out of her business. 

She plans to pay off the loan with the earnings she obtains from her business sales, while her husband Pedro will take charge of the family expenses and school costs for their two children, with the salary he receives from his job. 

Her desire is to improve her earnings from her business and thus increase her family's income.

loans.use: to buy merchandise.

loans.name: Patrick

texts.en:
The partiality to farming is like a byword in most of western Uganda. Most people in Western Uganda are very exhilarated about farming and hold it in high regard. The spirit and love for farming is handed down from past generations in these areas. If one does not end up farming, they will end up engaging in the other popular economic activities like raising goats and cattle 

A 35-year-old father of four, Patrick says for his case, he set forth in this business four years ago in Rukungiri.  Not so long, one may say, but he says he is already enjoying the experience of engaging in this business and he is already seeing better days on the horizon for his business. He has been basking in the glow of good business, principally after selling most of the crops he grows like bananas and cassava. The good spells he has enjoyed however, do not mean he has not bore witness to adversity. He says during some particular dry seasons, his business suffers bad harvests and consequently, he is not able to sell most of his harvests at good competitive market prices. This, at length, adversely affects his financial standing. Monthly, this business generates sales revenue to the tune of Ugandan shillings 150,000 and he says with this Kiva loan he is going to purchase hoes, pangas and high-grade manure to apply on his farms.

loans.use: to purchase hoes, pangas and high-grade manure

loans.name: Adeline Inès France

texts.fr:
Femme de 33ans, célibataire et mère de deux enfants scolarisé âgée de 6ans à 8ans. Elle débute son commerce de vente de tissages et mèches au marche en 2007 avec un capital de 70.000Frs. ses recettes journaliers sont de 20000 à 50000frs. 

Avec ce prêt elle va acheter des variétés de tissage tel que (tissage naturel noble, olive, x-pression, tissage synthétique), des mèches tel que pony, olive, anglaise, afro. Elle fait preuve d'une bonne gestion et réserve un bon accueil à ses clients. 

Elle aimerait effectuer des voyages en Afrique de l'ouest afin d'importer la marchandise. Elle aimerait aussi renforcer les conditions de vie de ses fils en leur offrant une bonne scolarisation et éducation. 

Elle est encouragée dans son entourage pour les efforts qu'elle fournit et sa motivation dans son commerce.
texts.en:
This woman is 33 years old, unmarried, and the mother of two children, aged 6 and 8, who are both in school. She started her business selling weaves and hair extensions at the market in 2007 with 70,000 francs in capital. Her daily receipts range from 20,000 to 50,000 francs. 

With this loan, she is going to buy a variety of weaves, such Noble Natural Weave, Olive, X-Pression, and synthetic weaves, and also hair extensions, such as Pony, Olive, English, and Afro. She demonstrates good management and accommodates her customers well. 

She would like to travel in western Africa to import merchandise. She would also like to improve conditions for her sons by providing good schooling and education. She is encouraged by those around her because of her efforts and motivation in her commerce.

loans.use: to buy hair extensions and weaves

loans.name: Marceline

texts.fr:
Femme commercante de 42 ans celibataire avec 6 enfants a sa charge dont l’age varie entre 14 et 23 ans.
Ayant considere ses charges , elle se lance dans la vente de la friperie en 2002 pour prendre soin de sa  famille,  Elle vend en moyenne 6000 a 75000 frs par semaine. 
A l’octroi de son prêt elle va renforcer le stock de ses marchandises en ajoutant les ballots de draps neufs, des serviettes non utilisées, des chemises hommes , des marinieres et des body .
Avec ses benefices , elle compte epargner pour aboutir a  ses objectifs . 

Elle a pour ambition d'ouvrir un magasin pour vendre les vetements d'enfants,des femmes et  d'hommes pour assurer la scolarite de ses enfants et les amener a faire des etudes universitaires
texts.en:
This borrower is a businesswoman, aged 42 and single, raising six children whose ages vary between 14 and 23. In view of her responsibilities, she began to sell used clothing in 2002 to care for her family. She makes sales of on average 6,000 to 75,000 francs per week. 

The loan will allow her to grow her stock of merchandise by adding bales of new sheets, un-used towels, men's shirts, and baby clothes. With her profits she intends to save in order to reach her goals. 

Her ambition is to open a shop to sell  men's and women's and children's clothing, so that she can pay school fees for her children and send them to university.

loans.use: to expand her stock of bales of used clothing.

loans.name: Vincent Claude

texts.fr:
Client de  49 ans, celibataire avec 2 enfants a sa charge dont l’age varie entre 11 et 14 ans n’ayant pas pu faire des longues etudes , il arrete ses cours en  classe de seconde, et il fait des petits metiers durant plusieurs annees , apres quelques epargnes, il se lance en 2005 dans le commerce de la friperie.

Il achete des  pantalons en jeans, des jupes, pulls, tous ce dont ses clients  adorent, ses ventes sont en moyenne de 10000 a 20000 frs par jour.
A l’octroi de son prêt , il va s’approvisionner dans les magasins sur place en ville et acheter des ballots de pulls over , des survetements, des marinieres  et tous ce dont les clients aiment acheter.
Il a des strategies tres efficace, des qu’il achete un nouveau ballot d’habits, il appelle ses clients par telephone et  propose des prix abordables,

Tres discret, il a une grande et bonne  influence dans sa famille et son environnement, ayant déjà une grande charge, il prend soin de sa famille et assure la scolarite de ses enfants.
texts.en:
A 49-year-old client and single father of two children ages 11 and 14, he was not able to attend school for very long.  He dropped out at the 10th grade level, and did odd jobs for several years.  In 2005, after saving up, he got into secondhand clothing sales.

He purchases jeans, skirts, sweaters, everything that his clients love.  He averages between 10,000 and 20,000 Congolese francs in sales per day.

When his loan is disbursed, he will build his inventory from local stores, purchasing bales of sweaters, outerwear, long-sleeved shirts and everything that his clients like to buy.  He has very effective sales strategies; when he purchases a new bale of clothing, he calls up his customers on the phone and offers them affordable prices.

His good judgment gives him a wide-reaching and positive influence within his family and his area.  Already carrying lots of responsibilities, he also takes care of his family and makes sure his children attend school.

loans.use: to purchase bales of long-sleeved shirts, baby suits, skirts and sweaters

loans.name: Luz  Benigna

texts.es:
La señora Luz Benigna es una mujer trabajadora y emprendedora quien hace cuatro años inicio con unos ahorros una pequeña venta con chiverías, helados, gelatinas…etc. Ella poco a poco la fue aumentando  su negocio con la compra de otros productos como arroz, frijoles, aceite, queso, pan, jabón, papel higiénico…etc. hasta tener una pulpería bien surtida.
Ella con el crédito comprar mayor cantidad de productos y variedad en especial granos básicos, pan, gaseosa…etc.
texts.en:
Luz Benigna is a hard-working and entrepreneurial woman who, four years ago, used some savings to set up a small sales location where she sold snacks, iced treats, gelatin-based desserts, etc.  She gradually increased her business, buying other products such as rice, beans, oil, cheese, bread, soap, toilet paper, etc.  She now has a well-stocked grocery store.

Luz Benigna will use her loan to buy a larger quantity and variety of products, especially basic grains, bread, soda, etc.

loans.use: to buy basic grains, bread, cheese, etc.

loans.name: Shamim

texts.en: Shamim lives in Uganda. She is married and has three children, two of whom are in school.  Shamim has a beauty salon. She has been in this business for one year and she works seven days out of every week. Shamim sells her products from home, by means of retail.  Shamim has requested a loan of 300,000 Ugandan shillings from MCDT SACCO to buy more boxes of cream relaxers and weaves.   The main business challenges for Shamim include transportation and the rainy season. Her goals and aspirations for her business are to own a fully stocked ladies salon and to own a bridal salon. Shamim lives in a home that she owns. She has access to electricity and to piped water.  Her major monthly expenses include school fees and medication.

loans.use: To buy more boxes of cream relaxers and weaves

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy cases of different types of fish

loans.name: Patience

texts.en:
Patience lives in Uganda. She is married and has 2 children, both of whom are in school. Patience has operated a business selling clothes door-to-door for the past 2 years, working 7 days every week. Patience has requested a loan of 300,000 UGX from MCDT SACCO, which she will use to buy more bales of clothes. The main business challenges for Patience include the ever-increasing prices of clothes and the rainy season. Her goals and hopes for her business are to start importing clothes herself and to get a permanent business premises.

Patience lives in a home that she rents; she has access to electricity but not to piped water. Her major monthly expenses include rent, school fees and medications.

loans.use: To buy more bales of secondhand clothes

loans.name: Zayda

texts.es: Zayda es una joven madre, tiene 30 años, radica en su tierra natal al lado de su esposo y sus 3 hijos en casa que heredó de sus padres. A lo largo de su vida aprendió todo lo referente a las tareas del campo, principalmente la agricultura, siendo fuente principal de ingresos, y que actualmente lo desempeña y es parte de su vida. En compañía de su esposo, aran la tierra que poseen, ahí cultivan maíz, habas, papa y otros productos más. Por otro lado, también aran otras extensiones de terreno, pues a veces requieren producir más, por ello deben extender la siembra. De manera adicional su esposo trabaja en la venta de productos  reciclables, esto le ayuda a tener otros ingresos mientras  espera la temporada de la cosecha. Durante todos estos años de arduo trabajo, se ha desarrollado como agricultora, con el fin de dar mayor comodidad a sus hijos, por tanto tiene proyecciones de aumentar su producción agrícola, así como tener animales, entre ellos vacas y ovejas. Tiene muchos años trabajando de manera grupal con MFP, es una de las integrantes de más trayectoria de su grupo solidario a la que considera su mejor aliada cuando de trata de temas financieros por lo que decidió renovar siendo esta su oportunidad número 15. Con el dinero que solicita, lo invertirá en la compra de sacos de abono orgánico para su próxima siembra.
texts.en:
Zayda is a young mother.  She is 30 years old and lives in the area in which she was born together with her husband and three children.  They live in a house that she inherited from her parents.

Throughout her life, Zayda has learned everything to do with working the land and farming.  This is her main source of income, it is what she does and it is part of her life.  Together with her husband, she ploughs the land that they own where they grow corn, beans, potatoes and other crops.  They also plough other areas of land as they sometimes need to produce more.  For this they must extend their sowing.  In addition to this work, Zayda's husband also sells recyclable materials.  This helps them to have other income while they await the harvest season.

During all these years of hard work, Zayda has developed as a farmer with the goal of providing her children with more comfort in life.  She has plans to increase her agricultural production and own animals including cows and sheep.  Zayda has been working with MFP group loans for many years.  She is one of the longest-standing members of her community bank and she considers it to be her best financial ally.  For this reason, she decided to renew her loan (this will be her 15th).  She will invest the money that she has requested in buying sacks of organic manure for her next sowing season.

loans.use: to buy sacks of organic manure

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy 3 dozen of perfume and 12 dresses (boubous thioub)

loans.name: Silvia María

texts.es:
La señora Silvia María de 38 años es una mujer trabajadora y emprendedora. Ella hace 10 años con la liquidación de su centro de trabajo empezó a vender chiverías, gaseosa y granos básicos. Con los préstamos y su ardua labor  la ha ido surtiendo y mejorando cada día hasta tener una pulpería.
Ella con el crédito comprara granos básicos, carne, chiverías, pan, embutidos…etc.
texts.en:
Silvia Maria, 38, is a hardworking and entrepreneurial woman.  When her workplace closed down 10 years ago, she began selling snack foods, sodas and basic grains.  With the loan and her hard work she has been supplying and improving her business every day until she now has a general store.
She will use this loan to buy basic grains, snack foods, bread, cold cuts, etc.

loans.use: to buy basic grains, meat, snack foods, bread, cold cuts, etc

loans.name: Rigoberto

texts.es:
Rigoberto, es casado y tiene un hijo de 8 años de edad, él es agricultor, se dedica a esta actividad desde hace 15 años, su padre le enseño todo el proceso de siembra y cuido del cultivo, trabaja todos los días de 6:00am a 3:00pm.
Él está solicitando un préstamo para la compra de abono y pesticidas, para aplicarlos al cultivo, este préstamo le ayudara a que Rigoberto tenga todo lo necesario para sus cultivos y le ayude a mejorar la producción.
El objetivo de Rigoberto es ayudar a su familia, con su hijo que tengan la oportunidad de finalizar sus estudios.
texts.en:
Rigoberto is married and has one 8-year-old child. He is a farmer and has made his living at farming for 15 years. His father taught him the whole process of planting and tending crops. He works every day from 6:00am to 3:00pm.

He is requesting a loan to purchase manure and pesticides for his crops. This loan will help Rigoberto acquire everything necessary for his crops and will help him improve his production.

Rigoberto’s goal is to help his family and give his son the opportunity to finish his studies.

loans.use: to purchase manure and pesticides for his crops.

loans.name: Demba

texts.fr: L’emprunteur est un homme âgé de 65 ans, marié et père de 07 enfants. Il pratique l’élevage extensif d’ovins et de bovins depuis son jeune âgé. Du fait de la sécheresse qui a longtemps sévi dans son pays, il arrête ce mode d’élevage pour s’exercer à l’élevage intensif, consistant à engraisser ses animaux dans un enclos. Cette activité qui marche bien en zone rurale, lui procure des revenus assez consistants pour prendre en charge les besoins alimentaires, sanitaires, d’habillement et de logement de sa famille. Aujourd’hui, il sollicite un crédit de 300 000F pour acheter 02 bœufs qu’il va nourrir pendant l’hivernage et les revendre sur le marché local. Il ambitionne de construire des étables pour élargir considérablement ses capacités d’élevage.
texts.en:
This borrower is a 65-year-old man who is married and the father of seven children. He worked at an extensive livestock farm of sheep and cows when he was young. Because of the drought long afflicting his country, he halted this type of livestock farming to practice an intensive type, which consists of fattening his animals in a pen. This business, which does well in rural areas, brings in revenues substantial enough to support his family in terms of food, healthcare, clothing, and housing. 

Today, he is requesting a loan of 300,000 francs to buy two head of cattle that he is going to feed during the off-season and then sell at the local market. His ambition is to build stables to expand his livestock operations considerably.

loans.use: to buy two head of cattle

loans.name: Fatou

texts.fr: L’emprunteuse est une femme d’âgée mure qui est très entreprenante. Au bout de quelques années de travail, elle a réussi à trouver un bon local, bien positionné au centre du village pour y implanter un restaurant. Elle y sert le petit déjeuner, le déjeuner et le diner a une clientèle devenu de plus en pus exigent.Son activité lui rapporte un revenu mensuel  assez important  pour la prise en charge de sa famille sur le plan scolaire, alimentaire, sanitaire mais aussi pour le paiement de la location et des factures d’eau et électricité. Elle est sociétaire de l’IMCEC ou elle sollicite un crédit de 300 000F pour augmenter son stock et acheter des sacs de légumes, de riz brisé, de légumes et des condiments. Son ambition est d’ouvrir un nouvel fast food pour faire des hamburger, des chawarma et des fatayas local.
texts.en: The borrower [Fatou] is a mature woman who is very enterprising. After several years of work, she was successful in finding a good location, well positioned in the town center, to open a restaurant. In it, she serves breakfast, lunch and dinner to a group of customers whose demand continues to increase. Her business brings in a monthly revenue large enough to take care of her family's academic, dietary and medical expenses and also the payment of her rent, water and electricity bills. She is a member of [U]IMCEC, where she is asking for a loan of 300,000 francs in order to increase her stock and buy sacks of vegetables, cracked rice and condiments. Her ambition is to open a new fast food restaurant to make hamburgers, as well as local shawarma [a type of sandwich/wrap] and fataya [a traditional Chicken dish].

loans.use: To buy 10 sacks of rice, 5 sacks of cabbages, 10 cases of olive oil, 8 bottles of butane gas, 10 cases of carbonated soft drinks.

loans.name: Kriscia Maria

texts.es:
Kriscia, vive con su familia, su esposo y dos hijos,  ella se dedica a atender un comedor y pupuseria, este negocio comenzó por el apoyo de su esposo y de su madre, trabaja en un local alquilado y su horario de venta es de 7:00am a 6:00pm, a parte de este negocio, su esposo tiene una libreria y servicios de fotocopias y ventar de articulos de computacion.
Ella está solicitando un préstamo para la compra de mercadería como: pollo, vegetales, carnes, chicharrón, quesillo y aceite, esta compra le ayudara tanto para la producción de alimentos en el comedor como también para la pupuseria.
Su aspiración es ser una mujer exitosa, incrementar la clientela, tener casa propia y junto a su familia tener una mejor condición económica.
texts.en:
Kriscia lives with her family, her husband and two children. She makes her living running a cafeteria and pupuseria (a location selling stuffed thick corn tortillas). She began this business with the help of her husband and her mother. She works from a rented location and her hours of operation are from 7:00am to 6:00pm.

She is requesting a loan to purchase goods such as chicken, vegetables, meat, chicharrón (pork rinds), fresh cheese and cooking oil. These purchases will help her a lot with food preparation at the cafeteria as well as the pupuseria. 

Her aspirations include being a successful woman, increasing her clientele, having her own house and having a better economic condition for her and her family.

loans.use: to purchase goods such as chicken, vegetables, meat, chicharrón (pork rinds), fresh cheese and cooing oil.

loans.name: Paz Y Bien Group

texts.es: L. SRA NANCY D. 27 AÑOS D. EDAD SOLTERA  CON 2 HIJOS MENORES D. EDAD,ES SOCIA  DEL GRUPO PAZ Y BIEN .L. SRA NANCY EN L. ACTUALIDAD SE DEDICA A L. VENTA D. MENESTRAS Y A L. VENTA D. VERDURAS EN EL MERCADO D. EL TAMBO,DESD. HORAS TEMPRANAS D. L.  MAÑANA ,TRABAJA TODOS LOS DIAS  D. LUNES A DOMINGO .L. SRA NANCY SOLICITO EL PRESTAMO PARA PODER INCREMENTAR  MAS MERCADERIA EN SU NEGOCIO .L. SRA NANCY QUISIERA PARA EL FUTURO TENER UN PUESTO MAS GRAND. EN EL MERCADO EL TAMBO  Y ASI PODER OBTENER MAS UTILIDADES .L. SRA NANCY SE ENCUENTRA UBICADA DETRAS D. L. SRA QUE VISTE UNA CHOMPA COLOR ANARANJADO .L. SRA NANCY VISTE  UNA CASACA Y CHOMPA COLOR NEGRO ,ELL. TIENE EL CABELLO CORTO
texts.en:
Nancy is 27 years old, single, and has two dependent children.  She is a member of the "Paz y Bien" group.  Nancy currently works selling mixed vegetables and fresh vegetables in El Tambo market.  She works from very early in the morning every day of the week, from Monday to Sunday.  Nancy requested this loan so that she could increase her business by purchasing more merchandise.  In the future, she would like to have a larger stall in El Tambo market so that she can make more profits.

In the photo, Nancy is behind the lady wearing the orange-colored sweater.  She is wearing a jacket and black sweater and has short hair.

loans.use: to buy more merchandise

loans.name: Sergio Antonio

texts.es:
Sergio, vive con su esposa y dos hijos, él se dedica a vender de forma ambulante medicina y ropa, inicio con el apoyo de un amigo, hoy en día este trabajo le permite tener todo lo necesario para el hogar, no posee un horario fijo y actualmente necesita capital para invertir.
Él solicita un préstamo para compararse medicamentos para el negocio, invirtiendo en tabletas, frascos bebibles e inyecciones, que sean para diferentes enfermedades a tratar, con el préstamo tendrá la posibilidad de contar con diversidad de medicamentos para atender la demanda.
Su objetivo es crecer en el negocio, proveer para su familia todo lo necesario que les permita tener una vida digna.
texts.en:
Sergio lives with his wife and two children. He makes his living as a peddler of medicines and clothing. He began the business with the support of a friend. Now this job allows him to have everything necessary for his home. He does not have a fixed schedule. Currently he needs investment capital. 

He is requesting a loan to purchase medicines for his business, investing in tablets, drinking flasks and injections for the treatment of different illnesses. With this loan it will be possible for him to have a variety of medicines to be able to meet the demand.

His goals are to grow his business and provide his family with everything necessary to give them a dignified life.

loans.use: to purchase tablet medicines, drinking flasks and injections.

loans.name: Luisa

texts.es: Luisa, es  viuda y vive en compañía D. sus 4 hijos en su casa propia. Se dedica a la agricultura, ganadería, en donD. cría vacas, toros, ovejas y cerdos; también posee una tienda D. abarrotes, instalada en su misma casa. Durante estos 10 años, menciona, que se ha intensificado en las labores del campo, pero sin descuidar en la atención hacía sus hijos, quienes cuando pueden la ayudan cuidando la tienda. Cada semana se abastece D. mercadería para tener su tienda repleta D. productos no  perecibles. Con el tiempo, estos trabajos le han permitido crecer en su economía, además que alterna, cuando pasa la temporada D. siembra debe esperar tiempo para la cosecha, en tanto se dedica la tienda para no dejar D. percibir ganancias. A futuro desea desarrollar su tienda, por ello necesitará ampliarla y abastecerla con diversos productos. Supo D. MFP por medio D. sus vecinas que la invitaron a formar parte D. un banco comunal que ha afrontado tiempos difíciles y las han superado, siempre ha demostrado ser puntual en sus pagos porque siempre ha invertido bien sus créditos que en la actualidad tiene dentro D. su historial 15 ciclos D. crédito trabajando D. manera grupal. Con el dinero que solicita, lo invertirá en la compra D. mercadería para su tienda y la compra D. un toro para su establo.
texts.en:
Luisa is a widow who lives with her four children in her own home.  She farms and raises livestock.  She raises cows, bulls, sheep and pigs.  She also has a grocery store in her home.

Over the last ten years, Luisa tells us that she has intensified her work on the land but without neglecting her children who help her to look after her store when they are able.  Each week she stocks up with merchandise so that her store is full of non-perishable products.  Over time, her work has enabled her to grow financially.  She is able to alternate her work: when the sowing season is over, she has to wait for the harvest season to begin and, in the meantime, she works in her store so that she never stops making profits.

In the future, Luisa would like to further develop her store.  She would like to expand it and stock it with a variety of products.  She learned about MFP through her neighbors who invited her to join their community bank.  She has faced difficult times and has overcome them.  She has always shown herself to be punctual in making her loan repayments because she has always invested her loans wisely.  She has been working with group loans from MFP over the course of 15 loan cycles.  She will invest the money that she is currently requesting in buying merchandise for her store.  She will also buy a bull for her stable.

loans.use: to buy non-perishable goods with which to stock her store and to buy a bull

loans.name: Socorro

texts.es: Socorro tiene 55 años, su actividad es la venta de mercadería en general. Hace más de 30 años que tiene este negocio, logro aprenderlo como una alternativa de trabajo. Ella siempre ha sido una persona muy independiente y disfruta de tener un medio de ingres para mantener a su familia. El financiamiento que solicita es para la compra de ropa, cosméticos, calzado, sabanas, toallas, adornos, vasos de vidrio y cortinas. Ella sueña con mantener su negocio muy activo y aumentar su inventario.
texts.en: Socorro is 55 years old.  She sells general merchandise.  She’s been in business over 30 years.  She managed to learn it as an alternative source of work.  She’s always been a very independent person and enjoys having a source of income to support her family. The loan she’s requesting is to buy clothes, cosmetics, sheets, towels, decorations, glass drinking glasses and drapes.  She dreams with keeping her business very active and with increasing inventory.

loans.use: to buy clothes, cosmetics, footwear, sheets, towels, decorations, glass drinking glasses and drapes.

loans.name: Edenelson

texts.es: Edenelson  vive en el municipio de Soledad con su cónyuge y sus dos hijos en las edades de 1 y 2 años. Él desde que salió de su pueblo natal en el departamento de Bolívar, buscando oportunidades de mejorar su bienestar, encontró mediante la venta de suéteres una opción de ingresos inicial;  así fue como inició con un pequeño capital y con mucho esfuerzo,  con el que posteriormente logró comprar una motocicleta, para hacer sus entregas a domicilio. En la actualidad distribuye su mercancía y también utiliza su vehículo para ofrecer el servicio de transporte.  En su vida de negocio acudió a muchos prestamistas informales y pagó intereses onerosos, así que varias veces se descapitalizó y volvió a empezar, porque estuvo muy cerca de perder su motocicleta. En la actualidad esa es cosa del pasado y ha logrado construir un pequeño capital de trabajo, el cual se esfuerza cada día por cuidarlo, aunque con el gran desafío de   muchas veces no poder responder a sus clientela oportunamente,  porque la recuperación de este una vez vende a crédito, no es suficiente para ser oportuno en sus ventas. Con su credikiva, primer financiamiento que hace a la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, comprará sabanas, toallas, suéteres y mercancías,   encargadas por sus más aplicados clientes. Con éste préstamo planea iniciar el crecimiento de su capital de trabajo para obtener más ingresos y en un futuro no muy lejano lograr ahorros para comprar su vivienda, pues en la actualidad vive en casa familiar y sueña con vivir con su familia independiente, construyendo más bienestar de manera autónoma.    Edenelson está muy satisfecho con las dos actividades que desarrolla porque en días pasados aumentaron sus ganancias en un 33% y esto le ha dado un gran entusiasmo para continuar trabajando fuertemente hasta lograr su sueño.
texts.en: Edenelson lives with his partner and their two children (ages 1 and 2 years old) in the municipality of Soledad. Ever since he left his native village in Bolívar province, Edenelson has been looking for opportunities to improve his well-being. He found selling sweaters to be one option for earning money initially. This is how he started - with a little capital and a lot of effort. Later, he was able to buy a motorcycle in order to make home deliveries. Now, he uses the motorcycle both to distribute his merchandise and to provide a transport service. In the course of his business life, he came upon many informal lenders and paid expensive interest rates, so that several times he lost money and had to start again because he was very close to losing his motorcycle. Now, this is a thing of the past and he has succeeded in building up a small working capital, which he takes care to protect every day. However, it is a challenge that many times he cannot respond to his customers opportunely because when he sells on credit, he does not recuperate his money quickly enough to do so. He will use this credikiva (the first loan he has received through Fundación Mario Santo Domingo) to buy sheets, towels, sweaters, and other merchandise for his most faithful customers. He plans to use this loan to initiate the growth of his working capital so that he can earn more income and, in the not-too-distant future, save enough to buy a house. Currently, he lives in a family house and he dreams of living independently with his family to increase their well-being and autonomy. Edelnelson is very satisfied with his two businesses because recently, he has increased his profits to 33%, which has made him very enthusiastic about continuing to work hard to achieve his dreams.

loans.use: to buy sheets, towels, sweaters, and merchandise in general

loans.name: Flor Del Bosque Group

texts.es:
El grupo solidario Flor de Bosque se encuentra conformado por Johana de los Ángeles, Isaura del Carmen y Pedro Rolando tres personas trabajadoras. El coordinador del grupo es el señor Pedro Rolando quien hace 8 años que tiene una mini pulpería en la que vende aproximadamente 4,400 semanal. 
El con el crédito comprara golosinas, granos básicos y refrescos. 

Mientras Johana se dedica a la fabricación y venta de comidas en especial fritangas los días viernes, sábados y domingos desde hace 4 años e Isaura tiene una pulpería.
texts.en:
The “Flor de Bosque” (Flower of the Forest) communal bank is composed of Johana de los Ángeles, Isaura del Carmen and Pedro Rolando, three hard working people.  The group coordinator is Pedro Rolando who has had a minimart for the last 8 years where his weekly sales are approximately 4,400 cordobas.  He will use the loan to buy snacks, basic grains and soft-drinks.

Johana has been making food to sell, especially fried fast food on Fridays, Saturdays and Sundays, for the last four years and Isaura has a grocery store.

loans.use: to buy snacks, basic grains and soft-drinks.

loans.name: Ma  Del Rosario

texts.es: La. Sra. María es  una persona  que  se  preocupa  por  el bienestar de su   familia,  ella  poco a  poco  a  ido  acondicionado  su  domicilio ya  que   le   gusta  que  cuando su  familia  la visita   se  sientan muy    agusto,  es  por  ello  que  en  este  momento  ella desea  realizar  la  compra  de  una  puerta  para  la  entrada de su casa ya  que  se encuentra muy dañada y  comenta que cuando sus nietos la visitan corren el peligro de salir y ser atropellados es por  ello  que  agradece   el apoyo  brindado   por  la institución para  la realización de su proyecto.
texts.en: María is a person who is concerned about her family’s wellbeing.  She has gradually been furnishing her house because she likes that when her family visits they feel comfortable.  Because of this she’d like to buy a door for the entrance to the house because the current one is damaged and she comments that when her grandchildren come visit they are in danger of running out into the street and being run over.  For this reason she is grateful for the support provided by the institution to carry out this project.

loans.use: to buy a door.

loans.name: Lissette Noemy

texts.es:
Lisseth, está casada, vive con su esposo y dos hijos, ella tiene una sala D. belleza, inicio hace varios años,  conto con el apoyo D. su esposo, hoy en día su horario D. atención es D. 7:00am a 5:00pm.
Ella necesita invertir en productos D. belleza, para ello solicita un préstamo que le permita incrementar la mercadería, comprara cremas, shampoo, lociones, estos productos los ofrece en la sala D. belleza a los clientes que les presta servicio.
Su aspiración es crecer como microempresaria, incrementar la clientela y el negocio, mejorar las condiciones económicas D. su familia y velar por las necesidades D. sus hijos.
texts.en:
Lisseth is married and lives with her husband and two children.  She owns a beauty salon which she set up several years ago, with her husband's support.  Her business hours are 7.00am to 5.00pm.

Lisseth needs to invest in beauty products and is requesting a loan which will allow her to increase her merchandise, purchasing creams, shampoo and lotions.  She sells these products to the customers that she serves in her beauty salon.

Lisseth's aspirations are to grow as a small businesswoman, increase her number of customers, increase her business, improve her family's financial situation and meet the needs of her children.

loans.use: to buy creams, shampoo and lotions

loans.name: Juan

texts.es:
Juan tiene 53 años de edad, esta casado y vive en casa propia ubicada en una comunidad rural del distrito La Matanza en Morropón. Juan es un hombre que goza de buenas referencias personales y laborales.

Juan se dedica desde hace 10 años a la venta de menestras , a los pobladores de su comunidad y alrededores. La experiencia de Juan ha hecho que este cuente con clientela fidelizada que prefiere sus productos ante otros. 

Juan solicita a Edpyme Alternativa un préstamo de 3000 nuevos soles para invertir en la compra de menestras, frijol, maíz y otros. Esta inversión hará que Juan aumente su clientela y por lo tanto sus ventas.

Él es conocido en su comunidad  y conoce muy bien su mercado. Gracias a su negocio ha podido mejorar su calidad de vida, y espera continuar con ello.

Juan es una persona muy responsable.
texts.en:
Juan, 53, is married and lives in his own house located in a rural community in La Matanza District in Morropón.  Juan is a man who has good personal and work related references.

For the last ten years Juan has been selling vegetables to local and nearby residents.  Juan’s experience has led to his having a well established base of regular customers that prefer his products over others.

Juan is asking Edpyme Alternativa for a 3000 new sol loan to invest in the purchase of vegetables, beans, corn and others.  This investment will lead to Juan’s increasing his clientele and thereby his sales.

He is well known in his community and he is very knowledgeable of his market.  Thanks to his business he’s been able to improve his quality of life and he hopes to continue doing so.  Juan is a very responsible person.

loans.use: to buy vegetables, beans and corn.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy a sack of black-eyed peas, 50 kg of peas, and 20 packets of milk

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy sheep and nutritionally balanced feed.

loans.name: Cipriano

texts.es: El Sr. Cipriano es una persona   responsable  y  muy trabajadora   el  cual   cuenta  con un taller  de carpintería,  el se preocupa  por  ofrecer  el mejor  servicio a sus  clientes , es  por ello que en esta  ocasión requiere realizar  la compra  de  mercancía ya  que   desea   tener   disponible  el  material  para  cuando sus  clientes  le   pidan  algún trabajo  poder   realizarlo  al instante, es  por ello que   ve  en el crédito la posibilidad  obtener  mayores  ingresos y seguir  brindándoles a  sus  clientes  un excelente  servicio.
texts.en: Cipriano is a responsible, very hard working person who has a carpentry shop.  He strives to provide the best service to his customers.  Because of this, on this occasion he’d like to buy merchandise because he wants to have supplies on hand so that when his customers request a job he will be able to do it at once.  He, therefore, sees in the loan the potential to earn higher income and continue offering his customers excellent service.

loans.use: to buy supplies for his carpentry shop.

loans.name: Jose Marcos

texts.es:
José, es agricultor, vive con su esposa y sus hijos, todos se apoyan en la familia, él desde joven se dedica a sembrar maíz y frijol, de esta actividad ha logrado mantener a su familia y sobre todo de la misma producción se han alimentado.
Él está solicitando un préstamo para la compra de insumos y pago de mano de obra, pues dentro de los insumos esta el muy importante abono, que sirve para fortalecer la planta.
Su objetivo es que con su trabajo logre mejorar e incrementar los ingresos cada día, ayudando a su a sus hijos a que cuenten con lo más necesario para subsistir.
texts.en: José is a farmer.  He lives with his wife and children.  The entire family helps each other out.  From a very young age he’s been growing corn and beans.   This activity has made it possible for him to support his family and, more importantly, this same production has fed them.  He is asking for a loan to buy farming supplies and to pay for labor costs because among the supplies is manure which serves to strengthen the plants.  His goal is that his work will lead to improved and increased income every day helping his children to have everything they need to subsist.

loans.use: to buy supplies and pay labor costs.

loans.name: Jenny Ines

texts.es:
Ines tiene 32 años de edad y vive en casa propia con sus dos menores hijos . Ines es una madre trabajadora y sacrificada, con deseos de superación. Ella vive en una comunidad urbana en vías de desarrollo perteneciente al distrito de Chiclayo.

Ines se dedica a la venta de ropa femenina, de manera ambulatoria, desde hace 8 años .  Todos los domingos Ines va al exterior de un mercado popular , ubicado a media hora de su casa, donde realiza la mayor parte de sus ventas y ha podido ganar clientela fija que le compra al contado.

Ines solicita a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 2000 nuevos soles para invertir en su negocio. Ella desea aprovechar el cambio de estación y las fiestas patrias para aumentar sus ventas, con la renovación de prendas. Este crédito le sería de gran utilidad.

Ines es una clienta fidelizada de nuestra entidad y cuenta con un excelente historial crediticio, siempre ha cancelado puntualmente sus pagos.
texts.en:
Inés, 32, lives in her own house with her two minor children.  Inés is a hard working, selfless mother with a strong desire to get ahead.  She lives in an urban, developing community belonging to Chiclayo District.

Inés has been a street vendor of women’s clothing for the last 8 years.  Every Sunday she heads out to the outside of a popular market located half an hour from her house where most of her sales take place.  She’s managed to win over a base of regular customers that pay her cash.

Inés is asking Edpyme Alternativa for a 2000 new sol loan to invest in her business. She wants to take advantage of the change in season and of the national holidays to increase sales and to renew her stock merchandise.  This loan will be of great use to her.

Inés is one of this institution’s most faithful clients and she has an excellent credit history; she’s always repaid her loans punctually.

loans.use: to buy clothes.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy medicine to stock her pharmacy.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy ingredients for healthy breakfasts.

loans.name: Nemecio Manuel

texts.es:
Manuel es un hombre trabajador de 70 años de edad. Él esta casado y tiene un hijo a cargo, vive en casa propia en una pequeña comunidad rural del distrito La Matanza en Morropón.  Es un hombre de buenas referencias personales y laborales.

Manuel se dedica a la producción de frijol de palo, desde hace 15 años. Su gran experiencia ha hecho que Manuel conozca su mercado y que gane clientela fidelizada hacia sus productos. La mayoría de sus clientes son pobladores de su comunidad.

Él solicita a Edpyme Alternativa un préstamo de 3000 nuevos soles para comprar fertilizantes y hacer labores de deshierbo para sus cultivos de frijol de palo. Además, hará mejoras al interior de su casa que le son de suma necesidad.

Este préstamo le será de gran utilidad y permitirá que Manuel continué con el buen desarrollo de su negocio y mejore su calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Manuel is a hard-working 70 year old man.  He is married and has one child under his care.  He lives in his own house in a small rural community in the La Matanza district in Morropón.  He has good personal and work references.

Manuel has been growing pigeon peas for 15 years.  Through this long experience he knows his market, and he gains loyal customers for his products.  Most of his customers are inhabitants of his community.

He is requesting a loan for 3,000 soles from Edpyme Alternativa.  He will use the loan to buy fertilizers and for the work of weeding his pigeon pea crops.  Also, he will make some needed improvements to the interior of his house.  

This loan with be very useful, and it will allow Manuel to continue with the good development of his business and to improve his quality of life.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers, to weed his crops, and to make some needed improvements to the interior of his house.

loans.name: Jesca

texts.en:
Jesca lives in Uganda. She is single and has 3 children, two of whom are in school. Jesca has operated a business selling clothes door-to-door for the past six years, working 7 days every week. Jesca has requested a loan of 300,000 UGX from MCDT SACCO, which she will use to buy more bales of clothes. The main business challenges for Jesca include the ever-increasing prices of clothes and the rainy season. Her goals and hopes for her business are to start importing clothes herself and to get a permanent business premises.

Jesca lives in a home that she rents; she doesn't have access to electricity or to piped water. Her major monthly expenses include rent, school fees and medications.

loans.use: To buy more bales of secondhand clothes

loans.name: Maria Jackeline

texts.es: Maria Jackeline tiene su negocio que es una tienda en donde ofrece una gran variedad de productos, ella es una persona muy inteligente y disfruta de su actividad económica tiene 2 hijos menores de edad a su cargo de 7 y 11 años respectivamente. Uno de sus mayores desafíos han sido la competencia pero ella no se preocupa pues  tiene una gran carisma para ofrecer a sus clientes y esto les atrae. El financiamiento que solicita es para la compra de pantalones, maletas, calzado, cosmético, entre otros.
texts.en: Maria Jackeline has a store where she sells a wide variety of products. She is very intelligent and enjoys her work. She has two young children, 7 and 11 years old. One of her greatest challenges has been her competition, but she doesn't worry about that because she is very charismatic which attracts her customers. This loan is for the purchase of pants, suitcases, shoes, cosmetics and other things.

loans.use: to buy pants, suitcases, shoes, cosmetics and other things.

loans.name: Simona

texts.es:
Simona es una mujer trabajodora de 36 años de edad. Ella es soltera y vive en la parte rural del distrito de Túcume en Lambayeque . Goza de buenas referencias personales.

Simona se dedica a la crianza y venta de cerdos y aves de corral, desde hace 3 años. Esta actividad la desarrolla en corrales espaciosos ubicados en la parte trasera de su domicilio. Simona conoce a la perfección su actividad y cuenta con clientela establecida en la zona. Adicionalmente, Simona se dedica a la costura y este servicio también le da buenas ganancias.

Simona solicita a Edpyme Alternativa un préstamo de 500 nuevos soles para comprar alimento balanceado para el engorde de sus cerdos y aves de corral. Este crédito le permitirá seguir desarrollando su negocio adecuadamente y obtener ganancias que le permitan mejorar su calidad de vida.

Simona es una mujer responsable y con muchos deseos de superación.
texts.en:
Simona is a hardworking 36 year old woman. She is single and lives in the rural part of the district of Túcume in Lambayeque. She has good personal references.

For 3 years, Simona has raised and sold pigs and poultry. She has spacious corrals behind her house. Simona knows her trade very well and has an established clientele in the area. She also sews which also gives her good income.

Simona asks Edpyme Alternativa for a loan of 500 nuevos soles to buy balanced feed to fatten up her pigs and birds. This will allow her to continue carrying out her business and to get profits that will allow her to improve her quality of life.

Simona is a responsible woman with a great desire to better herself.

loans.use: to buy balanced feed.

loans.name: Carmen

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “ILLARY III”; este banco comunal pertenece al Distrito D. Huanchac, provincia D. Cusco y Departamento D. Cusco.

La socia Carmen;  tiene 50 años D. edad y es casada la socia tiene 3 hijos D. 22, 15, 11; la socia se dedica  ala administarcion y atencion D. su tienda D. abarrotes, la soca tambien tiene un garaje que alquila , ella no tiene automovil y este espacio lo alquila a terceros para que D. este modo sea un ingreso extra ara ella, la soica desea invertir el credito en la compra D. mercaderia, ella desea compra al por mayor, arroz, azucar, fideos, harinas, leche en cajas entre otros. La  socia requiweree el prestamo para invertir en la compra D. productos D. primera necesidad como arroz, azucar entre otros.

La socia agradece y valora el prestamo que se le otorgara para poder mejorar sus calidad D. vida y la D. sus familia.
texts.en:
Carmen, 50, is a member of the “Illary III” communal bank that belongs to Huanchac District, Cusco Province and Department.

She is married and has three children who are 22, 15 and 11 years old.  She runs a grocery store and she also has a garage that she leases out.  She does not own a car so she leases the space out to third persons to earn extra income for herself.  

She wants to use the loan to buy merchandise at wholesale: rice, sugar, noodles, flour, boxed milk, etc.  She needs the loan to invest in the purchase of basic need items like rice and sugar, among others.

She is grateful for and values the loan she’ll get to improve her and her family’s quality of life.

loans.use: to buy stock items for her store.

loans.name: Maria Angelica

texts.es:
María, vive con su familia, es madre de dos hijos, se dedica a la crianza de cerdos y venta de ropa, el negocio de ropa lo tiene instalado en el mercado municipal, no tiene horario fijo, pues depende de cómo este la afluencia de clientes, la granja de cerdos la tiene instalada en su casa de habitación.
Actualmente solicita un préstamo para la compra de cerdos y también comprarse ropa para el negocio, invirtiendo en ropa interior, de niños y adultos, esta compra le permitirá ampliarse en los dos negocios, mejorando así su condición de comerciante.  
Ser una mujer con experiencia en negocios, es su objetivo, manejar tanto su granja como el negocio de ropa de una manera excelente, además de tener una vida estable junto a su familia.
texts.en:
María lives with her family; she’s the mother of two children.  She raises pigs and sells clothes.  The clothing sales business is located in the municipal market and she does not have a fixed work schedule because it depends on the number of customers.  She raises pigs at home.

She is currently requesting a loan to buy pigs and also to buy clothes for the business; she will buy underwear for children and adults.  This purchase will allow her to expand in both businesses thus improving her condition as a merchant.

Her objective is to be a woman experienced in business; to manage her farm as well as the clothing business with excellence as well as having a stable life together with her family.

loans.use: to buy pigs and to buy underwear for children and for adults.

loans.name: Rose

texts.en: Rose lives in Uganda. She is married and has three children, two of whom are in school.  She also takes care of additional family members (her old father). Rose has a charcoal stall.  She has been in this business for one year and she works seven days out of every week. Rose sells her products from home, by means of retail. Rose has requested a loan of 300,000 Ugandan shillings from MCDT SACCO to buy more bags of charcoal.  She generates additional income through poultry farming. The main business challenges for Rose include transportation and the rainy season. Her goals and aspirations for her business are to own a delivery van and to sell at wholesale only. Rose lives in a home that she owns. She has access to electricity and to piped water.  Her major monthly expenses include school fees and medication.

loans.use: To buy more bags of charcoal

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy inputs and accessories for making bricks.

loans.name: Gladys María Del Socorro

texts.es:
Durante 25 años Gladys ha vendido comidas rápidas en Girardota, Municipio del departamento de Antioquia, y aunque ha tenido que enfrentar dificultades gracias a la ubicación de su puesto de comidas, es una mujer luchadora que sueña cada día con mejorar su calidad de vida es por esto que trabaja de lunes a sábado con la ilusión de ver crecer su negocio, y en un futuro poder tener su propio restaurante donde pueda generar mas ingreso e igualmente generar empleos. 

Es por tal motivo que Gladys María solicita un préstamo con el cual poco a poco comenzar a construir su sueño, pues sabe que para ir generando mas utilidades deberá aumentar la producción y para ello necesita insumos con el cual preparar los alimentos,  sin embargo hoy no cuenta con ese capital que le ayudará a no solo a mejorar su calidad de vida si no también a dar un paso para cumplir su sueño.
texts.en:
For 25 years, Gladys has sold fast food in Giradota, a town in the department of Antioquia, but she still has faced difficulties due to the location of her stall. She is a hardworking woman who dreams every day of improving her quality of life. She works Monday to Saturday with the purpose of growing her business and in the future being able to have her own restaurant where she can generate more income as well as generating jobs.

For this reason Gladys Maria asks for a loan with which, little by little, she will begin to build her dream. She knows that to increase her profits she will have to increase her production, so she needs ingredients to make food. She doesn't have the capital that will help her not only to improve her quality of life but also take a step towards her dream.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for making food.

loans.name: Flora

texts.es:
Flora tiene 52 años de edad , es una mujer trabajadora y con muchos deseos de superación, madre de 2 hijos. Vive en casa propia en la provincia de Morropón- Piura. Flora tiene muy buenas referencias personales y laborales.

Flora se dedica, desde hace 3 años, a la venta de pequeños platos de comida y chicha de Jora ( bebida fermentada hecha a base de maíz) la cual ella misma prepara.

Flora desea invertir en su negocio para aumentar sus ventas y es por ello que solicita a Edpyme Alternativa un préstamo de 600 nuevos soles, para comprar maíz y los utensilios necesarios para la elaboración de su chicha.

Flora cuenta con clientela establecida y la demanda por sus productos ha aumentado, esta inversión le permitirá aumentar sus ganancias para mejorar su calidad de vida. Ella es una mujer responsable y con  gran experiencia en su negocio.
texts.en:
Flora, 52, is a hardworking woman who has a strong desire to succeed.  She is the mother of 2 children.  She lives in her own home in  Morropón- Piura province.  Flora has very good personal and work references. 

For 3 years, Flora has had a business selling plates of food and chicha de jora (a fermented beverage made from corn) which she makes herself.

Flora wants to invest in her business to increase her sales, and to do this she is requesting a loan from Edpyme Alternativa for 600 Peruvian soles.  She will use the loan proceeds to buy corn and the utensils she needs to make her chicha.

Flora has an established customer base, and the demand for her products has increased.  This investment will allow her to increase her earnings so that she can improve her quality of life.  She is a responsible woman who has a lot of experience with her business.

loans.use: to buy corn and utensils to make chicha

loans.name: Cenaida

texts.es: Cenaida tiene 24 años de edad, separado de su esposo con quien tuvo 2 hijos. Juntos viven en su casa propia ubicada en la localidad de Periavente baja del distrito de Pichari. A ella siempre le ha gustado ser la primera, ya que su éxito esta en las buenas prácticas de manejo agrícola, además toma en cuenta la importancia de la empatía, pues es donde hace sentir su presencia ante sus acopiadores más recurrentes. Es por ello que le resulta gratificante su negocio agrícola, en donde produce y comercializa café, que además de vender a un precio competitivo, tiene mucha demanda obteniendo buenas ganancias. Por lo general trabaja en compañía de su querida madre quien lo apoya siempre, pero en temporada de cosecha tiene que contratar peones para que faciliten el trabajo de extracción de su producto. Normalmente su producto de café los vende en los centros de acopio de su misma comunidad.Este es su primer crédito con MFP por lo que ella se compromete a realizar puntualmente el pago de sus cuotas.Con los 3,000 soles que solicita, contratará peones para que puedan limpiar su parcela.
texts.en:
Cenaida is 24 years old and separated from her husband with whom she had two children.  She lives together with her children in her own home which is located in the village of Periavente, in Pichari district.

Cenaida has always enjoyed being first.  Her success lies in the good farm management practices that she employs.  She also bears in mind the importance of empathy and this is where she makes her presence felt amongst the middlemen she deals with most frequently.  This means that she enjoys her farm work, producing and selling coffee.  As well as selling her produce at a competitive price, Cenaida has a lot of demand and this makes her good profits.  In general she works alongside her dear mother who always supports her.  However, during harvest season she has to hire laborers who make her picking easier.  Normally she sells her coffee to middlemen in her community.

This is Cenaida's first loan from MFP and she pledges to make her repayments on time.  She will use the 3,000 Peruvian soles that she has requested to hire laborers to weed her land.

loans.use: to hire laborers

loans.name: Noemi

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “ILLARY III”; este banco comunal pertenece al Distrito de Huanchac, provincia de Cusco y Departamento de Cusco.
